loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a thirty-two-year-old hardworking married man with two children aged six and two years old, living in Kamwenge Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income as well as riding a motorcycle to earn himself an extra income. He started this business so as to earn a living and improve on his standard of living. He hopes to become rich; however, his main challenge is price fluctuations.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy more items like soap, salt, sugar and others to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, salt, sugar and others to boost his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, salt, sugar, washing soap, and sanitary pads.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
After she received her previous loan from Kiva, Beauty purchased additional equipment to use in her garden. The garden fork, trowels, drum, watering cans, spray, tomato and butternut seeds, and chemicals managed to help increase her production. 

As a result, Beauty’s profits rose from $175 to $450 per month. She was able to both pay the school fees for her 2 children and finish building her house. 

Beauty is very grateful for that loan. However, she still has unused land that she would like to put to use. So now, Beauty hopes to borrow a second loan in order to further expand her business.

loans.use: to increase the land area of vegetable production on her farm.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela’s business of selling vegetables has been doing very well since the time she received the Kiva loan. This loan helped her to purchase products at favourable prices from wholesalers where she buys. This has made her realize increased sales and profits. 

She has managed to develop herself in a number of ways through the profits. She can now pay school fees for her child who is in primary school and pay rental, water, and electricity bills.

However, there are times when the market is flooded with vegetables, which causes her sales to be very low. Due to this, when she gets a second loan, she intends to diversify to poultry, since she has the market for broilers at her nearest secondary school.

loans.use: to increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fabric and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She operates a general store, to make a living. With her previous loan, she bought more products to sell. She repaid that loan, successfully. To offer more goods to her customers, she took a new loan recently.  She is using the new loan to buy rice and livestock-feeding supplies, in addition to her grocery goods.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Deisy Asuncion

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Rio De Oro.
En este lugar vive la señora Deisy, tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera de tres hijos, dos de ellos mayores y uno de 12 años el cual  estudia en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. 
Doña Deisy tiene un negocio con su hijo mayor, se dedican a la venta de arroz por saquillos, ellos se desplazan hasta Charapoto a una apiladora de arroz en la cual compran a menor precio, luego empacan en costales de 10 libras en adelante para después salir a recorrer la ciudad vendiendo y entregando este producto, ella también vende sabanas y ropa de todo tipo, su forma de ventas es puerta  a puerta, con esto ella se gana algo extra que les sirve para salir adelante, llevan más de 6 años dedicada al comercio.
 Este crédito para comprar arroz, ropa y sabanas. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un carro para entregar sus productos.
texts.en:
In the citadel La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, which has been known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos stadium, the members of Rio De Oro Credit Group meet.

This is where Deisy lives. She is a 43 year-old single mother of three children, two of which are older, and the third, who is 12 years old, is still in school. All her children still live at home. 

Deisy has a business with her oldest son selling sacks of rice. They travel to Charapoto to buy rice for cheaper prices from a supplier, repackage it into 10 pound bags, and travel throughout the city to sell and deliver this product. She also sells sheets and various types of clothing from door-to-door. Through this work, Deisy is able to earn a little extra money and help her family progress forward. She has six years of experience in this line of work. This loan will be used to purchase rice, clothing, and sheets. Deisy is grateful to the Credit Group for the assistance these loans provide her business. Her dreams include having a car to deliver her products.

loans.use: to buy rice, clothing, and sheets.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a forty-four-year-old, hardworking, married man. He has six children, and he lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He works in livestock farming as his main source of income. He went into the business, because it was profitable. He also earns extra income from farming and salary.

Stephen hopes to increase the number of cows on his farm. His main challenge is diseases that attack his animals, and they end up dying. He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a forty-year-old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income, which business he started to earn a living. He earns extra income from a hotel.

Bashir hopes to construct a good home. His main challenge is price fluctuations of agricultural products. He is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs like manure and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 56 years old.  She is a widow, with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 5,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, like soap, milk, canned goods, and eggs.

Cerila has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years, and she also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Cerila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like soap, milk, canned goods, and eggs

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen’s grocery business in Lupane, Zimbabwe has been doing well as a result of the Kiva loan. The loan enabled her to order double the quantity that she used to purchase. She used part of the profits to register for her secondary school exams in Mathematics, English and Geography. She also paid fees for her younger sister who is still in primary school. In addition, Queen managed to improve her current standard of living and employ a shop assistant.

The major challenges she has been facing include seasonality of the business since her clients are mostly teachers from the local school who get paid monthly, a lack of electricity, and competition from nearby rival stores. Queen has been able to successfully navigate these challenges and keep her business growing.

Queen recently repaid her $500 Kiva loan. In the future, she would like to get electricity for her shop, and improve her product selection. Her desire is to get a second loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the computer store he owns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice’s business has been doing well since she received her loan. She has been managing to make her loan repayments timely, reinvest in her business and meet the daily financial needs of her family. 

With the additional profits, she also managed to diversify into poultry production. In addition, she has paid for and will be sitting for the November ordinary level. She now has a passport that she paid for using the proceeds from her business.

She is planning to further her education using proceeds from her business. Her desire is to get a second loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia’s business is still running very well since April 2014 when she received her loan from Kiva. Before she received the loan, she used to purchase a few clothes to sell but after receiving the loan she could order the clothes in bulk.

Patricia is now self-reliant and able to cater for her own, immediate and extended family needs without facing too much challenge. She now has peace of mind. She has gained respect from her family members and the community at large since she is now able to contribute meaningfully to economic needs in the family. She managed to fully repay her loan timely and paid for her passport using the proceeds of her business. She is planning to continue with her business and also diversify into uniform making when she gets a second loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets, and shoes for all age groups so that she can increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred used her first loan to order clothes for resale. She ordered a variety of mixed gender clothing and baby diapers. She sells by door to door delivery and sometimes sells goods by order. She has been making a profit of almost $180.00 per month. Previously she was only making $40.00. The increase in income improved her way of living and her status in the community. Her family is now more dependent on her as she is able to support them financially. She dreams of opening a flock of boutiques in the local township so that she can have more returns from her business. A bigger loan will enable her to keep the dream alive.

loans.use: to increase her stock and expand her business and profits

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda changed her business from a grocery shop to buying and selling goats due to competition. She buys and fattens goats and sheep for a month before selling them at a profit in the capital. She sells at least ten goats per trip, which is usually once every three weeks. 

Rhoda managed to buy two cattle that have been put on the fattening program. From the cattle, she is expecting a 100% profit. 

She has used her profits to renovate her house and pay school fees for a vulnerable child at the local school where she does voluntary work. She also bought shoes for each of her family members in a family of eight. Her other profits are going towards her own education and her examination fees. 

Rhoda would like to expand to cattle fattening on a full-time basis. If she gets a bigger loan, she will start the cattle fattening business.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed for her cattle fattening program.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith’s business has been doing quite well. When she got her loan, she used it to restock her shop and add more shelves. 

With the profits she got from the business, she managed to purchase a Freezit (a frozen soda drink)-making machine worth $150, furniture worth $130, and has paid her school fees of $500. She has been able to provide for all her family’s basic needs. 

She hopes to further improve her business if funding permits. She is grateful for the loan that she got from Kiva and hopes to get another, bigger loan.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock in bulk.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old married father of one child.  He has been working in the construction business since 2011, and has 16 years of experience in his business  because he had to quit school during the intermediate stages and start working to support his family.  He used to work with his uncle.

Mohamad is specialized in opening roads, site preparation for building homes, and many other construction site needs. He works hard to develop his business through updating and increasing his machines.  For this reason, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a special lift and station car necessary for his business development and expansion, so that he can move his equipment easily from one project to another without any obstacles.

He hopes to stay capable of developing and improving his business in a well managed way.

loans.use: to buy a special lift and station car necessary for his business development and expansion.

loans.name: María Casilda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Rio De Oro.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, 2mayores de edad y el menor de 17 años la cual estudia en colegio, todos  aun viven con ella. 
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con sus ingresos sacar adelante a su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa interior de damas y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días por semana en horas que sabe que puede encontrar  a sus clientes, también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda,  deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida ella y su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar todo tipo de ropa interior. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para ella. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the citadel La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, which has been known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos stadium, the members of Rio De Oro Credit Group meet.

This is where Maria lives. She is 45 years old, separated from her husband, and has three children from that marriage. Two of her children are older, and the youngest is 17, who is still in school. All three children still live with Maria. 

Maria is a hardworking woman who enjoys supporting herself and her family with her income. She works in commerce, selling women's undergarments door-to-door. She goes out to sell three or four days per week during the hours that she anticipates her clients to be at home. She also sells out of her own home, where her clients can visit whenever they are in need of her services. She sells on a both a cash and credit basis. She has more than four years of experience in this line of work, with which she has earned a living for herself and her family. 

This loan will be for purchasing all types of undergarments to sell. She has undergone 4 loan cycles with the Credit Group, and she appreciates it because her clients are very important to her. Her dreams are to give the very best to her children.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 52 years old and blessed with seven children. To overcome the hardship of living, she sells grocery items, fruits and vegetables within the public market. 

Nena aims to strengthen her business in order to earn a higher income. She is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 12,000.00 to buy more fruits, vegetables and grocery items to resell.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and grocery items to resell

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 46, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. He is a lovely father of two children; one is single and one is married. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, he has been a farmer for almost twenty years.

At this time, his rice is big enough for harvest. To insure the harvesting acceleration, he would have some people assist him in the harvesting process, yet he doesn't have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, he would like to apply for a KIVA loan to pay for hiring laborers. He would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella, a 49-year-old married mother of two, has been farming rice and raising livestock in the Philippines for 25 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Ella is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jemilyn

texts.en:
Jemilyn is 22 years old with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Jemilyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

She aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Luzvizminda

texts.en:
Luzvizminda is 61 years old and widowed with two children.

Luzvizminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Luzvizminda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirty years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Luzvizminda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 44-year-old married mother of three living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She started her shop 10 years ago by raising capital from her salary; she also deals in decorations and at the same time earns a monthly salary.

Lucy used her previous loan to buy more general merchandise such as soap and sugar for her general store. Although faced with the hardship of limited capital, she hopes to expand her business into new areas. Lucy is therefore requesting another loan to buy items such as soap, bread, rice, posho and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap, bread, rice, posho and sugar to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a hardworking single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a bar and at the same time does farming in order to boost his income. He faces challenges of limited capital, but besides that, he hopes to expand his business to new areas. James needs a loan to buy beers, spirits and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, spirits and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 25 years old and married, with one child 

Maimuna deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, beans, and rice, among other items. She hopes to expand her business and become the main supplier of beans in the whole of Hoima. 

She will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith runs a poultry production business in partnership with a local school and teacher. They had reared batches of 100 birds each three times before receiving the loan. Soon after first receiving the loan, Faith purchased her own batch of 100 broiler chicks and feed. She consolidated the profits from the joint business and part of the loan to open a tuck-shop.

Despite the fact that the customers favored barter trade, her business grew and change was noted. She managed to take care of a boy from her community who was not going to school. The boy is now staying at her home and has enrolled in grade five at the local primary school. 

Apart from that, she bought building material for the construction of a two-room house. The material has a total cost of $200, and it includes nine bags of cement, two door frames, 2,000 farm bricks, as well the transport to ferry them, and six window frames. Additionally, she bought herself clothes and shoes.

She is currently facing challenges with the water supply, but she plans to buy a water pump and pipes in order to sustain and expand her poultry business. If she gets a bigger loan, she will use it to purchase chicks, feed, and a water pump.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bulk-buy corn and lime powder

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 60 years old, married, has three children and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm and is doing well, earning a good income for the family. She had sucessfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for fertilization of her farm. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer and planting materials to improve her rice farm. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate her home to provide safe living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and planting materials to improve her rice farm.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 42 years old and has two children. Arlinda is married and both of her children are in school.

Arlinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlinda requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlinda has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Arlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion, a 51-year-old married mother of seven, has been farming rice in the Philippines for nine years and earns additional income raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Salvacion is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Gelina is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Gelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 49 years old and married with four children, all of whom attend school. For the past fifteen years she has worked hard running a sari sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also grows vegetables to sell.

Ofelia has borrowed and successfully repaid nine prior loans through NWTF. She has now applied for a 12,000 PHP loan in order to restock her store. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to restock her sari sari.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell in her business.

Evelina has been in business for 14 years.  She earns addittonal income from fattening pigs, farming vegetables, and direct-selling Avon products.

Evelina has sustained her business through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking, married lady charged with the responsibility of taking care of six children; four attend school. She owns a beauty salon and gets additional income from farming.

She hopes to grow and develop her business and educate her children. She will use the loan money to buy more braids to sell this Christmas.

loans.use: to buy more braids to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Poultry farming is a profitable business venture that can be done on a part time basis to earn you extra income. Meet Emilio, a mixed farmer from Chuka, a rural town in Kenya, who decided to follow that path. He is happily married and blessed with three children. He earns a livelihood selling eggs, milk, and a variety of food crops.

For the past five years that he has been involved in poultry farming, he has found it very fulfilling, and feeding his poultry is his hobby. He sells poultry meat and eggs to his neighbors and to the local market. Because he produces quality meat and eggs, he has seen an influx of customers who want to buy from him. He is overwhelmed with the demand and cannot fully satisfy it. He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry so that he can fully satisfy the demand, and this will immediately translate to more income.

Income from selling eggs and meat will be used to improve his living conditions, cope with rising farm expenses, and secure the future of his school-going children. Other than an increase in profits, he will also make extra cash by selling poultry feathers, which are used in making earrings. He will also benefit from having more poultry manure, which will increase the fertility levels of his farm.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a hardworking married woman with the responsibility of taking care of four children between the ages of 26 and 15, all of whom attend school. She lives in Hoima Uganda, where she has established herself as a poultry keeper, supplemented by income from rent. 

Over the years Harriet has always hoped to be the leading  poultry farmer in her area, but poultry diseases have hindered her progress. She will use this loan to buy more feeds for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy more feeds for her chickens.

loans.name: Johnson's Group

texts.en: Johnson is a fifty-eight year old Komaza tree farmer. He has three children, all of whom are in school. Johnson is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Johnson also cultivates subsistence crops and supports his family with farming. He decided to join Komaza to improve life with money from selling the trees and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees for his children. Johnson’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the training that is offered. In this group's picture, Johnson is the farmer with his hand raised.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines for the treatment of her child.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is 47 years old, married and the mother of two children. They live in their country's Absheron region, but Tarana is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Agdam city. Her mother-in-law helps her educate and take care of her children. A while ago, she and her husband decided to open a store that sells woman's dresses, and she is requesting a loan for 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). Tarana will use this money to buy more clothes to sell, develop her business and increase her monthly income. Tarana is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, and for helping her provide a better future to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, earn more money, and provide a better future to her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 55 years old and a widow with two children, one of whom is in school, Mercedes works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs etc.

Mercedes has been in this business for five years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 60 years old, married and has eight children. 

Anita is in the agricultural business, farming corn and sugarcane in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anita has been farming corn and sugarcane for twenty years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Noemi

texts.en:
Ma. Noemi supports her family through her ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Her daughter, Carla May, is eighteen years old and the elder of the family’s two children. Carla May is working towards a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and is currently in her first year of this four-year course of study.

Ma. Noemi is a member of NWTF and is borrowing 6,200 PHP to pay for tuition fees for her daughter’s second semester of the school year 2014-2015. Carla May looks forward to graduating and being gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter's studies in secondary education.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 36 years old, married and has one child in school. For the past two years she has been growing sugarcane to sell in the Philippines.

Melba has taken out and successfully repaid five prior loans through NWTF to use on her farm. She has now applied for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She hopes to save enough money to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her sugarcane fields.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Adoracion is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adoracion has been farming rice for 30 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking mother of two children and one attends school. She owns a retail shop mainly selling soap, sugar, and plastic dishes among other items and gets additional income from owning a motorcycle used for transporting people. She desires to develop and expand her business so as to pay school fees for her child. She will use the loan to buy more plastic dishes like cups and plates to sell.

loans.use: to buy more plastic dishes like cups and plates to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Elizaydy is 17 years old and is 4th of four children in the family. His mother Epifania, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Elizaydy is studying for his Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in his first year of this 4-year course.

Epifania is borrowing PHP 6,200 to pay the tuition fees of her son Elizaydy for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When he graduates, Elizaydy plans to find a job so he can help his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 44-year-old married woman with six children. She used her previous loan to buy sugar, soap, and beans to sell. She deals in produce and also owns a salon. Her main challenge is limited capital. However, she hopes to expand her business to new areas in order to serve more customers and earn greater profits. She is requesting a new loan to buy cassava to mill and sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava to mill and sell.

loans.name: Lyngie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lyngie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Lyngie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as rice, sugar, soap, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lyngie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as rice, sugar, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and married with eleven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan and will use the new one to further build her business so she can achieve her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celfred Miles is 21 years old and is fifth, of the seven children in his family. His mother, Celia, is a member of NWTF. She supports the family through her food-vending business, in the Philippines.

Celfred Miles is studying toward a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science. Currently, he is in his fourth of this four-year course. Celia is borrowing PHP 6,650 to pay the tuition fees of her son, Celfred Miles, for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015. Celfred Miles plans to graduate and to be employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees related to her son's bachelor degree in Computer Science

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is 33 years old and married with three children. For the past nine years she has run a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income through her motorcycle transport business.

Mercelita has borrowed and successfully repaid eight prior loans through NWTF. She has now applied for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock such as coffee, soap and milk for her store. She is working hard to build her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as coffee, soap and milk for her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 59-year-old married mother of five children, all of whom are in school. She has been raising livestock in the Philippines for 10 years, and earns additional income farming vegetables.

Mary is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 46 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lilibeth has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Stewart

texts.en: Stewart. age 46, is a hardworking father of two children who lives in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of beans and rice. He dreams of expanding and diversifying his business more to include farming to make ends meet. He will use the loan facility to buy coffee to  sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Agriculture is the best employment, because nobody can sack you. You can start from any level and there are so many forms of farming you can do. Dancan is a father of one and has been practicing mixed farming in Riabai, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. For the past seven years he has been selling milk, eggs, maize and has some personal business he has been doing to supplement the meager income he earns.

If there is one thing Dancan is good at, it is raising farm animals! “Mercy”, his dairy cow, is very well taken care of. She gets the best feed and medical care Dancan can provide. However, his biggest challenge is raising capital. 

Dancan has a sound investment plan that will push him to the next level. He is seeking a loan through Kiva to purchase a water tank. Constant availability of water at his homestead will make work very easy for him. His farm animals and poultry will have a constant flow of drinking water, his family will have water for domestic use at the doorstep, and the crops on the farm will grow green and healthy through irrigation. 

Dancan wants to harvest rain water that always goes to waste and store it in the water tank for future use. With your contribution, Dancan will seek to increase the number of animals on his farm because his animals will no longer have the challenge of no drinking water. This loan will improve his living conditions and he will secure the future of his child.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is 44 years old and he lives with his pretty wife and beloved children in Kadjaran city of Syunik region. For many years now Tigran has worked at the Kapan combine as a trruck driver. At the same time he established his own business: he bought a garage and he offers car washing services there. His business is new, but as he says the number of his customers increases more by more, day by day. Tigran’s son greatly helps him in his business. Tigran’s elder daughter is unemployed and the smallest daughter is still school-aged. 

Tigran asks for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams in order to repair the garage where he runs his business, in order to make it cuter and more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair the garage where he runs his business, in order to make it cuter and more comfortable.

loans.name: Generita

texts.en: Generita is 56 years old, married and the mother of four children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy more livestock to raise. She has been in this line of work for 25 years and also earns additional income by farming rice. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé de quatre  femmes mariées uniquement  dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi-Flabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles, chaussures plastiques et charbon du bois. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des ustensiles de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 pièces d’ustensiles en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Banconi-Flabougou à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma Group comprises four women who are all married and living in monogamous households. On average, they are 40 years old and have four children. They all live in Banconi-Flabougou, an area of Bamako, and know each other through being neighbours.

The group members run small businesses selling cooking equipment, plastic shoes and charcoal. In order to gain cash to replenish their stock, the women have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their third loan cycle.

Fatoumata (pictured sitting on the far left) is renowned for the high-quality cooking equipment she sells. She will use her loan to buy 50 items of equipment in bulk in Bamako. She resells her goods in Banconi-Flabougou to a mainly female clientele.

With this loan, Fatoumata hopes to make 60,000 CFA francs per month on average, which she will reinvest in her business. Her ambition  is to buy a plot of residential land through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her business with new products such as soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Jekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Jekadi  sont mariées uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi-Flabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Banconi-Flabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, mèches de très bonnes qualités, pagnes wax et draps. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami   (femme  assise  à l’extrême  gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de mèches et de chaussures en plastiques (pour hommes et femmes). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paquets de mèches  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait à Banconi-Flabougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ami   espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women in the Jekadi Group are all married and living in monogamous households. On average, they are 32 years old and have three children. They all live in Banconi-Flabougou, a neighbourhood in Bamako, and know each other through their businesses and being neighbours.

The group members run small businesses selling high-quality hair extensions, traditional wax cloth pagnes and sheets.

In order to obtain cash to restock, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their third loan.

Ami (pictured sitting on the far left) enjoys a good reputation for the hair extensions and plastic shoes she sells (for men and women). She will use her loan to buy ten packets of hair extensions in bulk in Bamako. She sells her hair extensions in Banconi-Flabougou to a mainly female clientele.

With this loan, Ami hopes to make 50,000 CFA francs per month on average, which she will use to reinvest in her business and pay for her children's healthcare.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rose is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rose has been farming rice  for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He does farming, growing crops like maize and beans. He built rental houses alongside farming so that he can obtain income from them to boost his family's well-being. He wishes to expand and modernize his farm. He is challenged by weather variations and price fluctuations.

He wants a loan to weed his garden.

loans.use: to weed his garden

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase an additional stock of vegetables to sell, for her greengrocery business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and married, with one child in school. Irene works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Irene has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening. Irene aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en: Sos lives in the village of Getishen in the Syunik region. He and his wife live alone since their children are grown, already married and live with their families. Sos was employed for many years as a welder, and now works at a private company as a sentry-operator and is also busy with farming and agriculture. On his farm he has 30 chickens, which allows him to sell a lot of eggs.  He also has nice, big orchard full of apple, peach, plum, cherry and nuts trees. And he grows potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes. He sells all his farm products at the city’s wholesale market, largely to re-sellers. With his income, Sos manages to support his children’s families. But now he is experiencing some financial hardships and faces a very important problem that needs to be urgently solved. He is requesting this loan so his wife can have a medical examination which will find out why she feels weak and unhealthy. Sos is worried very much and will be very thankful for help from lenders so she can have the exam.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical examination.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fence his farm land

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Junito Juntie lll is 24 years old, and he is the fifth of the six children in his family. His mother Teresita, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Junito Juntie lll is studying for a bachelor of science in criminology.  He is currently in his fourth year of this four-year course.

Teresita is borrowing PHP 9,500 to pay tuition fees for Junito Juntie III for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

When he graduates, Junito Juntie lll hopes to be gainfully employed so he can help improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 30-year-old, hardworking and honest married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a very ambitious man who is involved in a number of businesses, which include motorcycle transport, selling bananas, and he also does subsistence farming. Price fluctuation and limited capital affect the business, while his dream is to buy another motorcycle for the transport business. Stephen intends to use the loan to buy cement, iron sheets, and bricks for completion of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron sheets, and bricks for completion of his house.

loans.name: Hemeniana

texts.en:
Hemeniana is 55 years old and married with ten children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Hemeniana requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Hemeniana has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He grows maize as his major crop, and does cattle farming. He sells milk to add to his income generation. He started the business to earn a living, and wishes to educate his offspring. To develop and modernize his farm is his major dream, though weather variations affect him.

He wants a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy pestcides and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a male, married with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. David owns a motorcycle garage, which has helped him to buy land using the proceeds. David began the business in order to look after his family. 

David has a dream of expanding his business, and being the best mechanic in the area. However, he is faced with a challenge of limited capital. 

David is hardworking man who wants money to buy motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sindiya  est majoritairement composé de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan II l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, mèches de toutes sortes, encens, céréales et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou   (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des mèches de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 paquets de mèches à Bamako. La  revente s’effectue en détails à Badialan II à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kadiatou   espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de maintenir cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir beaucoup plus d’argent.
texts.en:
The group called Sindiya  is mostly composed of polygamous women. They have on average 36 years of age and three children. They all live in Badialan II, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako and met through being neighbors. The members of the group make small-scale sales of all sorts of hair extensions, incense, cereals, and clothing. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and they are on their first solidarity loan. 

Madame Kadiatou (the woman seated at the far right in the photo) is very well-known for selling all sorts of hair extensions. She intends to use her loan to buy 30 packets of extensions in Bamako. Her sales are made retail, in Badialan II, to a clientele mostly composed of women. Madame Kadiatou hopes to use this loan to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in  her activity. Her goal is to maintain this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso so that she will have a lot more money.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions

loans.name: Chole Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Chole est majoritairement composé de  femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan II l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) des modèles différentes, des tubercules, des condiments et du miel. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Comba   (femme assise en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) des modèles différentes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 18 pièces de  pagnes wax en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Badialan II à une clientèle mixte. Madame Comba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter son volume de commerce dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Chole group is composed mainly of polygamous women who average 35 years of age and three children. They all live in Badialan II, a district of Bamako, and they know one another as neighbors. Their small trade activities include clothing (wax pagnes) in different styles, tubers, condiments and honey.   

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan cycle.
Mrs. Comba (sitting 3rd from the right in the group photo) is a leading reseller of clothing (wax pagnes). She will use her loan to buy 18 units of wax pagnes wholesale in Bamako. She retails her stock in Badialan II to a mixed clientele. 

With this loan, Mrs. Comba expects to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity. 

With the help of Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to bolster her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old and married with five children. For the past twelve years she has worked hard running a sari sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Betty has borrowed and successfully repaid 21 prior loans through NWTF. She has now applied for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy more stock to sell in her general store. Her aims are to build her business further and save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari sari.

loans.name: Rrok

texts.en:
Rrok is literally poor; he wants to start up a pig farm and to repair a collapsed stable, and he needs your help. Rrok is a 46-year-old villager and a married father of three. The oldest is 20 and the youngest is 13, with one of them, a daughter, being mentally challenged and suffering from some disease. Sadly, this daughter was fine up until she was five years old, when she drank some poison that was intended for trees that her neighbors had left near their fence. 

Agricultural has been his activity from the get go. He has some land where he plants cabbage, leeks, and spinach. In addition to this, he has rented about 10,000 meters of land from some villagers where he mostly plants corn. Rrok sells cabbage and corn to whole buyers. Poultry is something that he likes as well, and he has chickens and ducks and sells eggs and little ones. His wife works for other villagers in their lands.

loans.use: to start up a pig farm and to repair a collapsed animal stable.

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua is a 66-year-old hardworking woman, married to Daniel who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with six children.  Wayua has been operating a construction business by making bricks for a period of five years, earning herself an income of KES 4,000 at the end of every month.

Wayua was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 5,000 with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the entire amount to make additional bricks to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Wayua plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To make additional bricks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and has two children. With two children currently in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, diapers, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, diapers, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, diapers, detergent soap, shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
Bebita is forty years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are in school.

For the past two years Bebita has been farming sugarcane. She has taken out and successfully repaid four previous loans through NWTF and is now applying for a 11,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies for use on her fields.

Bebita is working to save enough money to enlarge her farm and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her sugarcane fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of skirts, jackets, shorts, pants, dresses, and shoes.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lucila works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry. Lucila is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing nets and bamboo for her fishing business.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing nets and bamboo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry business

loans.name: Aidin

texts.en:
Aidin is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics. Here is his story:

“I knew that AUCA’s tuition fee is so high, but I also knew about the Financial Aid of AUCA and Kiva loan for their students. As I have taken English and math classes at Continuing Education Center of AUCA, I am familiar with its teaching methods and quality of education. The flexibility, the modern approach, the quality of the education can compete with leading universities of the West. These reasons urged me on entering AUCA.

I live with my grandmother, as my mother works in another city, where she can earn much money than here. My grandmother is a pensioner, so both of us depend on my mother’s salary. My mother is doing her best to save money for my tuition, but upset that she can’t pay it by herself. I thank Kiva lenders for their attention and kindly ask to help me.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Senhora Felismina é casada e tem 54 anos de idade, tem 6 filhos maiores de idade que já não estão na sua responsabilidade, trabalha como médica tradicional, vive em casa própria.
O montante financiado sera aplicado na compra de cimento, varroes, pedra para dar continuidade a construção do murro de dependências.
Para o futuro espera construir mais dependências para o arrendamento de modo a aumentar a renda da casa.
O seu desafio é de ultrapassar as dificuldades financeiras, trabalhando mais e investindo mais em casas para o arrendamento.
texts.en:
Felismina is a 54 year old married lady with 6 grown-up children for which she is no longer financially responsible. She works as a traditional healer and lives in her own home.
With the loan provided to her she plans to buy cement, rods and stone to continue building the walls of her outbuildings. In the future she hopes to build more outbuildings to rent out so that she can increase the income that she brings home. Her greatest challenge has been overcoming her financial difficulties through working more and investing in more houses to rent.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods and stone to continue building the walls of her outbuildings

loans.name: Valeria Nicole

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señorita Valeria, tiene 20 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho para sus actividades.
Doña Valeria es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y con sus ingresos ayudarles a sus padres que son de escasos recursos, ella trabaja de secretaria para un medico y también se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos y días libres y también vende en su  lugar de trabajo,  deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su calidad de vida cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Alfa y Omega [Alpha and Omega] group meet in the area known as Estancia Vieja in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. It is a place of humble people who work in farming and commerce in general.

Valeria lives in this place. She is 20 years old. She is single and lives in her parents' house. She has been with the group for three cycles and she likes it because the loans have helped her very much with her work.

Valeria is a woman who is very much a fighter. She likes being self-sufficient in order to move ahead and to help her parents, who have few resources, with her income. She works as a secretary for a physician and is also in business. She sells all kinds of clothing and her method of selling is door-to-door. She goes out in her free time and days off and also sells at her place of work. She leaves her merchandise on credit and collects every week.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, and blouses, among other clothing items. Her dream is to continue improving her quality of life every day.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and blouses, among other clothing items

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 23 years old with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Catherine has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Catherine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Helcunida

texts.en:
Helcunida is 53 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Helcunida has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 34 years. 

Helcunida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Helcunida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is a young woman, 29 years old, from a small village in Chaladidi, Khobi district. She has a 12-member family, and they don't have any significant income for existence. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category and lives under poverty. The family members get social assistance from the local government. Apart of this, they have a small agricultural activity.  Particularly, they own a milk cow, and pigs, and they sell cheese and grown pigs at the local market. 

Teona has a great desire to do her bit for her family's welfare, and to somehow increase the income. To realize her plans she requires financial support and has obtained credit to local financial institutions. Teona requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision for business start-ups and restart-up credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, and lack of access to credit products. 

With the received credit, she will start trading in seasonal fruits and vegetables. Her husband will also help her. They will purchase fruits and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices, and sell them in nearby towns with a price markup. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start a trading business with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Fatima is 45 years old and has children who are in school.

Fatima has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Fatima requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Fatima has been in this business for three years. In the future, Fatima would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a 39-year-old married female with 3 children. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

She decided to start teaching 14 years back so as to earn income for the family. She dreams of educating her children to University level. 

Due to delayed salary payments, she has decided to take a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a married male with two children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He grows maize as a major crop. 

He opened up a barber shop to generate more income. He dreams of expanding his farm and constructing a house for his family. Rajab is a hardworking man who needs a loan to meet his dream of constructing a house for his family.

loans.use: to construct a house for his family.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married, with five children, and she lives in Masindi, Uganda. She sells general merchandise to generate income for her family and to sustain herself. 

Margret needs a loan to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell this festive season.   Her business faces the challenge of competition and, like other retailers, the general price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell this festive season

loans.name: Nohlahla

texts.en: Nohlahla saw her Kiva loan as an opportunity to expand her poultry business. With half the Kiva loan she managed to purchase 50 broiler chicks, chick feed and chemicals. Before she received the loan, she had been rearing batches of 25 Rhode Island chickens per cycle. Unfortunately, her business suffered a huge setback when heavy rains destroyed her fowl run. To avoid further setbacks, she has been keeping the chickens she bought with the rest of the loan in one of the rooms in her house which has very little carrying capacity. With some of the proceeds, Nohlahla decided to diversify her business and begin selling groceries. Aside from heavy rains, other challenges Nohlahla has faced include newcastle disease, which affects poultry, a high transport costs due to a poor road network and irregular currency exchange rates. Overall, the business has been going well for Nohlahla and she is getting profits ranging from $100-$150 from both her poultry business and her grocery business. With her profits, Nohlahla is completing her secondary education. She is currently a certified early child development teacher as well. After her business has stabilized she would love to pursue a teacher training course. She also hopes to get a second loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chick feed and increase poultry production

loans.name: Nomatter

texts.en:
When Nomatter received her first Kiva loan, she used it to boost her business by buying commodities to sell in her grocery shop. 

Nomatter has since managed to earn a profit of at least $80 per month after the sale of her products. This loan has helped improve her life, and she is now able to look after her parents and her younger brothers. 

Nomatter says she is happy and grateful for the loan she received from Kiva. Nomatter wishes to go to college, and the profits from her business will help her do so.

Nomatter now wishes to borrow a second loan.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks and feed.

loans.name: Favour's Group

texts.en:
Favour is 32 years old single lady; she completed her tertiary education 3 years ago but have since been unsuccessful in finding a job. Her father who is a member of Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society recommended her to join the cooperative. With no entrepreneurial skill from the university makes it harder to survive. In 2014, Nke-Anyi FMCS training committee listed her among participants of 2014 Nke-Anyi marketing seminar for entrepreneurs. 

During the 4 days of intensive workshops, Favour was able to acquire basic skills on purchasing processed palm oil product and how to profitably market it. After then she volunteered for one month working with Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society member’s product marketing committee, a unit of the cooperative that helps to sale rural dwellers product in the premium market. 

All this prepared Favour for a start. This is a new product the cooperative is initiating, a package geared towards supporting aged cooperative members children who are graduates and unemployed. Favour and 4 others are the first beneficiaries. 

This is going to be her first loan with the cooperative and she will be assigned to work with an experienced member in the field of product purchasing and marketing.
Favour is excited with this initiative and hopes that this loan will give her a hope of starting a new life and also help her to meet up with her daily needs and that of supporting her aged parents.  

She and her group member thanks all Kiva lenders that supports this loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and resell it through marketing operations.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 43 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Margie has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Bernadita works hard to support her family.

She has a variety store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and pig fattening. Bernadita is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to purchase more items like decorations, school supplies, clothing and snack foods for her variety store business.

Bernadita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like decorations, school supplies, clothing and snack foods.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 35 years old and married with two children, who are both in school.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Conchita has borrowed and paid back ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Conchita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: St Mathias Development Group

texts.en:
Betty lives in Masindi, Uganda. She does tailoring and sells clothes. She started the business to support her family needs. She wishes to educate her children to University but price fluctuations and inadequate capital affect her expected output. 

She wants a loan to buy material and cloth to sew and sell.

She is a member of St Mathias Development Group where members provide guarantees to each other to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy material and cloth to sew and sell.

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
This is Prena, a 56-year-old widowed mother with one of her sons, Mark who is 34 and mentally challenged. At the age of 9, he was accidentally electrocuted and lost one of his hands. Unfortunately, Prena has another son who is also mentally challenged.  

Here is what Prena said during her interview: “It has been very difficult for me especially when my husband passed away. I had to deal with all these things - the grief, providing care for our sons and providing food for all of us. I cried every minute and there are still times when I get very emotional,” she said, wiping away tears.  Prena has two other sons, with one of them living in Greece. 

Prena needs your compassion and your financial help to take her challenged sons for medical visits and she is almost begging you.

loans.use: to take her mentally challenged sons to a medical specialist.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Eunice, who is the group leader, pictured above. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Eunice has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Eunice isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming trainings. This year, Eunice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, because now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Eunice's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль 48 лет, замужем, есть дочь, образование- средне-специальное. Уже 10 лет она ведет свое хозяйство, также предоставляет швейные услуги. Стартовав в 2002 году, благодаря упорному труду Айгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 бычка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма и сена для скота. Доходы от бизнеса Айгуль планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Aigul is 48 years old, married, and has a daughter. She has a specialized secondary education. For ten years, she has been running her own homestead, and also offering sewing services. Having begun in 2002, Aigul through hard work now has on her homestead three steers. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Aigul applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase feed and hay for the livestock.

Aigul plans to invest profits from the business in further propagating the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy hay and feed for her livestock in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A sra Ana tem 42 anos de idade, solteira, mae de dois filhos que frequentam a escola. Sustenta ainda uma sobrinha.
Com este credito,  pretende comprar  material de construção (cimento, varroes, banheiras, lavatório e tijoleiras) para usar na construção da sua casa.
O seu maior sonho é de aumentar e terminar a sua casa e comprar mobiliário para melhorar as condições de habitação  e concluir os estudos no ensino superior onde ela frequenta.
 Seu desafio é de pagar o seu empréstimo dentro do periodo pré-estabelecido de forma a pedir outro, Bem como abrir um estaleiro de venda de material de construção e ter uma escolinha de culinária.
texts.en:
Ana is a 42 year old single mother of two, both of whom attend school. She is also responsible for caring for her niece. She intends to use this loan to buy building materials (cement, rods, sinks, a toilet and bricks) to use in the construction of her home. Her biggest dream is to finish building her home and to buy furniture to improve her living conditions, she also hopes to finish her course at the college that she currently attends.
Her challenge will be to repay her loan within the specified period so that she can apply for another. She also dreams of opening a builders yard and running a small cookery school.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, rods, sinks, toilet and bricks) to build her  home

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
