Saodat is an experienced dressmaker from Isfara. She is 54 years old, married and has adult children. Her husband is a disabled-pensioner. One son is engaged in the purchase and sale of fuel. 

Saodat has conducted her tailoring activity for over 15 years. She sews women's, men's and children's clothing for sale. Her daughter-in-law helps her in this activity. Prices of her goods are low and her clients are happy to buy her stitched clothes.

Now Saodat would like to purchase a computerized sewing machine and fabrics with a loan amount. This way she intends to expand her business and increase the budget of the family. She relies on your support.

loans.use: To purchase a computerized sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Kankelefo Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre (4) femmes, les membres du groupe Kankelefo sont toutes  mariés majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Bamako-Coura à Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente des chaussures en plastic, du fonio précuit et de la farine de mil. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  3ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Aby (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de riz,  2 sacs de fonio et 4 sacs de mil. Elles s’approvisionnent en céréales à Médine.   La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Aby compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kankelefo group are married women who live in polygamous households. They average 43 years of age and three children. They all live in Bamako-Coura, a district of Bamako, and they know one another as neighbors, though ties of kinship and through their income-generating activities. Their commercial activities include the sale of plastic shoes, cooked fonio, and millet flour.   

To build their inventory, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 3rd group loan cycle.

Mrs. Aby (sitting at the far left in the group photo) is a leading restaurant worker. She will use her loan to buy 5 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of fonio and 4 sacks of millet. She buys her cereals in Médine, and she sells to a clientele consisting mainly of women, cash or credit, sometimes on order. 

With this loan, Mrs. Aby expects to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which she will use to provide for her children’s healthcare.  

With the help of Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to bolster her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora  María, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 8 y 6  años  de edad, todos  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda. Ella le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende frutas y legumbres desde hace varios años, ella lleva 4 Años con esta actividad la cual les sirve ya que los gastos son muchos con la crianza de sus tres hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, otras prendas, frutas y legumbres. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the credit group 'Alfa y Omega' meet up every fortnight in the area known as 'Estancia Vieja' in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo. The people who live here are humble and work in agriculture and trade in general.

This is where Maria lives. She is 28, married, and has three children from this relationship who are 11, 8 and 6. They are all at school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Doña María is a very determined woman who likes to manage by herself to get ahead and help her husband with the household costs using her income. She sells clothing of all types, both door-to-door and from her home, where her customers come when they need a garment.

She will give part of the loan to her husband who for many years has had a market stall selling fruit and vegetables. Maria has had her job for four years which has helped them with the expenses of raising their three children. 

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, other garments, fruits and vegetables. Maria has happily been with the credit group for four years and used one of these loans to start her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, other garments, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba was born in 1991 year. She lives with her family, in the capital of Tajikistan. Nasiba has her own business. She has been busy with buying and selling women's clothes in a local market, for five years. She buys in bulk, goods from China and Turkey, and she sells them in a local market. Her mother helps her with managing the business.

Nasiba is going to buy goods from China for the new winter season. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes from China, for the new winter season.

loans.name: Ma.arlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma.Arlita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ma.Arlita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF. She is using the loan to buy additional fishing net, for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 57 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Leonida has a business, buying and selling fruits and vegetables, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money in order to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru:
Фаррух житель сельской местности, женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Фаррух как и многие жители сельских местностей занимается разведением и откормом скота. Сам Фаррух вырос в малоимущей семье, его родителям приходилось работать целыми днями на поле чтобы прокормить семью. Фаррух не смог получить достойного образования из за финансовых проблем в семье. Окончив школу Фаррух уехал на заработки в Россию и заработав деньги приехал домой и купил несколько голов скота, и начал их откармливать для дальнейшей продажи. Таким образом он смог увеличить поголовье своего скота и получать больше прибыли. Фаррух хочет дать возможность своим детям получить достойное образование. Чтобы не мучились  в жизни как их родители. 
На данный момент у Фарруха проблемы с финансами из за упадка цен на скот. Фаррух решил обратиться с этой проблемой в "АРВАНД" и взять кредит. На деньги которые он получит Фаррух хочет купить корм для скота. Фаррух заранее благодарен организации за предоставленную помощь сельским жителям.
texts.en:
Farruh lives in a rural area. He is married and has one child. Like many rural residents, Farruh works with breeding and fattening cattle. He grew up in a poor family, where his parents worked in the field all day in order to feed the family. Farruh was not able to get a decent education due to the family's financial problems. 

After having finished school, Farruh went to Russia as a migrant worker. When he had earned some money he went home and purchased some livestock, and started to breed them for reselling. This way he was able to increase the number of livestock and get a larger income. 

Farruh would like to give his children the possibility to get a decent education, so they will not suffer in life, like their parents. Currently Farruh has financial problems due to the decline in livestock prices. He decided to turn to "Arvand" with this problem, and take a loan. For the money he receives, Farruh would like to purchase livestock fodder. He thanks the organization in advance for providing assistance to rural residents.

loans.use: to purchase livestock fodder

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This nice and charming lady’s name in Mariam and she lives in Vnadzor city of Lori region. 

Mariam is 29 years old.  She is married and she has a small daughter. Mariam graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute from the faculty of Teaching in Elementary Classes and Methodology. Now she works at the school as an elementary class teacher. After her work at the school she also helps some pupils with their lessons and explains the themes which they did not manage to understand during the lesson to them.She is very clever pedagogue and greatly beloved by her pupils.

Mariam asks for this loan in order to buy a computer and some professional methodological literature, since she wants to be aware of any new information in the pedagogical sphere.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional methodological literature.

loans.name: Maria Loudilo

texts.en:
Maria Loudilo is 39 years old and a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Maria Loudilo has a general store business in the Philippines. Maria Loudilo requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like sardines, vegetables and other items to sell.

Maria Loudilo has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maria Loudilo would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like sardines, vegetables and other items to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 59 years old and married with six children. Clarita works very hard to provide for them.

Clarita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Clarita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, diaper and other groceries. 

In the future Clarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en: Ndue has his own welding shop. To get more jobs in the nearby areas he needed a car, so he bought one. However, he doesn't have a driving license; thus, the loan he is requesting this time is to pay for getting the license.

loans.use: to get a driving license so he can do his welding activities.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is aged 40; she is the mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a general store for many years near his house and the business is operating very well. 

Previously, he used to sell bakery items in large quantities but according to the customer’s demand he wants to offer rice, sugar, flour etc. He does not want to refuse a request for any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable as part of a daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. 

Therefore, Amina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son could buy sacks of rice, sugar and flour for his general store. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her son will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. Amina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her son's general store business.

loans.name: Nagima

texts.en:
Nagima is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is her story:

“I live with my family in Kara-Balta. There are five of us and my grandmother also lives in our house. My father is the only breadwinner in our big family, as my grandmother can’t walk and my mother takes care of her. Other siblings study at school. 

I am the eldest one and want to be a good model for my siblings. I want to get a Bachelor’s Degree in IBL at AUCA. Why AUCA?  I would like to highlight the deep academic knowledge that AUCA provides to its students. I am strongly convinced that the personal motivation of a student and drive is one of the main elements of successful education. I feel responsibility for my Kiva loan and will try to gladden Kiva lenders with the good academic news in future.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, beams, two machines for making building blocks, a hand wagon, a 50m hose and two shovels

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Заррина 26 летняя жительница не большого района Яван. Яван очень красивое место, тихое и спокойное. Природа этого места отличается от других мест Республики. У жителей Явана имеется свой акцент, по которым из отличают. Заррина живет и выросла в Яване. У нее большая семья. Заррина замужем и имеет ребенка. Ее дочка учиться на первом классе средней школы. Муж Заррины находиться на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
   Заррина около 5 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она на дому принимает клиентов. Также она 4 года уже работает в колхозе. Она всегда радуется как ребенок когда они получают хороший урожай. Данный момент время для посева Нового урожая и Заррина надеется получить кредит и купить качественные минеральные удобрения, высоко сортные семена и горючего для трактора, так как ее средств не хватает для данной покупки. Заррина оптимист и уверена, что ей помогут и к весне она будет получит хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Zarrina is a 26-year-old resident of the small region Yavan. Yavan is a very beautiful place, quiet and calm. The nature of this place is different from other places in the Republic. The residents of Yavan have their own accent which is notable. Zarrina lives and grew up in Yavan. She has a large family. Zarrina is married and has one child. Her daughter is in the first year of middle school. Zarrina's husband is working abroad in the Russian Federation.

Zarrina for about five years has been engaged in sewing women's clothing on order. She accepts customers at her home. Also, she has been working at a collective farm for four years. She is always happy as a child when they get a good harvest. It is now the time for sowing the new crop and Zarrina hopes to receive a loan and to purchase quality mineral fertilizer, a high grade of seeds, and fuel for the tractor, since her resources are insufficient for these purchases.

Zarrina is an optimist and is confident that she will be helped and in the spring she will have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy quality mineral fertilizer, a high grade of seeds and fuel for a tractor.

loans.name: Nekruz

texts.en:
Nekruz is a smart young man. He is not married and lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. 

Nekruz is a student of the third course. He studies at the National University of Tajikistan. Nekruz studies Law. He wants to be a good specialist after graduating university. Nekruz studies well. He is one of the best students. 

He must pay for his tuition but has not got enough money. He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
Akmaljon was born in 1970. He is divorced and has 3 children. His children are 4, 17 and 19 years old. Akmaljon has worked in a primary organization for more than 6 years. He is a highly educated man and does his job well. 

Akmaljon wants to help his children to get a higher education. Now, his son is a student in his first course and he must pay for his tuition. Akmaljon is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to pay for his son's tuition. 

He awaits your mercy. He dreams of seeing his son in a good specialty in future.

loans.use: to pay for his son's  tuition.

loans.name: Gonzalo Eudaldo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca.
En este lugar vive don Gonzalo, tiene 55 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 16 y 13  años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposa es comerciante. 
El señor Gonzalo  es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto  a su familia, el se dedica a realizar trabajos de jardinería, tiene contratos con instituciones ya sea privadas o del gobierno a quienes mes a mes les realiza el mantenimiento de sus jardines, lleva más de 40 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual el saca a su familia adelante a base de trabajo duro y honesto.
Este crédito es para comprar una maquina podadora de césped la cual le hace mucha falta para realizar una mejor labor. Lleva 6 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The loan group "Caminantes de Cristo" meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the sector known as Las Piedras. The place is known because is is very close to some rock quarries.

Don Gonzalo lives in this place. He is 55 years old and maintains a free-union relationship from which he has three children, ages 17, 16, and 13. The two younger ones are in school. His wife is in business.

Señor Gonzalo is a man who likes to work to get ahead together with his family. He does gardening work. He has contracts with institutions, both private and government, whose gardens he maintains month by month. He has been doing this work for more than 40 years, and with it he has raised his family on the basis of hard and honest work.

This loan is to buy a lawnmower that he very much needs to complete a bigger job. He has been in the loan group for 6 years, and he likes it for the help that they have given him with the loans. His dreams are to give the best to his family.

loans.use: to buy a lawnmower

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es:
José Ines tiene 54 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge; tiene una nieta a su cargo de 3 años de edad; vive en armonía y respeto a su comunidad, vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería; comunidad conformada por siete familias, él vive en casa propia de material rustico un piso, es natural del Caserío Andamarca y cónyuge es de caserío Las Juntas donde actualmente radican. Ellos viven en la parte urbana del Caserío Las Juntas, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza José Ines es la siembra del cultivo de cafeto, variedad catimor de tres años de edad, tiene 2 has de terreno agricola las cuales esta con cultivo de café; actividad realiza desde hace 20 años, anteriormente a cultivado variedad nacional; su predio se ubica en el Caserío Las Juntas del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, su producto lo vende en distrito Santo Tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente cultiva piña de la variedad Portuguesa, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, producto vende en distrito Santo Tomas los dias domingos a pobladores de la zona. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 2 has de café variedad catimor de tres años de edad; con ello obtendrá una mayor y mejor producción y por ende mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Ines is 54 years old. He has a stable home with his wife; he has a 3-year-old granddaughter in his care. He lives with his community in harmony and respect. He lives in a small community basically dedicated to farming and ranching, a community made up of seven families. He lives in his own one-story house made of rustic materials. He is a native of Andamarca village and his wife is from Las Juntas village, where they currently live. They live in the built-up part of Las Juntas village, and their house has water service. The community is located in the Santo Tomás district in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

José grows coffee trees of the catimor variety that are 3 years old. He has 2 hectares of farmland on which coffee is being grown. He has done this work for 20 years. Previously he grew the national variety. His piece of land is located in Las Juntas village in the Santo Tomás district in Cutervo, and he sells his produce in the district of Santo Tomás to area buyers. Additionally, he grows Portuguese-variety pineapples. He has a lot of experience in this line of work, and sells his produce in the district of Santo Tomás on Sundays to people who live in the area. The loan will be used to maintain 2 hectares of 3-year-old catimor coffee; with it, he will have more and better production, and therefore better income in order to thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain 2 hectares of 3-year-old catimor variety coffee

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of feed for her pigs.

Susan has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

Rosalie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for her fishing business, like nets, bamboo, etc.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to use in fishing, like nets, bamboo, and others

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rufina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  Rufina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Rufina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is forty two years and divorced with five children. She lives in Kasese Uganda. Jane used her previous loan to buy cassava flour which has helped her increase her profit levels. 

Jane is faced with a challenge of market competition and limited Capital. She wants to borrow money to buy more cassava flour to sell.  

Jane has a dream of educating her children in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to resell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 47 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Nilda works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, shampoo, diapers, spices, and other groceries.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.ru: Абдуллочон житель сельской местности, женат и имеет 3 детей. Абдуллочон родился и вырос в селе и так,как родители Абдуллочона были малоимущими он не получил полного образования. Абдуллочон ездил на заработки в Россию и накопив деньги решил заняться животноводством. В начале он купил пару баранов и начал откармливать, откормив он продал их и купил пять голов молодых ягнят. Сейчас у Абдуллочона двадцать голов баранов но из за упадка цен на скот бизнес Абдуллочона переживает не лучшие времена. Абдуллочон решил обратится за помощью в "АРВАНД" так, как Арванд предоставляет  кредит на животноводческую деятельность.Он очень обрадовался. На полученные деньги Абдуллочон хочет запастись кормом для скота на всю зиму. Абдуллочон заранее благодарен организации "АРВАНД" за помощь малоимущим сельским жителям.
texts.en:
Abdullojon lives in a rural area. He is married and has three children. Abdullojon was born and grew up in a village, and as his parents were poor, he was not able to get a full education. 

Abdullojon went to Russia as a migrant worker and after having saved up money, he decided to work with livestock breeding. In the beginning, he purchased two rams and started breeding them. After having fattened them, he sold them and purchased five young lambs. 

Currently Abdullojon has twenty rams, however due to the fall in livestock prices, he is going through hard times. He decided to turn to "Arvand" for help, as "Arvand" offers loans to livestock breeding businesses. He was very delighted by this. For the money received, Abdullojon would like to stock up livestock fodder for the whole winter. He thanks "Arvand" in advance for the help to a poor rural family.

loans.use: to buy livestock fodder

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали молодой мужчина в возрасте 29 лет. Шерали женат и имеет на иждивении 2 детей. Он живет в сельской местности и занимается мелкой розничной торговлей в магазине, который находиться рядом с его домом. Родители Шерали занимаются земледелием и выращивают зерновые культуры. Сам Шерали с детства помогал родителям на поле и получить достойное образование он не смог так как у родителей не было возможности дать ему образование. Сейчас Шерали сам занялся бизнесом и поднакопив денег решил построить себе дом, так как в семье у них 3 сына и он как старший должен выехать из родительского дома. Шерали смог построить дом но у него не хватило денег на установку окон и дверей. На полученный кредит он хочет купить окна и двери. С данной проблемой он обратился в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой чтобы закончить строительство до наступления холодов. Шерали заранее благодарен организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку сельских жителей.
texts.en:
Sherali is a young man of 29. Sherali is married and has two dependent children. He lives in the countryside and is engaged in petty retail in a shop which is located near his home. Sherali's parents are involved in agriculture and they grow cereals. Sherali himself since childhood has helped his parents in the field and he was not able to get a sufficient education since his parents did not have the opportunity to give him an education.

Now Sherali has gone into business and having saved money decided to build himself a home, since his family has three sons and he as the eldest must leave the parental home. Sherali will be able to build a home but he does not have enough money to install windows and doors. With the loan amount, he wants to purchase windows and doors. With this problem, he applied to Arvand for support in order to finish the construction before the approaching cold. Sherali thanks Arvand organization in advance for the financial support of rural residents.

loans.use: to purchase and install windows and doors.

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru: Мамуржону 43 года. Он целеустремленный трудолюбивый мужчина. У него большая  дружная семья в которой все стараются поддержать друг друга. Как глава семьи Мамуржон старается сделать все  для того чтобы его семья не нуждалась ни в чем. Его можно назвать мастером на все руки , так как являясь мастером по ремонту жилья он еше разбирается во всех тонкостях строительного дела.   Сейчас Мамуржон  подготавливает свой дом к зимним холодам  утепляя дом. Его умения в строительстве и ремонте жилья  ему конечно же сэкономили немало средств так, как ему не надо нанимать мастеров  он сам может сделать всю работу. Но тем не менее для приобретения необходимых  недостающих материалов ему не хватает денежных средств. При помощи «Арванд» он реализует свой план и закончит работы по утеплению дома.
texts.en:
Mamurjon is 43 years old. He is a purposeful and hardworking man. He has a large, friendly family, where everyone tries to support each other. As the head of the family, Mamurjon strives to do everything in order for his family to not be in need of anything. You can call him a jack of all trades; as he is a master carpenter, he understands all the intricacies of construction. 

Currently, Mamurjon is preparing his house for the winter cold by insulating the house. His knowledge of construction and renovation of houses certainly saves money as he does not have to hire carpenters; he can do all the work himself. However, he still does not have enough money to purchase the necessary materials that he is lacking. Through the help of "Arvand", he will realize his plan and finish the work of insulating his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to insulate his house

loans.name: Fredrick's Group

texts.en:
Fredrick's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. The group is being represented here by Fredrick, who is the group leader pictured. He is 62 years old, is married, and has four children. Fredrick has been a farmer for 16 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Fredrick isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year, Fredrick will get not only fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but he will purchase a solar light, too. He is very excited about this addition, because now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to study by.

Using this loan, Fredrick's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the maize harvest.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru: Гулсуной настоящий эталон женщины таджички-дехканки. Она проживает на районе Яван. Гулсуной замужем и вырастила двоих сыновей. Ее дети на заработках в России. Ее муж работает охранником в фирме по производства окон. Она много лет работала в госструктуре. Все свободное время Гулсуной с мужем проводят на земле. Их предки занимались земледелием, и они тоже будут работать на земле. Недавно Гулсуной приобрела еще несколько соток земли. Землю, которую она приобрела, была в не лучшем состоянии и совершенно не пригодна для посева урожая. Гулсуной очистила землю, привела в порядок и собирается посадить овощи. Сейчас на земле растет зелень, такие как укроп, петрушка и кинза. 2 недели назад часть урожая фасоли Гулсуной потеряла, из-за резкого похолодания. Сейчас она просит кредит, чтобы очистить оставшуюся часть земли, купить качественные семена и минеральные удобрения
texts.en:
Gulsunoy is a real example of a Tajik farmer woman. She resides in the Yavan region. Gulsunoy is married and raised two sons. Her children are working aborad in Russia. Her husband works as a security guard in a company that produces windows. For many years, she works in the state structure. In all of their free time, Gulsunoy and her busband work the land. Their ancestors were farmers, and they too will work the land. Not long ago, Gulsunoy acquired several more acres of land. The land that she acquired is not in good condition and is absolutely not suitable for growing crops. Gulsunoy cleared the land, put it in order, and intends to plant vegetables. Now growing on the land are herbs such as dill, parsley, and cilantro. Two weeks ago part of Gulsunoy's bean crop was lost due to the early cold.

Now she is requesting a loan, in order to clear the remaining part of the land and to purchase quality seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Fátima Narciza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca.
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de ellos ya  son mayores de edad, la menor tiene 14 años y estudia en colegio, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Fátima y su marido son los encargados del bar de un colegio de la localidad, ella en su casa prepara los alimentos que su esposo vende en su bar, ella prepara alimentos nutritivos y saludables ya que son para niños, allí venden hamburguesas, empanadas, corviches, arroz con pollo, jugos y batidos de frutas, siempre varían el menú para que los pequeños no se cansen de los mismos alimentos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local en otro lugar.
texts.en:
The communal bank Caminantes de Cristo meets biweekly in the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the neighborhood known as Las Piedras. This place is well-known for being near some stone quarries.

This is where Fátima lives. She is 58 years old, married, and has three children from this relationship. Two of them are adults, while the youngest is fourteen and is in school. Two of the children still live at home.

Fátima and her husband are the managers of a local school cafeteria. She prepares the food at home for her husband to sell at the cafeteria. She makes nutritious and healthy meals, because they are for children. They sell hamburgers, empanadas, stuffed plantain fritters, rice with chicken, fruit juice and smoothies. They are always changing the menu so that the little ones don't get tired of the same meals.

She will use this loan to buy ingredients to prepare the food. She has been with her communal bank since its beginning and appreciates the help provided by these loans. Her dream is to open a restaurant in a different place.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Francisco Cornelio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca.
En este lugar vive don Francisco, tiene 56 años de edad, está divorciado y de esta relación tuvieron 4 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. 
El señor Francisco se dedica a la agricultura, en la época invernal siembra maíz, maní y verduras, para eso solicito este crédito pues ya se acerca la época invernal y necesita del crédito una parte para arreglar los terrenos en los cuales espera sembrar y también para comprar unos chanchos pues quiere empezar con la cría de estos animalitos ya que tiene espacio suficiente cerca de su casa, con esto espera ganar más ingresos que le sirvan para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para pagar la mano de obra en los sembríos y para comprar dos chanchos.  Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos el sale adelante. Sus sueños es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Caminantes de Cristo loan group meets every fifteen days outside Portoviejo, in the area known as Las Piedras. This place is known because it is very close to a stone quarry. Don Francisco lives in this place. He is 56 years old, he is divorced, and they had four children from this marriage. All the kids are independent adults.

Francisco is a farmer. In the winter, he plants corn, peanuts, and vegetables. He is requesting the loan because wintertime is coming, and he needs the loan to get the land ready, so he can cultivate it, and also he wants to buy pigs, because he wants to start raising these animals. He has the necessary space next to his house.

He hopes he can get a better income to get ahead. He is going to use the loan to pay for the labor needed in the fields, and to buy two pigs.

He is been part of this group loan for 4 years, and he likes it, because thanks to the loans he can get ahead. 
His dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Ndoc

texts.en: This is Ndoc and his wife, Lule (or Flower, in English). They are parents of two children, 23 and 21 years old. Their children are working as a waiter and a ticket agent, at the moment. They have a grocery store built in their yard, and they want to stock up on inventory items. Your loan will help them achieve this goal. In addition to this store, they own some agricultural land where they have planted orange trees and grapevines, and they sell oranges and grapes to wholesale buyers. Prior to opening up his store Ndoc worked as an accountant in the army, yet he was let go due to the change in the government.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for the grocery store that he and his wife have in their yard.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 30 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Элмиры - высшее образование, в данное время занимается сельских хозяйством. В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы и теленок. Ежемесячный доход Элмиры составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. Также она мечтает купить автомобиль для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Elmira is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Elmira has higher education. Currently she works with agriculture. At her farm, she has three cows and one calf. The monthly income is around 12,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Elmira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase heifers. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also dreams of purchasing a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase heifers in order to grow her business

loans.name: Zheenaim

texts.ru: Жээнаим, 53 года, в разводе, детей нет. У Жээнаим высшее образование, она работает в больнице. Также много лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Жээнаим на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец и 7 коз. Ежемесячная прибыль Жээнаим составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Жээнаим планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также хочет купить мебель для дома.
texts.en:
Zheenaim is 53 years old and divorced. She does not have children. Zheenaim has higher education. She works at a hospital. She has also worked with livestock breeding for many years. Thanks to her persistent work, she currently has two cows, ten sheep and seven goats on her farm. Her monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Zheenaim turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business. She would also like to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to increase their headcount

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Lilibeth is a native from Concepcion, Ilo-ilo. She earns a living by fishing. She catches and sells fish to the local people in the community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years. She is married and has three children, ages 20, 18 and 15 years.

Due to the scarcity of capital to finance her fishing business, Lilibeth has requested a loan of 20,000 to buy an engine for the motorboat and four bundles of fishing net. She is hoping that these materials will be of great help, especially in augmenting her income. Thus, she could continue sending her children to school and also provide better living conditions.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to expand her current business, for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the motorboat and four bundles of fishing net

loans.name: María Filerma

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Caminantes de Cristo se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña María  se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Ella hace poco y con la ayuda del crédito que recibió de la institución emprendió un negocio en las afueras de su casa donde vende frutas y legumbres, lleva poco tiempo con este negocio pero le está dejando muy buenos ingresos que le ayudan a cubrir muchos gastos de su hogar.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cosméticos, frutas y legumbres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando sus negocios.
texts.en:
The loan group "Caminantes de Cristo" meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the sector known as Las Piedras. This place is known because it is very close to some rock quarries.

Señora Maria lives in this place. She is 54 years old. She is married, and from this relationship they have three adult children. Two of them still live in their house. Her husband works in agriculture.

Doña Maria works in commerce. She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). Her form of sales is door to door. A little while ago, and with the help of the loan that she received from the institution, she began a business outside her house where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has only had this business for a short time, but it is giving her very good income that helps her to cover many of the expenses of their household.

She is going to use this loan to buy cosmetics, fruits, and vegetables. She has been in the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because of the help that they have given her to get ahead. Her dreams are to continue improving her businesses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo owns and operates a transport service. This is how he earns a living for over four years now and he supports his family's daily needs with this income.

Recently, Ronaldo took out a new loan to buy new spare parts for repair and maintenance. 

In the future, Ronaldo hopes to renovate his house for a safer and more comfortable living of his family.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts for repair and maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snack foods, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Emma Consuelo

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Rio De Oro.
En este lugar vive la señora Emma, tiene 55 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, todos mayores de edad, con ella vive una hija.
Doña Emma es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante sola, se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad, parte de este crédito ella espera utilizarlo para realizar ciertos arreglos en su casa, quiere pintar su casa para tener un mejor ambiente. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y pintura para los arreglos en su hogar. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the ladies who compose the Río de Oro Credit group meet in the La California Citadel in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the “Royal Tamarind Trees.” 

Señora Emma lives here.  She is 55 years old, and she is divorced.  She has four children from her marriage, all of whom are now grown.  One of her children, a daughter, lives with her.

Doña Emma is a woman with a fighting spirit, who likes being able to stand on her own two feet; and to get ahead, she sells clothing of all types.  She sells door to door, and she also sells out of her home, which her customers come to when they need an item of clothing.  She sells on credit to her customers and collects every week.  She has been doing this work for more than 15 years.

She hopes to use part of this loan to make certain repairs in her house, such as painting it in order to have better surroundings.  This loan is for the purchase of pants, shirts, blouses, and paint for fixing up her home.

She has been in the credit group from the beginning, and she likes it because she funded her business with one of the loans. Her dream is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, and paint for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree in Accounting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep to increase business, to make a better future for his newborn baby.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim is a 33-year-old man. He has a lovely family. Vadim has a wife and two daughters. 

His wife is a housewife and helps Vadim in his business. His elder daughter goes to sixth class in school, and his little daughter is going to second class in school. The family members are IDP (Internally Dsplaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in the Fuzuli region. 

Vadim has been in the animal breeding business for 5 years. He buys little calves, raising them and then selling them in the bazaar to earn money. Winter is coming and he wants to vaccinate his animals. Therefore he has requested a loan in the amount of 1300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

Vadim is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for this help. In the future, he wants to start to produce dairy products and sell them.

loans.use: to vaccinate his animals

loans.name: Afat

texts.en:
Afat is married and has two children. She has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from her native land for over 22 years and she now lives with her lovely family in the Fuzuli region. Her children go to secondary school. 

Afat has a small store where she sells different fruits and vegetables. Her husband actively helps her with her business. Afat needs a loan of 2,300 AZN to buy different fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, apples, bananas, onions, greens, etc.) to sell. Afat says thanks to the Kiva organization for all its support and for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, to increase her monthly income and to make house repairs in the future

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, esta esforzándose por poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y seres queridos. Comenta que su anterior préstamo le ha sido muy útil, ya que gracias a el pudo invertirlo en su microemprendimiento.
Nelson tiene un bus, el cual también explota, y que le genera un ingreso para ayudar a su familia, pide este préstamo para poder comprar repuestos para su bus.
texts.en: Nelson is a hardworking person and a fighter.  He is striving to be able to get ahead, and help his family and loved ones.  He says that his first loan has been very useful, because thanks to it he was able to invest in his micro business.  Nelson has a bus that he drives, which generates an income to help his family.  He is requesting this loan to purchase spare parts for his bus.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: 24 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El comité 24 de junio está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas mantienen una actividad propia, emprendidas por ellas mismas, trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
 Son mujeres emprendedoras de entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Gilda, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, lo cual es la costura varia, tiene muchos clientes quienes le hacen muchos pedidos. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo, cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en: The “24 de Junio” communal bank is in its first cycle of the program.  It is a group of women entrepreneurs where all maintain their own activity, undertaken themselves, and they work and help each other get ahead.  Gilda stands out among the women entrepreneurs.  She is very good at what she does, which is varied sewing.  She has many customers who place numerous orders.  She is requesting this loan to purchase fabric and thread, which will enable her to continue her work, and fulfill her customers’ needs..

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora, de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella se dedica a la comercialización de todo tipo de productos, los principales son: cortinas, y sábanas confeccionadas por ella misma.
Comenta que tiene su propio taller de costura, es una persona muy trabajadora, gracias a su esfuerzo  puede darle una vida digna a sus hijos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas para la confección de más sábanas y cortinas debido a que tiene muchos pedidos que cubrir.
texts.en:
Maria comes from a humble and hard-working family in the city of Carapegua. She sells all kinds of products, but mostly curtains and sheets that she makes herself. She states that she has her own sewing shop.

She is a very hard worker and thanks to her efforts she is able to provide her children with a decent life. She is asking for this loan so she can buy fabrics to make more sheets and curtains because she has many orders to fulfill.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make sheets and curtains.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Virgen del Pilar son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes.
La Sra. Teresa es una de las integrantes, una mujer que se destaca por sus ganas de superación y de mejorar su vida, ella pide este préstamo para que con ello pueda comprar insumos para seguir con su trabajo de cocinera, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás.
Todas agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The members of the group Virgen del Pilar are very united and  support each other. They work together on the activities and feel satisfied with the support received from the women committee program so that they can increase their income and be more independent. 
Mrs. Teresa is one of the members and distinguishes herself by the desire to excel and improve her life.  She's requesting this loan to buy materials and ingredients to continue her work as a cook, including vegetables, meats, seasoning, among other things.  
All the women are grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meats, seasonings and other cooking materials.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a 38-year-old married mother of three children. She started eight years ago working as a tailor to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Georgina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying a new tailoring machine which will facilitate her work and provide her customers with better and quicker service.

Georgina hopes to further expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Villa 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Villa 23 de octubre  esta en su Tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que les permitirá ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de ellas es la señora Juana, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que a través de un poco mas de esfuerzo irá mejorando. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, es una señora muy buena en lo que hace, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
The group known as Villa 23 de Octubre is in its third cycle in the women's committee program. All the members have promised to work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Elimination of Poverty Survey which will allow them to continue to improve their living conditions. 

One of the members is Juana. Her poverty level was shown to be level 1 in the survey, which means that with some extra effort she can improve. She sells meals that she makes herself every day starting very early in the morning. She is very good at what she does and that is why it is going so well for her. She is asking for this loan so she can buy a variety of ingredients for making her meals, such as greens, condiments, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy greens, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients to make meals for sale.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 32-year-old, married mother of two children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, three years ago she started selling clothes from her house to help in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Hiba is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes for the upcoming Christmas. Hiba hopes to expand her business more in the future, to increase her income, and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre (4) femmes, les membres du groupe Kayira sont équitablement  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Bamako-coura à Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, condiments (tomates, piments, aubergines, choux…). Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  3ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente condiments (tomates, piments, aubergines, choux…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de tomates, 3 sacs d’aubergines, 2sacs de piments et 3 sacs de choux. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments à Médine.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame  Aminata  compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel  moyen de 60 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The KAYIRA group is made up of four (4) married women, half of whom are living in monogamous families, the other two in polygamous families. On average, they are 35 years old with five children each. They all live in the Bamako-coura neighborhood of Bamako. They know one another through family and neighborhood ties, and also through their income-generating activities. They sell food products (tomatoes, peppers, eggplants, cabbage...). Eager to build their stocks of merchandise for resale, they have decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their third cycle of solidarity loan.

The group's featured borrower, Aminata (seated at the far left in the photo) is well-respected as a seller of food products (tomatoes, peppers, eggplants, cabbage...). She is planning to use her loan to buy five baskets of tomatoes, three bags of eggplants, two bags of peppers and three bags of cabbage. She buys her goods in Medine. She resells her goods mostly to women who pay her in cash or on credit. She works as an itinerant seller and sometimes takes orders. Thanks to this loan, Aminata is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs, which will be used to send her children to school and to take care of their health needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, su granja la tiene ubicada en su lugar de residencia, el joven vive en casa propia con su familia, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de cerdos tiernos y concentrado para seguir con la crianza de cerdos ya que le ha ido muy bien en su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young man, age 22, has his face pixelated because he lives in a high-risk area. He has been raising and selling pigs for three years. His farm is located at his place of residence. The borrower lives in his own home along with his family.

He is requesting a new loan so that he can buy piglets and concentrated feed. As a result, he can continue raising pigs. He is doing very well in this line of work, so he and his family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy piglets and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Catalina Silvia

texts.es: Catalina de 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, ella es empleada de una empresa privada con lo que gana de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos en el lugar que muestra la fotografía para sus dos hijas mayores, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos, etc. y pago de mano de obra para que ella y sus hijos puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Catalina is  a 47 year old single mother who lives in her own house with her 5 children. She is an employee in a private company and through this she makes enough from her work to pay some of the household expenses. She wants to improve her house building some rooms in the place indicated in the photo for her two oldest daughters. What she earns does not cover the cost so for that reason she is requesting a loan. She will use it to buy cement, sand, re-bar, bricks etc. and to pay for labor so that she and her children can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, re-bar, bricks, etc. and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es: Jose de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra mas mariscos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: José, 30, lives in his own home with his mother.  He has been engaged in selling seafood for fifteen years.  He has many customers due to his good prices.  The customer is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale seafood to be able to continue with his sales and thus, have better income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale seafood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been blurred since she is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area, has made a living in the sale of personal products for various years. Her business is located in her residence. She lives in her own house with her life partner.

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc., all on wholesale. This way, she will be able to continue her work and to have greater income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc. all on wholesale.

loans.name: Kholiskhon

texts.en:
Kholiskhon is married and has three children. Her husband is a builder. Some years ago, he returned from Russia.

Kholiskhon is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry five years ago. She is developing the business little by little, and her husband helps her to make it.

Kholiskhon is the main breadwinner of the family, as her husband has a small income. She must buy coal and wood to keep her house warm in the winter season, but she does not have money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy coal and wood.

She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan, since it will be used to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood for the winter season.

loans.name: Basby

texts.en:
Basby was born in 1971 year. She is a married mother of three children. Basby’s husband is an auto-mechanic. They work hard to earn their living. Basby is a seamstress. She sews a variety of clothes. She sews both national women's dresses and men's suits and trousers. She has worked in this field more than 20 years and has great experience.

Basby is going to increase her working capital and, in this way, improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en:
Dildora, 23 years old, lives in a small village in north Tajikistan with her husband and her 2-year-old child. The family's main source of income is from agricultural activities. Dildora has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 5 years. She feeds milk cows and sells milk and milk products to local people. Her husband works in a refueling job but it is all hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

Dildora is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy coal to keep her house warm in the winter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy coal for the winter season

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with seven children, four of whom attend school. She is also looking after her brother.

She has been operating a retail shop for the last 17 years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more stock of rice, sugar, dry beans, and cooking fat for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to start operating a mobile money joint. She joined MCDT because of the school fees loans.

She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, soap, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of three children; all of whom attend school. They live in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. Other than her children, she is not looking after any other family members.

Stella has been running a retail shop as her only source of income in last ten years; working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to restock her shop with more sugar, flour, soda, flour, soap, and dairy products for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and thievery. 

Her dream is to own a big shop on her own land, operating both retail and wholesale. She also would like to open a mobile money business. 
The weekly repayment program attracted her to join MCDT.

loans.use: to restock her shop withflour, sugar, soda, milk, and soap

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. She rents a house with her husband, accessing electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has been operating a retail shop for basic commodities in a rented premises for ten years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more crates of soda, sacks of sugar, cooking oil, flour, soap and beans. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her dream is to build rental houses. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, crates of soda, flour, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are attending school. Margaret does not look after any other family members. She has a business selling cereals and has been selling ground nuts in a shop at retail for the last twenty years, working seven days a week. Margaret also sells clothes to supplement her income.
Margaret has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more ground nuts for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and price fluctuations. Margaret's dream is to build her own work premises. She joined MCDT because of the low interest on loans and the saving products. Margaret resides in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of ground nuts.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is co-habiting and has four children, all of whom are attending school. She is also looking after two cousins. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has been selling green bananas, vegetables, yams and charcoal in the retail market for the last eight years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas, vegetables, yams and charcoal to sell. Her challenges include seasonality, thieves, bad debtors and transportation. 

Her dream is to bypass the middlemen by collecting the food and charcoal from the villages herself. She joined MCDT because of their interest in serving the low income earners.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas, vegetables, yams and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She is also looking after two of her sisters. She has been selling clothes at retail from door-to-door for fifteen years, working six days a week. She also earns money from a motorcycle she hires out to the public.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT- SACCO to be able to stock more skirts, blouses and dresses to sell.  Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to become an importer of both new and secondhand clothes. She joined MCDT because of the loans at relatively low interest and no assets for collateral. Her goal is to buy a plot of land. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity, but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and fees.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom are attending school. She is also looking after other members of her family (3 orphans).

She has been selling fruits at retail in the market for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She owns a motorcycle that she hires out to the public to earn more income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,900,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more watermelons, big and small yellow bananas, tomatoes, pineapples, apples, passion fruit, oranges, and sugar cane to sell. 

Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to buy land for growing some of these fruits and to procure a van she can use to supply fruits to big supermarkets.  She joined MCDT because of the school fees loan product.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, watermelons, big and small yellow bananas, apples, passion fruit, and sugar cane.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children, one of whom is attending school. She is also looking after her mother.
She has been operating a food stall and selling chips from home for the last two years, working seven days a week. She generates additional income from operating a pub.

She has requested for a loan of UgShs 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking cassava. Her challenges include collecting payment from debtors and thieves. Her dream is to become a supplier of beer, wines, and spirits. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans.

She resides in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 4 children that all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity.

Mary operates a retail shop in a shop site that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, beans, cooking oil and flour. 

Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and buy a van to transport her merchandise. She would also like to buy a fridge to keep her drinks cold. 

Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, flour, soap, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es:
El socio Uriel se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artefactos, el socio vende refrigeradoras, televisores y equipos de sonido. el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de artefactos. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar televisores y refrigeradoras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Uriel continues his business of selling appliances. He sells refrigerators, televisions, and sound equipment. Uriel wants to get ahead in his business. He dreams of expanding his business of selling appliances. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in order to buy televisions and refrigerators.

Uriel is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy televisions and refrigerators to sell.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a 53-year-old woman married to Leonard who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children. Serah has been an agricultural farmer for a period of five years, earning herself an income of KES 6,000 at the end of every month.

Serah was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm plantation.

Serah plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Vinh has a service business shipping goods. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 49 years old, and she is married with four children. Vinh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, to build a toilet.

In the future, Vinh hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchace brick, sand, and cement, to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany is a forty-year-old merchant residing in Concepcion, Ilo-ilo. She is running a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities such as coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, soap, seasonings, and soft drinks. She has been engaged in this kind of business for ten years. Aside from operating a store, she goes fishing. She sells fish to augment her income. She is married and has three children, ages 14, 12, and 10. Her husband is a fisherman.

Lany has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy assorted goods for the store, and also fishing net. This will help Lany improve her daily catch and fill her store with a variety of stock. Eventually, this will create higher earnings and provide her children with good food and quality education.

Lany dreams of maximizing all these materials for the recovery of her livelihood and also for the welfare of the whole family in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for the store, and also fishing net.

loans.name: Mơ

texts.en:
Mơ has a service business shipping goods. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Mơ is 53 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Mơ faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Mơ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Mơ hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and sand to build a toilet.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is 31 years old, single, and a hardworking lady who has been in the quarry mining business for the last six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 48,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 		
She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy the modern equipment for quarry work.                                                                                           

Everlyn will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and open another business.

loans.use: to buy modern equipment for quarry work

loans.name: Mercedes Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Rio De Oro.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. El marido trabaja en una empresa local. 
Doña Mercedes es una joven madre y esposa que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto  a su familia, ella en sociedad con su suegra tienen un local en la casa de su suegra donde venden productos de plástico, en su local sus clientes encuentran sillas, mesas, reposteros, canastas, jarras, vasos y muchos otros productos, son muchas las personas que llegan hasta este local el cual está muy bien surtido y venden a precios muy cómodos, llevan 3 años en este negocio con el cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar sillas, mesas, reposteros, canastas, jarras, vasos y muchos otros productos que venden. Lleva 3 ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia pues viven con su suegra.
texts.en:
The members of the credit group 'Rio De Oro' meet every fortnight in the La California area of Portoviejo, the captial of Manabí known for many years as "the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees".

This is where Mercedes, 21, lives. She is in a common-law marriage and has a 3-year-old son from this relationship. Her husband works for a local business. 

Doña Mercedes is a young wife and mother who likes to work in order to move forward together with her family.
