She and her mother-in-law have a shop in her mother-in-law's house in which they sell plastic products. In this shop her customers find chairs, tables, shelving units, baskets, jugs, tumblers and many other products. Many people come to this shop which is well-stocked and offers very good prices. They have had this business for 3 years and they are doing well with it. 

This loan will be used to buy chairs, tables, shelving units, baskets, jugs, tumblers and many other products for sale. She has been through 3 loan cycles with the credit group and she likes it because the loans that they give her are helpful. Her dream is to have her own house because at the moment she and her family live with her mother-in-law.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, shelving units, baskets, jugs, tumblers and other plastic products

loans.name: Gueybi Alexandra

texts.es:
Gueybi Alexandra tiene 41 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente. Tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz). Gueybi Alexandra vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires en el caserío Pedregal. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y a la agricultura siendo su principal cultivo el platano. Y está ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Gueybi Alexandra es la venta de chicha en su casa, además de la crianza de animales menores(patos, cuyes,etc.). Su esposo se dedica a la comercialización de platano. El crédito será destinado para mejoras en su casa pues desea arreglar el techo ya que se viene la temporada de lluvias y ella desea asegurar su vivienda. El credito les permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida ya que será invertido en su casa.
texts.en:
Gueybi Alexandra is 41 years old and in a common-law relationship. She has her own home, which receives public services such as water and electricity. Gueybi Alexandra lives in the village of Pedregal in the District of Buenos Aires. The residents of this small community raise cattle, engage in trade, and grow crops, primarily bananas. This area is located in Morropón Province, which is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Gueybi Alexandra sells “chicha” (a traditional beverage made from corn) from her home. She also raises small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, and other livestock. Her husband sells bananas. The loan she is receiving will be used for improvements to her house. Gueybi Alexandra wants to repair the roof since the rainy season is approaching. For this reason, she wants to make sure that her house is secure. By investing the loan in her house, she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Neiser Ronald

texts.es:
Neiser Ronald tiene 30 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado se su cónyuge y dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico un piso, vive en caserío hace 6 años y cónyuge es nacida en caserío el roble; donde actualmente radican; vive en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte urbana del caserío el roble Distrito de Santo Tomas ; vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza Neiser Ronald es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor, plantación tiene tres años de edad ya que en la zona todos tienen plantación nuevas; café de Neiser Ronald esta en primer año de producción y para 2015 estará en segundo año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio 3 has donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 03 años en caserío el roble Distrito santo tomas, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en distrito santo tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente Neiser Ronald se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno contando a la fecha con 6 reses de su propiedad; también cultiva productos de pan llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío el roble distrito santo tomas. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 2 has. de café en producción, con ello asegurará mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Neiser Ronald, 30, shares a stable home with his spouse and two children, ages seven and four.  He lives in his own one-story house made of rustic materials.   He has lived in the village for six years, and his spouse is a native of El Roble village where they currently reside.  He lives in harmony with his family and in fellowship with the members of his village.  He resides is the urban part of El Roble village, in the Santo Tomas district, a small community primarily engaged in farming and raising livestock, and where the homes have water and electricity services.

Neiser Ronald is engaged in coffee cultivation, and has two hectares of the Catimor variety of coffee to date.  His plantation is three years old as everyone in the area has new plantations.  Neiser Ronald’s coffee is in its first year of production and in 2015, it will be in its second year of production.  This parcel of coffee is situated on his own three hectares of farmland.  He has been engaged in this activity for three years, in El Roble village, Santo Tomas district.  He has experience in cultivating coffee, and sells his product to buyers in the Santo Tomas district.  In addition, Neiser Ronald is engaged in raising cattle, and has six cows of his own to date.  He also cultivates grain products, and all this is done on his own land in the El Roble village in Santo Tomas.  The purpose of the loan is to maintain two hectares of coffee in production, and with it he will ensure greater and better production for the 2015 season and therefore, obtain higher income in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain two hectares of coffee in production.

loans.name: Francess  A.

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Francess.  She is married and has two children, aged 26 and 19. 

In 2009, Francess established her drinks business. She began her business to assist her husband in the running of their home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her main customers are mixed. Working seven days a week and 17 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Francess would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks and water for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her in increasing her profit. With the proceeds of the business, she is determined to open another outlet, becoming a supplier of drinks (wholesale) to other retailers.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more soft drinks and water.

loans.name: Eludys Judith

texts.es: Eludys,  con una sonrisa en sus labios nos cuenta que siempre le apasionó la modistería y que desde joven aprendió empíricamente a confeccionar ropa, pero sintió la necesidad de profesionalizar su arte, por lo que estudió en una academia e inició su propio negocio en el año 1984.  Eludys tiene 52 años de edad de los cuales ha dedicado 30 años en este negocio, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, dos jovencitas de 21 y 14 años y un jovencito de 23 años, sus propósitos a largo plazo es mejorar las condiciones de la casa en la que viven, es por esa razón la señora Eludys labora en su taller 9 horas diarias, para lograr cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.  Ella confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros y realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble, acabado de piezas y empaque de productos; sus clientes se han mantenido fieles con el pasar del tiempo, pues brinda un excelente servicio y elabora sus prendas sobre medida y a la vanguardia.  Con esta amplia gama de productos y demanda de pedidos, decidió que su negocio debía crecer mucho más,  por lo que invertir en una fileteadora Industrial y en materias primas, al por mayor y de contado, como telas, hilos, botones, le fortalecería su infraestructura técnica, su capacidad de producción y su capital de trabajo;  para ello está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en ésta propuesta, con la su negocio mejorará pues aumentará su productividad y dará una acabado de calidad a la ropa que fabrica además de superar el gran desafio de tener suficiente capital de trabajo para invertir.
texts.en:
With a smile on her face, Eludys says that she has always been passionate about fashion design. At a young age, she learned how to make clothes on her own. However, she felt the need to become a professional in this art. For this reason, she studied at an academy before starting her own business in 1984.

Eludys is 52 years old and has been dedicated to this business for 30 years. She is married and has three children: two daughters (ages 21 and 14) and a son (age 23). Her long-term goals include improving the conditions of the house in which her family lives. For this reason, Sra. Eludys works at her shop for nine hours each day so that she can fulfill orders from her customers. She produces all types of clothing such as shirts, trousers, dresses, school uniforms, and other garments. Eludys handles every step of the operation, including sewing, designing, cutting fabric, prepping, assembly, finishing individual pieces, and packaging the product. Her customers have remained loyal over time because Eludys provides excellent service. The clothes that she produces are custom-fitted and on the cutting edge.

Due to the wide range of products that she offers and the demand for her services, Eludys decided that her business should grow much more. For this reason, she will invest in an industrial overlock stitching machine and raw materials that she will purchase in bulk and with cash. These items include fabrics, thread, and buttons. In order to strengthen her infrastructure, her production capacity, and her operating capital, Eludys is applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest the proceeds as planned.

By improving her business and increasing her productivity, Eludys will be able to produce a quality finished product. In addition to expanding, her greatest challenge will be having sufficient operating capital for investment.

loans.use: to buy an industrial overlock stitching machine and supplies in bulk such as fabrics, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 60-year-old father of six who lives in the Nkubu area which is located in the central province of Kenya. He has farmed for 20 years and earns an honest and decent income. Jackson has both crops and a dairy farm and has a small business to make ends meet. 

Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Jackson. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces. Jackson seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. 

Jackson and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. Jackson is disciplined regarding finances and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income and obtain a stable future for his family.

loans.use: to venture into other areas of farming.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 24-year-old hard working man, with 2 children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He has a service of brick laying and at the same time selling firewood. He faces challenges of weather changes, especially the rain, which destroys his bricks. Patrick has asked for a loan to buy firewood and bake bricks to sell.

Patrick hopes of building a commercial, permanent house.

loans.use: to buy firewood and bake bricks to sell.

loans.name: Jeckness

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Jeckness. 

She is a smallholder Kenyan farmer making a living off dairy, poultry, tea, and banana farming. She started farming 30 years ago when she tied the knot with her better half. She did it to help her husband put food on the table for their family. 30 years later, she is now a widow bearing the burden of fending for herself and paying for her child's university education fee.
 
Jeckness had a difficult childhood growing up in a poor family. She has become hardened to the realities of life, but she is deeply worried about her children's future. She struggles everyday to afford education to ensure that her children lead a more comfortable and fulfilling life. 

With this request, she is seeking 20,000 KES loan to purchase several heads of poultry. The brood of chickens will lay eggs that will generate income for Jeckness through sales and the hatching of chicks. She will use the money from the sale of eggs to pay for all her expenses; including loan debt, and her child's education.

She will continue working on the 2-acre farmland left behind by her husband to make a decent living and keep his spirit's alive. Jeckness' family will be very grateful for the loan that will go a long way to improving their lives.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Hello wonderful Kiva Lenders! 
The dairy business is an important source of income to small-scale farmers in Kenya. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva to provide financial and technical solutions to poor farmers such as Lawrence, a father of two children in the Nkubu area of Kenya. 

Lawrence has been a mixed farmer for the past six years, and his primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and food crops. The Nkubu area has a cool climate, but sometimes experiences long dry spells, and this account for major crop failures which can lead to starvation. 

Lawrence is seeking a loan to purchase a high quality dairy cow. Easy availability of feed and fodder all year round makes dairy farming an ideal choice of investment in this region. Through the loan Lawrence will be able to fully satisfy the demand for milk in his village and through increased income, he will be able to improve his living conditions. 

This loan will be very important because it will not only improve Lawrence’s life, but also he will be able to get manure, which will be used on his farm and improve productivity. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Lawrence has been trained on how to save money, and he plans to use the extra income to increase his business and is planning to buy another dairy cow. All that Lawrence waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land where he can rear cattle and later sell them.

loans.name: Hafusa

texts.en: Hafusa is a 23-year-old, married woman with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a salon and at the same time fries cassava to sell. She started these businesses with a hope of becoming self-employed. She aims to expand her business to new areas in the future. Hafusa has asked for a loan to buy salon chemicals and weaves.

loans.use: to buy salon chemicals and weaves to use this Christmas season.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 28-year-old, married man with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His major work is mowing the compound on a contract basis, and at the same time he earns salary working as a security guard. He is hoping to expand his customer base and increase his income. Moses needs a loan to buy a second machine for compound mowing.

loans.use: to buy a second machine for compound mowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 33-year-old married man with four children; three of them are currently attending school in Hoima, Uganda. 

Alfred started a business in produce, mainly in buying and selling maize and beans. He also supplements his income by growing cassava to earn additional income. With this loan, he will use it to buy more maize to sell.

In the future, Alfred hopes to expand and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flour to make more soft drinks.

loans.name: Rugaga

texts.en:
George is a member of Rugaga Kweyamba which is an association made up of many people, but Rugaga Kweyamba takes a loan as an individual. These individuals deal in different types of businesses like agriculture, rentals, and hiring of chairs on functions. 

They are facing challenges of limited capital, however, they hope to construct very many houses to rent. The association has asked for a loan to construct more rental houses for renting.

loans.use: to construct more rental houses for renting.

loans.name: Pauson

texts.en: Pauson is a 47-year-old, hardworking married man, with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce alongside farming to earn himself an extra income. He started this business to earn a living. He hopes to become rich, however his main challenge is price fluctuation.  He is requesting a loan to buy more produce to sell like beans, maize, millet etc.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell like beans, maize, millet, etc.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 38 años de edad, su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 7° grado, no continuo sus estudios porque decidió mejor casarse, ahora junto a su esposo tienen tres hijas de 18, 15 y 13 años de edad, de los cuales dos están estudiando y la otra le ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa a su mamá, María vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas, su esposo trabaja como motorista mientras que María se dedica a la venta de productos de catalogo desde hace 3 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de una amiga, decidió dedicarse a este negocio debido a la situación económica en que vivía, para ofrecer los productos ella lo hace en los alrededores de su comunidad, su horario es de 2::00 pm a 5:00 pm.

 El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una vaca lechera, con la leche que le de la vaquita ella podrá hacer los quesos para venderlos, así tendrá mas ingreso para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, los sueños de María son que sus hijas sean profesionales para que en un futuro tengan mejores posibilidad de un buen trabajo, tener un negocio de ropa y comprar una mototaxi.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and studied until 7th grade. She didn’t continue her studies because she decided to get married instead. Now, she and her husband have three daughters of ages 18, 15, and 13. Two of them are studying and the other helps her mom with the household chores. Her husband works as a driver while María makes a living in the sale of catalog products, a job that she learned from a friend. She decided to dedicate herself to this business due to the economic situation in which she was living. She sells the products in the areas surrounding her community. Her schedule is from 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM. 

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy a dairy cow. With the milk from the cow she will be able to make cheese to sell, and therefore she will have more income to give her family a better quality of life. María’s dream is that her daughters become professionals so that in the future they will have a greater chance to get a good job, have a clothing business, and buy a moto-taxi.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bella Iris

texts.es: Doña Bella, tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente vendía mercadería en forma ambulante, y hace dos años estableció su pulpería en su casa donde vende refrescos, churros, dulces, granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, verduras, pan, condimentos, productos de aseo, y otros como útiles escolares. Con el propósito de surtir mas el negocio ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo que es el tercer ciclo con la Institución y es por 15,000 lempiras, para comprar azúcar, arroz, pan, manteca, refrescos, churros, huevos, verduras, harina, granos básicos, dulces, productos de aseo y otros de abarrotería. Su objetivo es incrementar el inventario para aumentar las ventas y los ingresos. Tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Bella is 47 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with her husband with whom she has 3 children. she lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. She has always worked in commerce. Previously she sold merchandise door-to-door and two years ago established a small store in her house.

She sells soft drinks, chips, sweets, basic grains, sugar, lard, vegetables, spices, cleaning products and others like school supplies. With the aim of stocking her store more she has decided to request another loan which is her third with the institution. It is for 15,000 HNL and she will buy sugar, rice, bread, lard, soft drinks, chips, eggs, vegetables, flour, basic grains, sweets, cleaning products and other grocery products.

Her goal is to increase her inventory to increase her sales and her income. She plans to expand her store and provide a better quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, bread, lard, soft drinks, chips, eggs, vegetables, flour, basic grains, sweets, cleaning products and other grocery products.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 32 años de edad, es panificador, su nivel de estudio fue hasta 6° grado y ya no siguió estudiando debido a que viajo hacia los estados unidos, esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, junto con su esposo tienen 3 hijos de 10, 5 y 1 año de edad, dos están en la escuela, Miguel vive con su esposa y sus hijos, Miguel trabaja como panificador desde hace 2 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de un amigo y por la economía en que vivían, también sale a vender pan en bicicleta en los caseríos aledaños, su horario es de 2:00 am a 8:00 am. 

El crédito que esta solicitando Miguel, es para comprar una cocina de gas, ya que necesita una en el hogar y lo demás lo invertirá en la compra de un televisor para que se entretengan sus hijos, también pagara una deuda que adquirió en la enfermedad de uno de sus hijos. Los sueños de Miguel es llegar a tener una casa, tener un negocio y tener su propio terreno agrícola para sembrar.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old and is a bread baker. He studied up to the 6th grade but did not continue because he traveled to the United States. Miguel has a life partner who is a housewife. Together they have three children who are 10, 5 and 1 year old; two of them are in school, and they all live together.

Miguel has been working as a bread baker for the past two years. He learned this work from a friend as a result of the economic times in which they were living. He also sells bread from his bicycle throughout the neighboring communities.  He works from 2:00 a.m. until 8:00 a.m.

The loan that Miguel is requesting is so that he can buy a gas stove for his house. He will use the rest to buy a television for his children's entertainment. He will also use some of the money to pay a debt he owes due to the illness of one of his children. Miguel's dream is to have a house, a business, and to have his own land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove, a TV, and to pay a debt.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
Edward is a 60-year-old, proud father of 11 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Edward has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Edward described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Edward’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.75 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 57-year-old, proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Margaret has noticed that she has larger farm group support.

Margaret describes her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Margaret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith, pictured above, has been a farmer for 18 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 54 years old, is married, and has 7 children.

Judith likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Judith plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Judith’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
The Yehowa Akwe ('God should take control') Group consists of two members who live in Teshie, Accra, Ghana. They have applied for a loan of GHS 2,300 from ID Ghana to invest in plastic products, cups, sauce pans, wigs, and earrings. 

Rebecca is a 31-year-old, single woman who lives in Teshie, Accra, Ghana with her 8-year-old son. She is the featured borrower. She has been selling plastic products, cups, and sauce pans for one year. She was previously selling fish. 

Currently, she wants to buy more plastic products, cups, and sauce pans, but she doesn't have enough capital. She decided to apply for a loan of GHS 1,500 from ID Ghana in order to purchase more plastic products, cups, and sauce pans and sell them to customers. 

Rebecca looks forward to improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic products, cups, and sauce pans and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en:
Ameer is a 36-year-old married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

She has eight children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales in order to earn a good income for providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales

loans.name: Zobia

texts.en:
Zobia is 21 years old and is a married woman. She has one child. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. 

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Zobia  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Lumturije

texts.en:
Lumturije is requesting a small loan of 50,000 Albanian Lek to buy pesticides for her plants. Lumturije, 57, and a mother of one, does agriculture to earn a living. She plants quantities of beans and sells them dried. She also has plum orchards and sells the fruit. Lumturije's husband sells rain covers that are used mostly for covering the plants to protect them from frost.

Since Lumturije's land is far from home, the loan officer took her photograph inside her home. She is wearing a white apron, which is very traditional amongst the women in the region of Korca; they always put an apron on when they cook.

loans.use: to buy pesticides mostly for her plum trees

loans.name: Mariol

texts.en:
Mariol is 25 and a member of the ethnic vulnerable minority of Albania. He has this little bar-café built in the first floor of his house.  Also, together with his brother and father, he buys and sells fruits and veggies that luckily are plentiful in the region where they reside.  Mostly they are known for the delicious and large quantities of produce such as dried beans, chickpeas, oats, potatoes, wheat, corn, apples, quinces and plums. 

Mariol said that he has plans to marry, but not anytime soon, because he wants to be stable financially first, and he hopes to improve his condition.  Members of this vulnerable ethnic community are located in the suburbia of their city, with some of them living in better conditions compared to others.  Mariol is seeking your financial help to buy some inventory items for his bar-café and to repair the transportation truck they use for buying and selling of the veggie and fruit produce.

loans.use: to repair the transportation truck they use for the fruits and veggies business and to stock up on inventory items for his little bar-cafe.

loans.name: Etleva

texts.en: Etleva and Aurel are parents of three children, ages 18, 10 and 6 and they are members of the most vulnerable ethnic community of Albania. They are requesting this loan to pay for the hospitalization and funeral expenses of Aurel’s father who was hit by a vehicle and then sent to Tirana, the capital city, to a hospital where he was pronounced dead a few days later.  They did not have the money to pay for all the expenses and they asked relatives and friends to pay.  Now they owe these moneys to them. They both have been photographed inside their home. Etleva works as a cleaner in three buildings, and Aurel as a chimney sweep.

loans.use: to pay for the hospitalization and funeral expenses for her father-in-law who was hit by a vehicle.

loans.name: Festime

texts.en:
Festime is 54 years old. Her husband, Nevruz, is next to her in the photograph. They are parents of three children, with the youngest one being 24. 

Festime and her husband both have some health problems; she has problems with her hearing and walking whereas he suffers from some organ disease. Festime receives a disability income and Nevruz receives a retirement pension as well as pay for being a commune council member. They also own a house in a village that they rent out and they get some money from this as well.

Festime is seeking your help to pay for her husband’s health specialist visit to the capital city.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's health specialist visit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his little bar-cafe.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Razia is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 45,000. 

With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 37 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Azra’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Azra has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires, some auto spare parts, and tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Azra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, some auto spare parts, and tools

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas is a 34-year-old married woman. She has five children. Muqadas is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet her customer's orders on time to earn good profits. This monetary help can take Muqadas closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet her customer's orders on time to earn good profits.

loans.name: Fehmeeda

texts.en:
Fehmeeda is a 41-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She is operating a business of a small general store at her home. Her husband is employed in a garment shop as a salesperson, but he does not earn enough income to lead his family. 

Fehmeeda is making a great effort to support her family. But she faced a financial problem in the growth of her business. She needs to buy more grocery items to meet the day-to-day requirements of her customers. For this, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy more packs of biscuits, rice, beverages, sugar, cleaning products, etc. She is positive about her future earnings and wants to spend her earned profit for the betterment of her children.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, rice, beverages, sugar, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Bhagwanti

texts.en: Bhagwanti is 42 years old and is a married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trading. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Bhagwanti has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with the loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en:
Khatija is a 43-year-old married woman and her husband is an electrician by profession. He provides his services in their locality and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family. 

In order to cater to more customers, Khatija's husband needs to acquire more supplies; such as a variety of wires, switches, charges, and cable. For this reason, Khatija has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her husband in catering to more customers and eventually increase the family's net income.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies; such as wires, switches, charges, and cable.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of 6 children. She has a business of farm animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is also very motivated to provide their children with a better life through good education, food, and clothing. 

Zubida has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR which she intends to use to purchase more young goats and calves to cater to more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate more revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more young goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Rukyia

texts.en:
Rukyia is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been providing the service of flour grinding in her community from many years. 

The man shown in the photo is her husband who supports Rukyia in her work. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members, so she started this business at her home to contribute to the family income. She knows the techniques of flour grinding and through time she becomes known for providing fine quality flour and earns enough to support the needs of her family. 

In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Rukyia contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR. The new machine would help her meet more customer demands in a timely manner and will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a new flour grinding machine

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Khursheed’s son, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, her son changed his vehicle's tires. 
 
Currently, Khursheed has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will allow her son to replace the auto body and purchase some tools for his vehicle. 

Khursheed is very happy to see her son's business growing.

loans.use: to replace the auto body and purchase some tools for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ruqayya

texts.en: Ruqayya has successfully established her business of hand embroidery with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva.  She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva loans, she was able to purchase required raw materials. Now she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more materials such as threads, sequins, beads and needles to meet customers’ orders on time to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more materials such as threads, sequins, beads and needles to meet customers’ orders on time to gain more profits.

loans.name: Na'omi

texts.en:
Na'omi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Affinikee, Irmiya, and Safayanu.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Na'omi would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Na'omi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Na'omi spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, hoping to eventually become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to meet expenses such as her children's school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ume  Kalsom

texts.en:
Ume Kalsom is a 34-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is an electrician by profession. He provides services in their locality and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family net income. 

In order to cater to more customers, Ume Kalsom's husband needs to purchase more supplies; such as a variety of wires, switches, charges, and cable. For this reason Ume Kalsom has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies; such as wires, switches, charges, and cable.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia has successfully built her business selling bridal dresses with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she attained a good number of customers, she made a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more bridal dresses in different colors and new designs to increase her sales for gaining more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more bridal dresses in different colors and new designs to increase her sales for gaining more profits.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 53-year-old widowed woman. She is a vigorous lady and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. 

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She also stitches clothes to generate an extra amount of income. Now, she has requested for a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Hamida expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ayuba, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to become one of the most profitable farmers in his community.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dabo

texts.en:
Dabo is a maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dabo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dabo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Dabo is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like clothing and food, eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yosiya

texts.en:
Yosiya is a maize farmer from Chiroma Village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yosiya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yosiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Yosiya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for expenses like food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Habu

texts.en:
Habu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Habu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ezekiel, Joseph and Caleb.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Habu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Habu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Habu  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ado G.

texts.en: Ado G. is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ado G. would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ado G. can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ado G., like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elisha G

texts.en: Elisha G. is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Elisha G. would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Elisha G. can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Elisha G., like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rahila Uwani

texts.en:
Rahila Uwani is a maize farmer from Gayya village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila Uwani would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila Uwani can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Rahila Uwani, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to meet expenses such as food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 3 mujeres alegres y luchadoras que se organizaron hace año y medio, con el propósito de mejorar su nivel de ingresos y comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios.

Sonia: Es una señora amable. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 6 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, gaseosas, pollo, carne molida, productos lácteos, chiverías, entre  otros productos. Su sueño es comprar una mantenedora nueva.
texts.en:
This group comprises three joyful and courageous women, who organized themselves one and a half years ago in order to improve their income level and purchase merchandise for their small businesses.

Sonia is a friendly lady.  She established her small grocery store six years ago, in order to have her own source of income.  She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, chicken, ground beef, dairy products, snacks, and similar products.

Her dream is to purchase a new refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, chicken, ground beef, dairy products, and snacks, along with other products.

loans.name: Caribeans Girl Group

texts.es:
Está integrado por 3 mujeres luchadoras, que se unieron hace un mes con el propósito de obtener su primer financiamiento, para mejorar su nivel de ingresos y comprar mercadería para  sus pequeños negocio.

Jeammie: Es un joven amable, madre soltera de una pequeña hija. Solicita financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar vigoron: Yuca, tomate, repollo, vinagre, sal, chicharon. Su sueño es crecer más en su negocio y establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of three hardworking women that met a month ago with the intention of obtaining their first loan to improve their income level, and purchase merchandise for their small businesses. 

Jeammie is a young, friendly single mother of a small daughter.  She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies and ingredients (yucca, tomato, cabbage, vinegar, salt, and pork crackling) to make “vigorón”, a traditional Nicaraguan dish.  Her dream is to grow her business further and establish a small general store.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients to make “vigorón”.

loans.name: Marcaribe Group

texts.es: María Azaraya: Es una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 5 años vende bastimentos. Para acceder a financiamiento hace 4 meses se organizo con 2 mujeres luchadoras para conformar el grupo solidario Mar Caribe. Solicita financiamiento para comprar coco, filipita, malanga, limones, yuca entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
María Azaraya is a hardworking single mother, who has been selling groceries for 5 years in order to have her own source of income and provide for her children.  

Four months ago, in order to qualify for a loan, she and two other courageous women organized the solidarity group, “Mar Caribe” [Caribbean Sea]. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase coconut, filipita (a variety of banana), taro, lemons, and yucca, among other products. 

Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut, filipita (a variety of banana), taro, lemons, and yucca, among other products.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyugue y sus dos menores hijos de edades 11 y 4 años de los cuales el primero cursa primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Maritza es natural de la zona. Vive en la parte rural del distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Y su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Maritza es el comercio de aves como gallinas, patos, pavos, las compras los realiza en su mismo caserio y en caserios aledaños. Y las ventas de los animales Maritza las realiza en dos formas animales vivos y/o animales muertos listos para su preparación a los restaurantes. Maritza cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro, además cónyugue trabaja como caporal de chacra, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el credito sin ningun problema. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en su negocio en compra de mayor cantidad de animales con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Maritza, 34, lives in her own house of rustic materials.  She lives with her husband and two minor children, 11 and 4, of which the first attends the primary grades of the National College of the District of Pucara.  Maritza is a native of the zone.  She lives in the rural part of the district which has electricity and running water services.  This district is located in the Province of Jaen, Region  of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.  Her community makes a living basically through agriculture, ranching, and commerce.
What Maritza does is trading in birds such as hens, ducks, and turkeys.  She buys them in her own hamlet or adjacent ones. As to the sales of animals, Maritza does it in two ways: live or dead ready for preparation by restaurants.  Maritza has ten years experience in this work.  In addition, her husband works as a farm foreman bringing additional income to cover the loan without a problem.  The loan will be destined to be invested in her business by purchasing a greater quantity of animals with which she will generate better income and thus be able to improve her quality of life.  For this work, there is no better competition in the zone and with it she gets better prices.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying a greater quantity of animals.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudio debido a la situación económica en que vivían sus padres, decidió trabajar para ayudarle en los gastos a su familia, luego decidió casarse y junto a su esposo procrearon 4 hijos de 26, 22, 18 y 17 años de edad, de los cuales 2 se encuentran estudiando y los otros dos ya están casados, por lo tanto trabajan para su propio hogar. María vive con dos hijos que son los que dependen de ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura mientras que María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cestas desde hace 20 años trabajo que lo aprendió de su esposo, decidió dedicarse al negocio para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

Para llegar a su trabajo María viaja en vehículo 20 kilómetros, su horario es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm.

Elpréstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar materiales para elaborar las cestas. Los sueños de María son llegar a ampliar el negocio de cestas, también tener un terreno y tener 5 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and is a housewife. She did not study due to her parents' economic situation. She decided to work to help her family with their expenses. Later, she decided to get married and she and her husband had 4 children of ages 26, 22, 18, and 17. Two of their children are studying and the other two are already married, and therefore they work for their own homes. María lives with the two children that depend on her. 

Her husband makes a living in agriculture, while María makes a living in the production and sales of baskets, ever since she learned this line of work from her husband 20 years ago. She decided to dedicate herself to this business to help her husband with the household expenses. To get to work, María travels in a vehicle for 20 kilometers. Her schedule is from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy materials to create the baskets. María’s dreams are to expand her basket business, and also to have a plot of land and 5 dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy materials for the production of baskets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Heison Alonso

texts.es:
Heison Alonso vive en casa familiar con madre. Aproximadamente más de 20 años. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Heison Alonso se dedica a la cria y venta de animales menores caerneros, patos,gallinas) desde hace aproximadamete mas de 05 años. El destino del préstamo es para compra de una cantidad mayor de animales y arreglo de corral donde estos viven para poder criarlos en mejores condiciones y con una mayor calidad; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Heison Alonso lives in his family home with his mother. He is more than 20 years old. He has good personal and work-related references, and his family is supportive. He lives in a community engaged in commerce, farming, and livestock production; it is located in the Saña district, which is in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

Heison Alonsa has earned his living raising and selling young animals (sheep, ducks, and chickens) for approximately five years. The objective of the loan is to buy a larger quantity of animals and to repair the corral where they live so that he can raise better quality animals in better conditions. In the near future, this will allow him to improve his income and increase his profits, thereby improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals and repair his corral

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino tiene 64 años de edad, es conviviente no tiene hijos dependientes solo tiene a su cargo una nieta. Florentino vive con su cónyugue y su nieta de 07 años, en el caserío de Sondor distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. El caserío de Sondor es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Florentino se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café de variedad Catimor de 08 y 04 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado, dichos cultivos se encuentran ubicado a unos metros lomas arriba del colegio del caserío. Florentino además se dedica a la cria de animales de corral y cultivo de pan llevar, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio abono, mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Invirtiendo en su negocio y podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Florentino is 64 years old, married, and does not have any dependent children. He is only taking care of a granddaughter. Florentino lives with his spouse and his granddaughter, who is 7 years old. They live in the Sondor village in the Pomahuaca district, which is in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. Sondor is a medium-sized village with aspirations of growing. In said district, the main activities are agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding.

Florentino makes a living in agriculture. He has coffee crops of the Catimor variety, which are 8 and 4 years old. He has a fruitful coffee plantation in a good stage of growth. These crops are located a few meters of elevation above the village school. Florentino also makes a living in breeding farm animals and growing basic staple crops. He has more than 10 years of experience in agriculture and has very good personal references.

The loan will be used to invest in his business, fertilizer, and maintenance of his coffee crops. Investing in his business will allow him to obtain an acceptable profit to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his business, fertilizer, and maintenance of his coffee crops.

loans.name: Atuwa Baturiya

texts.en:
Atuwa Baturiya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Dantala, Blessing, and Metala.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Atuwa Baturiya would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Atuwa Baturiya can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Atuwa Baturiya spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and eventually have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses such as her children's school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hassiba

texts.en:
Hassiba is a 41-year-old married mother of two children. In the beginning, she started working as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband in covering their family's needs and expenses. With her ambition and hard work, Hassiba has succeeded in opening her own beauty salon. 

Today, Hassiba is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to expand her business by buying the necessary hair tools to facilitate her work and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary hair tools for her salon

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 43-year-old married mother of six children. Due to the low level of her husband's income, she decided to open a grocery shop to help her husband in covering their family's needs and expenses.

Today, Rose is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with new products that customers have requested. This will satisfy her current customers and attract new ones.

Rose hopes to expand her business more in the future to improve her family's living conditions and to save some of her profits for her children's future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new products requested by customers

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a hardworking married man who started his business of buying and selling produce, mainly maize, beans, and rice among others, in Hoima, Uganda.

He desires to develop and expand his business. However, inadequate capital hinders the achievement of his desire.

He will use the loan facility to buy more beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Watch Daniel's video profile here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=woki1EbAy3o

Daniel is 54 years old, married and has 5 children. He has been a solar lamp distributor for NOTS Lampe Solaire for the past 3 years. Last year Daniel used Kiva funds to purchase solar lamp inventory worth $20,275. He successfully paid back his Kiva loan and now hopes to increase the loan size so he can purchase 2,500 solar lamps from NOTS Lampes Solaire and sell them to cotton farmers on credit. Prior to selling solar lamps, Daniel studied agriculture and engineering and worked as a farm manager at a Malian textile company. He started his own company because he believes that solar lamps are very useful for rural families who live in his region. Daniel’s main customers are farmers from Sikasso, the southern-most region in Mali. The majority of his customers do not have access to electricity - they light their homes with kerosene, flashlights and candles instead. To charge their mobile phones they walk long distances to a kiosk and pay money. On top of being dangerous, time-consuming and toxic, these energy sources are expensive. They cost a family about $80 per year or 10% of their annual income! And during the rainy season it is even worse, as kerosene is oftentimes not available or very expensive. A d.light solar lamp lasts for about 5 years and costs $25. Purchasing a solar lamp saves families time and money (about $375 over 5 years!) and is much safer and healthier. The environment also benefits – no more toxic waste or dirty CO2 emissions. Daniel recently signed an agreement with the Union of Cotton Producer Cooperatives to promote solar lamps to the 15,000 cotton farmers in his region. He conservatively estimates that he can sell 2,500 lamps to these farmers. When the farmers sell their cotton harvest they can pay Daniel for the solar lamps. Your Kiva investment will help bring light to approximately 10,000 lives and help Daniel to provide for his family and expand his business. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy solar lamps that he will sell to cotton farmers

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 47 years old and is married with four children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Hai works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture and has been involved in this business for four years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. Therefore, Hai is requesting a loan to purchase bricks, sand and cement to build a toilet. This is Hai's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hai hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, sand and cement to build a toilet

loans.name: Quân

texts.en:
Quân is 26 years old and is married with one child. He lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Quân has been operating a service business which involves shipping goods for the past four years.

The main hardship that Quân faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase bricks, sand and cement to build a toilet.

In the future, Quân hopes that his family will be healthy and happy, that his business will go well and that his child can go to school.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, sand and cement to build a toilet

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos uno de 20 y otro de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y por la tradicional feria que se realiza todos los jueves y domingos; donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja de cocer hasta un tractor de arado, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura constante de 4-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Rosa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español (sentada la tercera de la derecha usa chamarra negra). Su vida la realiza con sus dos hijos; el mayor estudia en la universidad y trabaja y el menor estudia en el kínder, la familia vive en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas natural. La necesidad por obtener mejores ingresos económicos para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos, la llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de chompas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo u mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas, como; Alfajor, Pastelillos, Chicles, Paletas, Chocolate, Regaliz, Caramelos, etc., gracias a sus deseos de independizarse comenzó esta labor, que realiza desde hace ocho años en la puerta de su domicilio, aguantando las inclemencias del clima y el frío del lugar. La ventaja es que los días jueves y domingos se realiza la famosa feria de la ’16 de julio’ donde tiene muchas ventas. Su sueño es tener un espacio en su casa para abrir una tienda y vender bajo techo. Ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de golosinas de temporada (bastones de caramelo, roscas de dulce, panetones, etc) para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de su pequeño hijo. esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución eb ocho años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Rosa solicita un préstamo para la compra de golosinas por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 39 year old single woman with two children, ages 20 and 5 years old. Her business is selling candy. She is a good mother, enterprising, constant, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is located in the "16 de julio" zone, an area known for all kinds of businesses and its traditional market that takes place every Thursday and Sunday. In the market you can find everything from sewing needles to tractors. The area has a cold, dry climate with a constant temperature of 4-12 degrees centigrade all year.

Rosa has a dark complexion, long dark hair, medium height, and her first language is Aymara and her second language Spanish. She is seated third from the right with the black jacket. She lives with her two children. The oldest studies at the university and the youngest in kindergarten. The family lives in its own home with drinkable water, electricity, and natural gas. The need for income to cover her household expenses drove Rosa to form a communal bank with others. They have businesses such as: selling food, refreshments, sweaters, making baby clothing, selling french fries, athletic clothing, neighborhood store, and butcher shop. The loan will be used to support their businesses.

Rosa sells candy such as sandwich cookies, tarts, gum, lollipops, chocolate, caramels, etc. Thanks to her desire to be self-sufficient she began this business. She has had her business for 8 years, selling from the doorway of her home in all kinds of weather and cold. The advantage is that on Thursdays and Sundays the famous traditional "16 de julio" market has many sales.

Her dream is to open a space in her home to open a store and sell from her home. She wants to buy the candy at wholesale in order to take advantage of the end of year sales, and with the profits pay the education expenses of her young son. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution over the past 8 years that she has had with this work. For these reasons Rosa seeks a loan to buy candy at wholesale to pay for her son's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy candy at wholesale and with the profits pay the school expenses of her young son.

loans.name: Lorena De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lorena de 32 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 3 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lorena is 32 years old, a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children. For three years she has had a small store located in her home. She has many customers for her good prices and friendly service. She is seeking a loan in order to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soda pop, candy, pastries, etc. and in this way be able to have better income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soda pop, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 55 years old and lives alone in the Akhalkalaki district. She owns 1.25 hectares of agricultural land which is rented out to local farmers. 

Marita has decided to start a retail business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to take out a loan of 2,500 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase clothes from wholesalers and then will resell them at higher prices. This will increase her income and, with her increased income, Marita will expand her business in future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a business selling clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prune and sow cacao plants.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Juan, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su familia, en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon. Juan se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y sandalias para damas y productos plásticos como canastas, coladores, panas, vasos, paltos etc.  Este negocio lo tiene hace 2 años 3 meses y se ubica en puntos estratégicos en el mercado para vender.  Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 15,000 lempiras  y lo invertirá en la compra de una docena de camisas, media docena de pantalones y una docena de blusas, el resto lo invertirá en productos plásticos, con el propósito de obtener mejores ventas y ganancias. Su meta es tener un local propio, céntrico y hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a la familia.
texts.en: Juan is 46 years old, married, has 5 children, and lives with his family in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon. Juan works selling women's clothing, shoes, and sandals and plastic products such as baskets, colanders, basins, glasses, plates, etc. He has had this business for 2 years and 3 months and it is located in strategic points in the market for sales. He is asking for a second loan with ODEF, which is for 15,000 lempiras, and he will invest it in the purchase of a dozen shirts, half-dozen pants, and a dozen blouses. The rest he will invest in plastic products, with the goal to get better sales and earnings. His goal is to have his own central retail space, and to grow his business to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase a dozen shirts, half-dozen pants, a dozen blouses, and also he will invest in plastic products.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is photographed with her youngest child, her one-year-old; her oldest is 7 years.
 
Flora is seeking this loan to buy a used vehicle because she and her family live very far from village and city.  They have no neighbors around. Sometimes their children need medical checkups or there are other urgent matters.  Thus having a car is "mandatory," as she says. 
  
Flora has one sow and two female goats for her family’s needs.  Her husband works for pay in a fish factory in the city of Lezha.  Flora used to work there before as well, but now she is on maternal leave.

loans.use: to buy a used car for family needs

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga has a retail business selling dry food. Nga is 34 years old and she is married with three children. Nga supports three dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nga has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a toilet.

In the future, Nga hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
La socia Sayda se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sayda continues devoting herself to her livestock business, fattening and raising cattle in order to sell them later in different markets.  She works from 8:00 A.M. until 6:00 P.M., and she wants to get ahead by means of this work. 

Her dream is to expand her cattle sales business, and she is requesting a loan to purchase a cow. She is happy about the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
Mireya tiene 45 años de edad es casada, se conoce como una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de continuar en su actividad productiva para sufragar gastos personales y algunos de sus hijos. En este tiempo logró independizarse por completo de su esposo, como nos explico en la visita ya no debe esperar que su esposo le de dinero para comprarse lo que ella necesite ya que gracias a su actividad ella genera suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades y la de sus hijos cuando es necesario.Ella tiene 15 años de haber iniciado con el comercio, se caracteriza por la buena táctica al vender ya que hasta el momento ninguna clienta ha fallado en sus pagos y cada vez le compran más, ha logrado crecimiento, lo que la lleva a solicitar apoyo económico para comprar más mercadería.
Doña Mireya actualmente se especializa en venta de ropa de bebé, sábanas, cortinas, zapatos, perfumes y productos del catálogo L Bel, gracias a esta actividad re modeló su casa, acondicionó un cuarto para colocar su mercadería y compro una refrigeradora nueva. Ella sueña con convertirse en una distribuidora y a la vez generarle empleo a una de sus hijas que no pudo concluir sus estudios, para que ella también logre mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mireya is 45 years old, married, and is known as a hard-working woman with the wish to continue her successful business in order to pay personal expenses and some expenses of her children. She has been able to become independent of her husband, as she explained that she no longer waits for her husband to give her money for what she needs as thanks to her business she generates enough income to cover her necessities and those of her children when necessary.

She has had this business for 15 years, is known for her salesmanship and none of her customers are behind in payments and they continue to buy from her, which is why she is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise. Mireya today specializes in selling baby clothing, sheets, curtains, shoes, perfume, and products via the L Bel catalog. Thanks to this work she has remodeled her house and a room to store her merchandise, and she bought a new refrigerator.

She dreams of being a distributor and generating employment for one of her daughters who couldn't finish school, so that she too can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build his home from quality materials.

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Vân is 21 years old and she is married with no children. Vân lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Vân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Vân has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a toilet.

In the future, Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a toilet.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en:
Carine is 28 years old. She is married, with two children, ages between 1 and 3 years, neither in school.
