Carine has a book shop and has been running it for the past five years. With her loan, she would like to buy more books, pencils, and files to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more books, pencils, and files to sell

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 36 años  de edad, es casada, tiene  6 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes junto a cinco de sus hijos y el esposo. Ella tiene su propio  negocio de una pulpería donde vende arroz, manteca, harina, azúcar, sal, pan, verduras, pastillas de uso común, condimentos, jabón, pastas, huevos papel higiénico, café, champú, refrescos, jugos,  etc. Este negocio lo tiene hace 11 años como su fuente de ingresos del cual a podido mantener a su familia. Ha hecho crecer su negocio invirtiéndole varios préstamo, a la fecha lleva diez ciclos con el actual que es por 21,000 lempiras, con este capital va poder surtir mejor la pulpería con productos como arroz, azúcar, harina, huevos,  manteca, frijoles, refrescos, pan, verduras y carnes, ya que tiene buena clientela y necesita mantenerlo surtido. Su meta es darles una buena educación a sus hijos hasta que se gradúen y ampliar mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is 36 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in the Choloma, Cortes municipality along with five of her children and her husband. She has her own business, which is a grocery store where she sells rice, butter, flour, sugar, salt, bread, vegetables, common over-the-counter pills, condiments, soap, pastas, eggs, toilet paper, coffee, shampoo, soft drinks, juices, etc. 

She has had this business for 11 years, and it is the income source with which she has been able to support her family. She has grown her business by investing various loans. To date, she has had 10 loans, including this one, which is for 21,000 Honduran lempiras. With this capital she will be able to stock her grocery store better, with products such as rice, sugar, flour, eggs, butter, beans, soft drinks, bread, vegetables, and meat. She has a good customer base and needs to keep her store stocked. Her goal is to give her children a good education until they graduate and to expand her business more.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, sugar, flour, eggs, butter, beans, soft drinks, bread, vegetables, and meats to sell.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. José siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de maíz y frijoles pero ha pensado en sembrar café ya que la zona es apta para este cultivo también.  Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años y 4 meses, su finca la tiene en el solar de la casa y vende el café en grano oro a los intermediarios de la zona.  Con el fin de mejorar la producción de café a solicitado un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para comprar abonos, foliares para fertilizar la finca y compra de un vivero para sembrar más café. Sus planes son tener una finca grande y bien asistida, y de allí darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en: José is 36 years old, married, has 4 children, and lives with his wife and children in the municipality of Gracias Lempira. José has always worked growing corn and beans but he has decided to plant coffee since the zone is a fit for this crop as well.  He has done this work for the past 10 years and 4 months, he has his farm on the plot where his house is and he sells his coffee as beans to the intermediaries in the zone. With the goal of improving the coffee production, he has asked for a loan of 10,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizers and liquid fertilizers applied to the plant leaves to fertilize the farm and to purchase a nursery to plant more coffee. His plans are to have a large and well-tended farm and from there give his family a better quality of life, and that his children study.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and liquid fertilizers applied to the plant leaves to fertilize the farm and to purchase a nursery to plant more coffee.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana, tiene 22 años de edad, esta soltera, no tiene hijos  vive con su madre  en una aldea del municipio del  progreso, Yoro. Ella se ha dedicado al estudio y hace un año decidió poner su propio negocio donde vende productos como ser granos básicos, refrescos, churros, dulces, galletas y otros. Es una mini pulpería y su deseo es crecer con el negocio. Con el fin de surtir el negocio y obtener ganancias para costearse el estudio en la universidad ha solicitado un prestamo por 3,000  lempiras con el cual va comprar mas churros, refrescos, dulces, galletas, arroz y frijoles para vender.  Su plan es continuar estudiando  en la universidad hasta graduarse y ver su negocio grande.
texts.en: Ana is 22 years old, single, doesn't have any children, and lives with her mother in a village in the municipality of El Progreso, Yoro. She has dedicated herself to her schooling and a year ago decided to start her own business where she sells products such as basic grains, soft drinks, churros, sweets, cookies, and others. It is a mini-grocery store and her wish is to grow with the business. With the end of stocking the business and getting earnings to pay for her university studies, she has asked for a loan of 3,000 lempiras, with which she will purchase more churros, soft drinks, sweets, cookies, rice and beans to sell. Her plan is to continue studying at the university until she graduates, and to see her business become large.

loans.use: to purchase churros (a type of donut), soft drinks, sweets, cookies, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom are attending school. She also looks after her mother-in-law.

Sarah has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for the last seven years, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Her dream is to educate her children to the university level. She joined MCDT because of the school fees loan product and the relatively low interest charged on loans.

She and her family live in a house that has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Cristiano Group

texts.es: Grupo Cristiano está integrado por tres mujeres exitosas y esforzadas en su negocio, quien lo coordina es el señora Rosario, una mujer emprendedora de 44 años de edad, casada y se dedica a la comercialización de perfumes y ropa en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace cinco años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes para damas y caballeros, docenas de ropa como camisas, pantalones, shores etc. Con el fin de satisfacer la demanda, la segunda socia es la señora Luz de 53 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y Maria Olga de 61 años de edad su negocio es la venta de tortillas y nacatamales en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Grupo Cristiano (Christian Group) is made up of three women who are successful and zealous in their businesses. Rosario organizes the group. She is an entrepreneurial, 44-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has made a living by selling perfumes and clothes in the municipality’s market. 

She is requesting the loan to buy perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, as well as dozens of articles of clothing such as shirts, pants, shorts, etc. in order to satisfy demand.

The second member is Luz, who is 53 years old and makes a living by selling used clothes. Maria Olga is 61 years old, and her business is selling tortillas and tamales in her home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, as well as dozens of articles of clothing such as shirts, pants, shorts, etc. in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a cosmetics shop at the market in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, shampoo, braids, weaves and other cosmetics. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care and being friendly. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food.

loans.use: to buy Vasoline, hair relaxers, treatments, oils, braids, and weaves.

loans.name: Sinh

texts.en:
Mr. Sinh has a retail business selling dry food. Sinh is 34 years old and he is married with two children. Sinh supports two dependents with his business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Sinh has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns his is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a toilet.

In the future, Sinh hopes for his children to find a good job, for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: goods to furnish his house.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María Emilia tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

María Emilia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, art. de aseo, etc. Ella tiene su tienda desde hace más de 5 años, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, compra de más mercadería, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio; María Emilia piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Emilia is 26 years old, is partnered, has 2 children, and lives with her family in the rural zone of Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Her community basically works in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. 

María Emilia works selling groceries such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks, cleaning supplies, etc. She has had her store for more than 5 years, the business is located in her home. She is asking for a loan for working capital, to purchase more merchandise. This investment will serve to increase her sales, with a big influence on the business. María Emilia plans to have a greater stock of products to be able to serve the diverse needs, requirements, and tastes of the customers in the zone, which will permit her in the short term to improve her income and increase her earnings, with the end of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to get working capital, she will purchase more merchandise; this investment will serve to increase her sales.

loans.name: Hằng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng has a retail business where she sells dry food. She is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. Hằng is able to support her 2 dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province of Thailand.

This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved with her business for 8 years now.

The main harship that Hằng faces in her life is having neither a clean water system nor a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase sand, cement, and bricks in order to build a toilet for her family.

In the future, Hằng hopes for her children to find good jobs, her business to do well, and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase brick, sand, and cement in order to build a toilet.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming, along with sales of produce to earn himself an extra income. He started this business so as to earn a living. He hopes to be a modern farmer; however, his main challenge is inadequate capital. 

He is requesting a loan to pay workers on his farm.

loans.use: to pay workers on his farm.

loans.name: Daisy Aracely

texts.es: Daisy, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en una comunidad que pertenece a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Daisy, decidió hace un año establecer su propio negocio para generar ingresos y consiguió un local y una cámara fría para refrescos y comenzó a vender pollo frito con tajadas, tacos de pollo, refrescos, jugos y almuerzos. Ella necesita mantener los materiales e insumos para su negocio y atender bien a su clientela, para eso solicita un préstamo por 25,000 lempiras para surtir con refrescos, jugos, agua, carnes, verduras, condimentos, productos desechables y de aseo, harina, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc. para la preparación de los alimentos y productos que vende. Con las ganancias a futuro piensa construir un local mas grande ya que cuenta con buena clientela.
texts.en: Daisy is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a community in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. One year ago Daisy decided to open her own business to generate income and she obtained a location and cold storage unit, and began to sell fried chicken, chicken tacos, refreshments, juices, and lunches. She needs to maintain the materials and ingredients for her business and serve her customers well. Therefore she seeks a loan of 25,000 Lempiras to stock refreshments, juices, water, meats, vegetables, condiments, plates, glasses, soap, flour, beans, sugar, oil, etc. to make meals and products that she sells. With the profits, in the future she plans to build a bigger location now that she has a good customer base.

loans.use: to stock refreshments, juices, water, meats, vegetables, condiments, plates, glasses, soap, flour, beans, sugar, oil, etc. to make meals and products that she sells.

loans.name: Klementina

texts.en:
Klementina is in the photograph with her little granddaughter.  She is a mother of four, with the youngest one being 7 years old. 

Klementina has been doing agriculture/livestock to earn a living.  She has cows, sheep, and a mule.  Her husband works for pay in a nearby powerhouse.  

Klementina is asking for a loan is to do some repairs to their little house.  Kindly note that houses in rural areas most of the time are in terrible shape.  That makes it very difficult for people to live inside, especially when they have young children.  Thus, from time to time the houses need some basic repairs, if not total renovations. 

Klementina’s village is situated on a mountain where the temperature in the winter drops below 15 degrees.  Most of the families have left the village, and those still living there at the moment live almost primitively.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to their rundown family home

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en El Caserío San Cristóbal, una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Martin se dedica al Cultivo de café, desde hace 16 años, en el Caserio san Cristobal. Desea e crédito para invertir en compra de abonos y pagar mano de obra en su cultivo de café. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Martin posee amplio conocimiento en el cultivo de café por lo que se espera será una gran cosecha.
texts.en:
Martin is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in San Cristóbal village, a rural zone of Cañaris district; its population works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry two hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Perú. 

Martin has worked growing coffee for the past 16 years in San Cristóbal village. He wants a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and pay labor costs for his coffee crop which, in the short term, will allow him to improve his income, increase his earnings, with the end of improving his quality of life and that of his family. Martin has a broad knowledge of coffee growing, so he hopes it will be a good harvest.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and pay labor costs for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 25 years old and is married with 1 child. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Lan has had a retail business for 6 years selling dry food.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Lan is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a latrine. This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Lan hopes her children will find good jobs, her business will do well, and her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a latrine.

loans.name: Santos Heriberto

texts.es: Santos, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive con su familia en el municipio de la Iguala, Lempira. Santos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura del cultivo de maíz y frijol y luego al cultivo de café siendo esta producción la que le genera mayores ingresos. Vende el café en grano despulpado y lavado a los intermediarios de la zona. Lleva seis préstamo con el actual que ha solicitado a la institución con el fin de darle asistencia técnica a su finca de café. Este préstamo es por 20,000 Lempiras, y lo invertirá en la compra de 20 bolsas de abono y foliares para fertilizar la finca. Sus planes son seguir cultivando café para la venta, maíz y frijol para consumo y darle buena asistencia para ir formando buen patrimonio para la familia.
texts.en: Santos is 42 years old, married, has 4 children, and lives with his family in the municipality of Iguala, Lempira. Santos has always worked growing corn and beans, and later growing coffee being that this is the product which generates the most income. He sells his pulped and washed coffee beans to the intermediaries in the zone. He has six loans with the current one that he has asked the institution for, with the end of providing him technical assistance on his coffee farm. This loan is for 20,000 lempiras, and he will invest it in the purchase of 20 sacks of manure and liquid fertilizer to apply to the leaves to fertilize his plantation. His plans are to continue growing coffee for sale, corn and beans for consumption, and take good care of it to build good assets for the family.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of manure and liquid fertilizer to apply to the leaves to fertilize his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Miluska Del Milagro

texts.es:
Miluska es una joven madre de familia que siempre lucha para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo, ella es muy alegre y trabajadora y vive en Lima junto a su familia. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una profesión debido a las pocas probabilidades vividas en su casa, ella empezó desde cero y ahora está trabajando como Auxiliar en un Colegio. Miluska ama a los niños, ella cree que le está yendo bien porque siempre está pendiente del bienestar de los niños.
Miluska quiere tener mayores oportunidades, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprarse una computadora para poder ampliar sus conocimientos y poder estudiar cursos a distancia. ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que esto la ayudará a crecer en su trabajo y salir adelante poco a poco.
texts.en:
Miluska is a young mother who always struggles to be able to improve her son's quality of life. She is very happy and hard-working and lives in Lima with her family. Unfortunately, she couldn't study for a degree due to the few possibilities available in her home. She began from zero and now is working as an assistant in a school. Miluska loves children and she believes that it is going well for her because she always is looking out for the children's well-being.

Miluska wants to have better opportunities, and for this reason she plans to use the loan to be able to purchase a computer for herself to be able to expand her knowledge and to study distance learning courses. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, she wants them to know that this will help her to grow in her work and get ahead little by little.

loans.use: to purchase a computer to take distance learning courses.

loans.name: Ingrid Vanessa

texts.es:
Ingrid es una joven de 23 años de edad, estudio bachillerato, ella es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años y vive con sus padres.

 Ingrid trabaja como empleada desde hace 2 años, unos amigos la involucraron en un trabajo comunitario y fue de esa manera que tubo la oportunidad de quedarse en ese trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar lamina, clavos para mejorar el techo de la cocina de  su vivienda.

El sueño de  Ingrid es en un futuro poder obtener un crédito mas grande y poder construir una casita y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 23-year-old young woman. She went to secondary school, she is a single mother of a 3-year-old boy, and lives with her parents. 

Ingrid has worked as an employee for the past two years. Some friends involved her in a community job and this was the way she had the opportunity to remain in this job.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase metal sheeting and nails to improve the kitchen roof of her home.

Ingrid's dream is that in the future she will be able to get a much larger loan and be able to build a small house and provide her son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting and nails to improve the kitchen roof of her house.

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
These three women who come from the same neighborhood are part of the Discipline Group. They are bound by good social, economic, and business relationships. They are selling foodstuffs, vegetables, coal pots, cooking pots, yams, cutlery sets, and underwear.

 Beatrice, who is 36, is the group's representative. She's standing in the middle of the photograph. She's married and the mother of two children, one boy and one girl. She's a merchant.

Her new loan request of GHS 900 will enable her to buy okra and eggplant to sell to customers. The generated profits will enable her to cover her children's food and health needs, but will also help strengthen her savings with the ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy okra and eggplant to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lelis Eduardo

texts.es:
Lelis Eduardo tiene 34 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene tres hijos menores de edad, vive en casa propia, vivienda construida de material rustico (adobe y techo de teja). La vida en el lugar es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería; el lugar donde vive es un centro poblado menor de aproximadamente 60 familias dicho caserio tiene aproximadamente 30 años de creación política y está ubicado en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Lelis Eduardo es crianza, engorde y comercializacion de ganado porcino. La actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, el lugar donde tiene sus porcinos es en la parte de atrás de su vivienda; él comercializa en el mercado local y zonas aledañas. El destino del crédito es para compra de animales (porcinos) para engorde así como también para compra de alimento balanceado para los porcinos. La inversión le ayudará incrementar las ventas y a obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que la zona hay consumo de este producto,ya que la carne de porcino es muy bien cotizado en la zona. Lelis Eduardo piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que año tras año su negocio viene siendo mas conocido en la zona, así mismo sus ventas vienen creciendo. Y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lelis Eduardo is 34 years old, partnered, has three minor children, and lives in his own house, a dwelling made of rustic materials (adobe and tile roof). Life in this place is peaceful, its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry. The place where he lives is a small populated center of approximately 60 families. This village was created as a political entity approximately 30 years ago and is located in the district of Buenos Aires, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

The work that Lelis Eduardo does is raising, fattening and selling pigs. He has done the work for 4 years; the place where he has the pigs is in the area behind his house. He sells them in the local market and in the nearby zones.  The destination of this loan is to purchase animals (pigs) to fatten and also to be able to purchase balanced feed for the pigs.

The investment will help him to increase his sales and to get more income for his family. The market has good perspectives since in the zone there is consumption of this product, since pork is highly sought out in the zone. Lelis Eduardo plans to continue investing in his business since year by year his business becomes more known in the zone, and also his sales continue growing.  In this way, he will get more earnings which will permit him in the medium or short-term to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase animals (pigs) to fatten and also to purchase balanced feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de sorbete artesanal desde hace 3 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferente colonias y ya tiene muchos clientes, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de los sorbetes como: leche, hielo, frutas, azúcar, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man's face has been pixelated because he's 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area.

He has earned a living selling handmade sorbet for three years.  He sells on foot throughout different neighborhoods and already has a lot of customers.  He lives in his own house with his life partner and his two children.

He's requesting a loan to buy milk, ice, fruit, sugar, and other ingredients to make the sorbet.  That way he'll be able to continue with his job and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy milk, ice, fruit, sugar, etc.

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two members who are part of the group called In God.  It is made up of members who get on very well and work hard. They live in the same neighborhood, and they are into selling gari (cassava flour), eggs, and noodles. 

Florence (standing on the left in the photo) is 55 years old. She is married and has children. She will use her loan to buy two bags of gari and a crate of eggs from the market to sell to customers in Teshie. 

She has been doing this job for eight years. This is her seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana, which indicates that she is very loyal, because all her previous loans have been paid successfully. She uses her earnings to take care of her family expenses and to ensure the smooth running of her household.

loans.use: To buy two bags of gari and a crate of eggs from the market to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Sanzhar

texts.en:
Sanzhar is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“I have a big, happy and friendly family. I am the second of three. My sister studies at another research university and my little brother started primary school this year. I finished Physics and Mathematics Lyceum #61, which is one of the most prestigious schools in Kyrgyzstan, and am eager to study at AUCA. With AUCA, I can be on the move and look confidently to my future as it provides its students up-to-date conditions for learning and development. 

It’s common that tuition at the best universities is high, and AUCA is not an exception. My father’s salary and our savings are not enough to cover my and my sister’s tuition fees.  We understand that it’s better to try to get a good education now, which will help us to find well-paid job in the future than 'to boil the pot' without higher education. In dreams we live, in dreams we act, but we reach our goals after them. This Kiva loan is a huge and key step in making my dreams a reality.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge (quien es obrero agrícola) en el distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería , etc. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de cerveza, chicha de jora, y crianza de animales menores(patos, cuyes, etc). La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años en el distrito de La Matanza; el destino del crédito será para realizar mejoras en su vivienda pues ella desea comprar materiales de construcción (cemento, fierro ,etc.) para poder cosntruir una habitación más en su vivienda, pues de esta forma Rosa podrá ayudar a su familia a obtener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old and married, with three grown children.  She lives in her own house with her spouse, a farm worker, in the district of Matanza.  Life in the district moves along peacefully, because its residents devote themselves to agriculture, raising livestock, and such. Her community is located in the district of La Matanza in the Morropón Province, which lies within the Piura Region of Peru’s northern coast.

For over 10 years, Rosa has been selling beer, chicha de jora (corn beer), and raising small animals such as ducks and guinea pigs, in the district of Matanza.

Her loan will be for making improvements to her home, as she wants to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron, and similar items so that she can build another room for her home.  In this way, Rosa will be able to help her family achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home, as she wants to buy construction materials such as cement and iron, in order to build a room.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom is attending school. She is also looking after her father. She has been selling chips in a shop at retail for the last eight years, working seven days a week. She has no other source of income. She resides in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to enable her to stock more Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, and spices and to replace some working utensils. Her challenges include seasonality and changes in prices. Her dream is to open another outlet at the market. She joined MCDT SACCO because of the low interest rate on loans.

loans.use: To buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, spices, and tomato sauce

loans.name: Empalado Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Empalado” está en su ciclo número 3° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
La Sra. Raquel es macatera, es decir, se dedica a la venta ambulante, ya sea venta de Cosméticos y otros productos variados, es así que su préstamo lo va a invertir en su negocio para la compra de más cosméticos, prendas varias, artículos de bazar y demás. Ellas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que reciben y que les será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The group "Empalado" is in its third cycle of the women's committee program, where all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, as a way of knowing the situation of each one and being able to work to improve it accordingly.

Raquel is a macatera, which means she works selling on foot, selling cosmetics and other various products. This is how she is going to invest her loan in her business for the purchase of more cosmetics, various garments, housewares and more. They are thankful for the opportunity that they receive and it will be a great help to them.

loans.use: to buy costmetics, various garments, housewares and more.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 48 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Vive con sus hijos y su cónyugue en el caserío de la Unión. El caserío la Unión es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Sallique, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. En dicho caserío sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y la ganadería.

Mario se dedica al comercio cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes el cual funciona en su propio domicilio ubicado en el caserío la Unión, cuenta con más de 06 años de experiencia en el negocio, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de mercadería en mayores cnatidades para surtir y diversificar su stock de productos y de esta forma poder atender toda la demanda, gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Invirtiendo en su negocio y Mario podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is 48 years old and lives with his partner and two children in the neighborhood la Unión. La Unión is a midsize neighborhood with a desire to improve itself. It is located in the district of Sallique, province of Jaén, region of Cajamarca, in the north sierra of Perú. The villagers work on agriculture and raising cattle. 
Mario has had a grocery store based out of his residence for the last 6 years. He has very good personal references and because of his good service and experiences he has a very good clientele. 
The purpose of the loan is to invest in expanding and diversifying the stock of his store to better serve the demand, likes, and preferences of his customers. By investing in his business Mario will make it sustainable and as such improve his quality of life.

loans.use: invest in expanding and diversifying the stock of his store.

loans.name: Kafaze

texts.en:
Kafaze wants to start a small dairy farm. So, to begin with, she will invest in the purchase of a dairy cow. Currently she takes care of her 5 goats, all of a good breed. With their milk, she makes cottage cheese which she sells at the local farmer's market. 

Kafaze is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children, aged 17, 15, and 14. Her husband works in a water company where he fills water bottles. Kafaze is lame, and so she receives a small monthly disability payment. 

The village where they live is known for its walnuts, persimmons, plums, and speckled beans. With the persimmons, plums, and grapes Kafaze cultivates, she is able to make and sell a local grappa or brandy known as ‘rakia’.

loans.use: to invest in a dairy cow and start a small dairy farm.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive  con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento, Omar tiene buenas condiciones de vida. No obstante, su trabajo es bastante estresante, puesto que se dedica a ser guardia de seguridad y quiere un credito para cubrir  sus gastos de estudios superiores. Omar es la unica persona que gana dinero en su casa, sus padres solo pueden apoyarlo con la vivienda, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Omar is a man of 23, he is single, doesn't have children and lives with his parents in La Paz in a house of brick and cement. Omar has good living conditions. However, his work is quite stressful, since he works as a security guard and wants a loan to cover the expenses of his higher education costs. Omar is the only person who earns money in his house; his parents can only support him with the home. Therefore he needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education costs.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia Nieves se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos,al socia por medio de este negocio y le va muy bien el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nieves continues working in the business of selling shoes. The member, by means of this business, it's going very well for her. The member's dream is to grow the shoe sale business. The member is asking for a loan to buy shoes.

The member is happy because of the loan and commits herself to fulfilling the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana is a 43-year-old married mother of two children. She started four years ago working as a makeup artist and manicurist from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Maryana has professional skills in this field and has a good reputation among her customers. 

Today, Maryana is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary makeup and manicure tools to better satisfy her customers. Maryana hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary makeup and manicure tools

loans.name: Shafa Deborah

texts.en: Shafa Debora is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Elkana, Hope, and Diyana.  Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Shafa Debora would have had to sell her maize at a low price soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as buying food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shafa Debora can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. The loan will be used to pay for immediate living expenses while she waits to sell her maize. When asked, Shafa Debora spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children so they can have skilled jobs.

loans.use: to pay for living expenses such as school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her corn at a low price at harvest.

loans.name: Nhóm 05,thôn Tiến 14,quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Ngâu is 61 years old and is married with nine children. Ngâu supports no dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Ngâu is the group leader of the Nhóm 05,Thôn Tiến 14, Quảng Nham Group, which consists of seven members. 

Ngâu operates a small restaurant selling fast food for breakfast. She is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make the food to sell. Ngâu has been involved in this business for five years. In 2010, Ngâu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngâu has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. In the future, Ngâu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase food to cook breakfast for sale

loans.name: José Eulogio

texts.es:
José es un ejecutivo de venta tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompañado y junto con su compañera de vida tiene una niña de 5 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando, José vive con su compañera de vida y su hija. Su compañera de vida se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuido de su hija, mientras que José trabaja como repartidor de gas desde hace mas de 1 año, también trabaja como agricultor (siembra de maíz) desde hace 10 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres y por la economía en que vivían, para llegar a su trabajo José camina 1 kilometro, su horario es de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm, en sus ratos librse enseña a tocar a un grupo musical.

 El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una motocicleta para transportarse a su lugar de trabajo, le ayudara mucho porque teniendo motocicleta tendrá un poco mas de ingresos y con eso él espera poder darle a su familia lo necesario para salir adelante. Los sueños de José es tener un terreno agrícola, que su hija estudie mucho para que sea profesional y llegar a tener un negocio.
texts.en:
José, 30, is a sales executive.  He's in a relationship and his life partner has a five-year-old daughter who attends school.  José lives with his companion and her daughter.  His companion is a homemaker and takes care of her daughter, and José has worked distributing gas for more than a year.  He also has worked for 10 years as a farmer growing corn, a job he learned from his parents because of the economy in which they were living.  José works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m., and he walks a mile to get to work.  In his free time he teaches a band how to play music.

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy a motorcycle so he has transportation to work.  It will help him a lot because, with the motorcycle, he'll have a little more income with which he hopes to be able to give his family what they need to get ahead.

José's dreams are to have a plot of farmland, for his daughter to study a lot so she can become a professional, and to have a business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation to work

loans.name: Yostus

texts.en: Yostus used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children and to buy buy bars and doors for his hardware business. He is a 51-year-old married man with 12 children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Yostus has a dream of educating his children up to university level. Yostus is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Yostus wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Las Milagrosas Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá con conocer su situación de vida, y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, lo que quiere decir que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo. Ella es manicurista y tiene muchos clientes que siempre le piden sus servicios, es por eso que ya es muy conocida en el barrio.
Su sueño es poder crecer como microemprendedora y poder mejorar su trabajo. Pide este préstamo para la compra de limas, alicates, esmaltes, acetonas y demás, de manera a ir cumpliendo con su meta.
texts.en:
There are 20 women that make up this group. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, which permits them to learn about their life situation, and be able to work accordingly. 

One of the members is María, who in her last questionnaire, showed a poverty level inside level 3, which means that with by effort and continuous work. She is a manicurist and has many clients who always ask for her services. It's because of this that she is already known in the neighborhood.

Her dream is to be able to grow as a microentrepreneur and be able to improve her work. She is applying for this loan to buy files, tips, polishes, acetone and more, and in this manner fulfill her goal.

loans.use: to buy files, tips, polishes, acetone and more to continue with manicuring service.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy es un hombre de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 19 y una hija de 22 años y trabaja como empleado público.
Él es responsable, constante y trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ que se encuentra a 14 km. de la ciudad, antiguamente fue capital de una gran parte del trópico y tiene como principales atractivos turísticos: La feria del Chicharrón, en el mes de junio, es visitada cada año por cientos de comensales. En este municipio tienen sus viviendas de residencia la mayoría de los agricultores que desarrollan actividades en el trópico, estas residencias de Sacaba son usadas cuando sacan sus productos del trópico a comercializarlos en la ciudad.
Eloy es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello corto negro, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español. su vida la realiza con su esposa que viaja constantemente debido al comercio que realiza y sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Toda la familia vive en una casa a medio construir y cuentan con electricidad y agua de pozo. Él trabaja como Policia, labor que viene realizando desde hace quince años, y tiene como funciones características: la vigilancia del tráfico en vías interurbanas, custodia de vías de comunicación, velar por el cumplimiento de las normas que tiendan a la conservación de la naturaleza y el medio ambiente entre otras. Su sueño es ver concluida la construcción de su casa. Él desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en el baño, la cocina y la lavandería para el bienestar de su familia; “llevo cinco años tratando de terminar la construcción de mi hogar, ladrillo a ladrillo y piedra por piedra la terminaré, lo único que quiero es que mi familia viva como se lo merece”. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eloy solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en la cocina, baño y lavandería de su casa para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Eloy is a man of 42, he lives with his wife, he has a son of 19 and a daughter of 22 and works as a public employee. He is responsible, tenacious and hardworking. He carries out his work in the town of Sacaba, which is 14 km from the city. In the past, it was the capital of a large part of the tropics and it has the following main tourist attractions: the chicharrón fair, in the month of June, is visited each year by hundreds of diners. The majority of the farmers who carry out activities in the tropics have their homes in this municipality; these residences of Sacaba are used when they take their products from the tropics to sell them in the city.

Eloy has tanned skin, is of medium stature, has short black hair. His native language is Quecha and he speaks Spanish. He carries out his life with his wife who travels constantly due to the business she does and her children study in school. All of the family live in a halfway-constructed house and they have electricity and well water. He works as a policeman, work that he's been doing for the past fifteen years, and has the following characteristics: watching traffic on the intercity roads, safekeeping the roads, ensure that the rules that guard the conservation of nature and the environment are followed, among others. 

His dream is to see the construction of his house completed. He wishes to carry out the installation of potable water in the bathroom, the kitchen and the laundry room for the good of the family. "I've been trying to finish the construction of my home for five years, brick by brick and stone by stone. I will finish it, the only thing I want is that my family lives like they deserve." This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the 15 years that he's been carrying out this activity.

It's for these reasons that Eloy is applying for a loan for the installation of potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to install potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of the house for the wellbeing of the family.

loans.name: Jesus Divino Amor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS DIVINO AMOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelida Nancy ella es soltera y tiene 38 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y venta de zapatos, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos y tambien zapatos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas y zapatos.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de textiles, negocio de venta de artesania negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Jesús Divino Amor Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Nelida Nancy, 38.  She's single and has two children.  She works in her clothing and shoe business selling pants, blouses, and t-shirts as well as shoes.  She has several years of experience in this business and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a store.

Nelida Nancy's requesting the loan to buy shoes, t-shirts, sweaters, blouses, and shoes.  She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this means and promises to make her payments punctually.

The other members work in a textile business, a handcraft business, a grocery store, and a restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, t-shirts, sweaters, and blouses

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata. She is single and has two children aged 13 and 7. In 1998, Aminata established her rice, bean, groundnut and palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family. Her main customers are all ages. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,420,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy additional rice, beans and groundnuts. She hopes that this loan will add to her present stock and increase her profit. In the future, Aminata plans to build a store and to grow more groundnuts. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for rice, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Janelard

texts.en: Janelard used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children who had to prepare themselves to sit for final examinations, which they have finished. Janelard has a dream of educating her children and expanding her palm oil business. Janelard is faced with the challenges of market competition and limited capital. Janelard wants a loan to buy more palm oil for selling.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for selling.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Samuel is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses such as clothing and food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 23-year-old married mother of two children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, five years ago she started working as a manicurist and makeup artist from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Marwa is working hard to provide her children with a better living situation, thus she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house and make it a better and healthier place for her family.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny es una joven muy emprendedora, es madre soltera de una pequeña niña quien es el principal motor de su vida para salir adelante. Por iniciativa propia empezó a trabajar desde muy joven en diferentes lugares y con mucho esfuerzo pudo abrir su propio negocio de fabricación de calzados para hombres de excelente calidad. Ella permanece durante todo el día en su taller porque quiere mejorar su producción y así captar más clientes.
En estos momentos Jenny necesita mercadería para poder continuar con la fabricación de sus productos, por eso va a utilizar el crédito para comprar materiales como suelas, cuero, entre otros para continuar con su negocio. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque la estarán ayudando a hacer crecer su empresa. Más adelante espera poder ampliar su negocio y darle todo lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Jenny is a a very entrepreneurial young woman. She is the single mother of a little girl who is the main driving force in her life pushing her to succeed. On her own initiative she started working in different places when she was very young, and with a lot of effort she was able to start her own business making excellent quality men's shoes. She stays in her shop all day because she wants to improve her production and in doing so gain more clients.

At the moment, Jenny needs goods to be able to continue making her products, so she will use the loan to buy materials like soles and leather, among other things, to continue with her business. She is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva for their generosity because they will be helping her grow her business. In the future she hopes to be able to further expand her business and give all the best things to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy the materials (leather, soles) for her business making shoes.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village in the state of Kaduna. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Dauda, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses such as food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jesus Clemente

texts.es: Jesus de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la confección de uniformes escolares su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jesus quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando tres puertas metálicas y dos ventanas, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de balcones, laminas, chapas, vidrios para ventana y pago de mano de obra y así puedan vivir más cómodos y seguros con su familia.
texts.en: Jesus is 39 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and three children.  He makes and sells school uniforms from his home and is able to pay his household expenses with what he earns, but it’s not enough, so he is asking for a loan so he can make some improvements to his home.  He wants to install three metal doors and two windows.  He will use the money to buy window sills, metal, doorknobs, window panes, and pay for labor so that he and his family can feel safer and more comfortable.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Stanley, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 47-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of his family, with a wife and three children, he farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kerugoya in the Central region of Kenya. For the past 15 years, he has been practicing mixed farming. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs and crop selling. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. Stanley passionately loves dairy farming. The biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. 

He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter and another quality breed of dairy cow. The chaff cutter will assist Stanley in cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage to feed his cows. Also, it will aid the animals' digestion and prevent the animals from rejecting any part of their food. Stanley also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be produce between 15 and 25 liters of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 KES per liter, and with this loan, he would make a cool US $11 per day. 

Before Stanley joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have any future promise for income generation. After training, Stanley now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the millionaires' club. 

With the loan, Stanley will increase his income from milk selling and his cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows, and through this loan, Stanley will achieve this. An increase in income will allow Stanley to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Stanley fears that his dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide its reliable market channel, credit facility, and services that he requires to grow his dairy enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter and a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el sector de Ucupe, donde la vida es muy tranquila y armoniosa. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María del Carmen se dedica a las actividad de cria y venta de animales con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, solicita préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno, dicha inversión le servirá para poder diversificar su negocio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 37 years old and lives with her husband and her youngest son in the sector de Ucupe, where life is very relaxed and harmonious. Her community works in agriculture, ranching and trade. She is located in the district of Lagunas, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

María del Carmen is in the business of raising and selling animals, with more than 5 years of experience in this business. Her business is located in the back of her home.  She is asking for a loan to buy cattle, which will diversity her business. This will allow her to increase her income within a short time and improve the quality of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle, which will diversify her business.

loans.name: Gloria En Lo Alto Group

texts.es: Gloria en lo Alto está integrado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras y laboriosas, es coordinado por la señora Maria Eugenia quien tiene la edad de 40 años, acompañada, se dedica a la comercialización de leche agria y gallo pinto en el mercado de Managua desde hace ocho años, ella tiene varios ciclos trabajando con la institución Adim y ha aprovechado los créditos anteriores en la compra de una mantenedora, mejora de vivienda para mantener su negocio ya aumentar su capital. Y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de productos lácteos, como leches, granos básicos, platos, vasos, bolsas, etc. Otra de las integrantes es Sandra quien tiene la edad de 25 años, comerciante de ropa en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace un año, la tercera socia Angélica una joven de 23 años de edad y quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace ocho años, y Rebeca de 30 años de edad es propietaria de una tienda de ropa nueva desde hace siete años.
texts.en:
Gloria en lo Alto [Glory on High] is composed of four enterprising and industrious women. The group is coordinated by Mrs. Maria Eugenia, 40, married, who is in the business of selling buttermilk and rice and beans in the market in Managua. She has been doing this for 8 years and she has been working the the ADIM Institution for several cycles and has used previous loans for the purchase of a refrigerated case, improved housing, and to maintain her business and increase her capital. She requests this loan for the purchase of dairy products such as milk, grains, plates, glasses, bags, and more. 

Another member is Sandra, 25, a clothing merchant in the most popular market in the capital since last year. The third is Angelica, a 23-year-old partner who has sold new clothes for 8 years. Rebecca, 30, has owned a shop for new clothes for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products and ingredients for rice and beans

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es: Doña Dora es una mujer creativa y laboriosa tiene la edad de 67 años, acompañada, y se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio desde hace veintisiete años y madre de un hijo quien es su deseo de superación para seguir adelante. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, pollo, carne, mesas, y sillas, etc. Con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado las ventas, compra de productos,  y mejoramiento del hogar para el crecimiento del negocio. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en los días de pago.
texts.en: Dora is a creative and industrious woman. She is 67, is married, and sells food at home. She has done this work for 27 years. She is the mother of a son who she hopes will succeed and move forward. The loan is for the purchase of dry goods, vegetables, fruits, sodas, chicken, beef, tables, chairs, and more. With her previous loans, she has improved sales, made purchases, improved her home, and grew her business. She has proven to be a responsible person with repayments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant like dry goods, fruits, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Marta es una mujer emprendedora  exitosa tiene la edad de 51 años de edad, casada, y madre de dos hijos quienes son su deseo de superación. Ella se dedica a la venta refrescos desde hace diez años, el crédito lo solicita para la inversión en la compra de frutas, bolsas de libra, refrigeradora, baldes, etc. Con el fin de satisfacer la demanda insatisfecha de su localidad y aumentar el capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Marta is a successful female entrepreneur of 51 years of age. She is a married mother of two. Her children are her desire to succeed. She has sold refreshments for ten years. She requests this loan for the purchase of fruit, bulk ingredients, a refrigerator, buckets, and more in order to satisfy the unmet demand for her business and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and ingredients for making refreshments

loans.name: Kholdona

texts.ru: Она Холдона. Ей 64 года. Холдона живет вместе с сыном, невесткой и тремя внуками. Ее сын рабочий-строитель. Муж Холдоны много лет назад скончался, и она работает на скотном дворе. На данный момент у нее трое маленьких козлят. Благодаря кредиту Холдона может купить крупнорогатого скота, который будет обеспечивать семью молоком. После откорма она продаст корову с наценкой. После Холдона приобретет еще одного скота. Вы можете помочь Холдоне в осуществлении ее планов.
texts.en: Kholdona is 64. Khaldona lives with her son, daughter, and three grandchildren. Her son is a construction worker. Kholdona's husband died many years ago, and she works in the cattle yard. Currently, she has three small kids (goats). Thanks to the loan, Kholdona can buy cattle which will provide the family with milk. After fattening it, she will sell the cow for a profit. Then, Kholdona will buy another cow.. You can help Kholdona implement her plans.

loans.use: buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bicycles

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are regulars. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES40,000 loan to buy more clothing inventory. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more clothing inventory

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami est âgée de 39ans. Elle a pour mari un huissier de justice et ils ont 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle revend des friperies à KPALIME et se fait aider par sa sœur. Avec son second crédit, madame Ami devrait acheter des marchandises. A l'avenir, avec le profit, elle espère prendre son propre contenaire et envoyer les enfants en Europe pour leurs études.
texts.en: Ami is 39 years old. She is married to a court bailiff, and they have four children, three of whom attend school. To help her partner with the family expenses, she sells secondhand clothing in KPALIME and is helped by her sister. With her second loan, Mrs. Ami is supposed to buy merchandise. In the future, with the profit, she hopes to buy her own space and to send her children to Europe for their studies.

loans.use: to buy packages of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 49-year-old married mother of four children; she started selling clothes a year ago to help her husband, who has limited income in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new clothes collection for the upcoming Christmas season.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business more to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new clothes collection

loans.name: Eunia

texts.en:
Eunia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She is not looking after any other family members.
 
She has been operating a retail shop for the last two years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more cooking fat, sugar, salt, flour and soft drinks for sale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to be able to open a branch in a busy trading center. 

She joined MCDT because of the success stories she heard from her friends who were already members of the organization.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar, salt, flour and soft drinks

loans.name: James Dante

texts.es:
James Dante tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

James Dante se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 06 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
James Dante is 41 years old, is unmarried and is responsible for a son. He lives in a family home in a rural zone of the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. His community works in agriculture, ranching and trade.

James Dante raises and sells corral animals. For the last 6 years his business has been located in the back of his home. He is asking for a loan to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks and hens. The loan will help him to have a greater investment, with the goal of expanding his business and satisfying the needs of his clients. This will allow him to increase his income within a short time, with the goal of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, ducks and hens.

loans.name: Las Socias Group

texts.es: Grupo las socias está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras de éxito, es coordinado por la señora Lisbeth de 29 años de edad acompañada, y se dedica a la venta de pizza. Y solicita el crédito para la compra pasta de tomate, harina, sartén, levadura, orégano, gas butano, queso, etc. Con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar las ventas y aumentar la demanda de los productos. La segunda socia es la señora Kenia  de 26 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace año y medio y finalmente la señora Rosa tiene la edad de 45 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, zapatos y productos Avon.
texts.en:
The Las Socias Group is composed of three entrepreneurs who are successful hardworking women. The group is coordinated by Mrs. Lisbeth, a 29-year-old married woman who sells pizza. She is requesting a loan to buy tomato paste, flour, a frying pan, baking powder, oregano, butane gas, cheese, and more. With her previous loans, she has improved sales and increased demand for her products. 

The second partner is Mrs. Kenia, 26, who has sold new clothes for a year and a half. Finally, Mrs. Rosa, 45, sells new clothes, shoes, and Avon products.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and equipment to make pizza

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto tiene 62 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Jacinto se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, además de su motocarguera de color rojo en la cual transporta sus heramientas con más de 20 años de experiencia brindando este servicio, Jacinto ofrece su servicios en el distrito de Oyotún y sus alrededores. Él solicita préstamo para compra y mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Jacinto piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 62 years old and single with no children. He lives with his family in a rural area in the district of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. His community is primarily dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Jacinto works offering services as a day laborer. He has his own tools, as well as his own red motorcycle and trailer that he uses to transport his tools. He has been offering these services for over 20 years. Jacinto offers his services in the district of Oyotún and surrounding districts. He is applying for this loan to buy and maintain equipment and tools. This investment will will allow him to have tools and equipment in better condition, which will greatly influence his business. Jacinto plans to improve productivity of his services and in that way be able to satisfy the diverse needs of the clients in his area.

loans.use: to buy and maintain tools and equipment.

loans.name: Dylaver

texts.en:
This is Dylaver a 55-year-old married father of six children. They are Romani, members of the most vulnerable ethnic community of Albania, and they are talented at selling items whether used or new. Some of them have been very successful at what they do and they have employed others as well. 

As seen in the picture, Dylaver buys and sells new cloth, raw fabric material for curtains and drapes, sheets, and other things. Dylaver doesn’t have a stable booth or stand where he sells because he moves around in other regions, and sometimes he goes to the neighboring country of Kosovo where he sells as well.

Dylaver is requesting this loan to buy raw fabric material to resell.

loans.use: to buy raw fabric material to resell

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq (5) femmes, les membres du groupe Kototala sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier  de N’Tomikorobougou à  Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, charbon du bois, savons et habits. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso   et  sont  à leur  2ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Djénéba (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car  le charbon est très prises par les femmes dans le marché N’Tomikorobougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Bamako.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à N’Tomikorobougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 25 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en: Made up of five women, the members of the Kototala group are for the most part married and live in polygamous households. They are on average 38 years old and have five children. They all live in the N’Tomikorobougou neighborhood in Bamako. They know each other through local borrowers’ groups and their businesses. The members of the group run different businesses, notably selling charcoal, soaps, and clothing. In the hopes of growing their businesses, they decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. Mrs. Djénéba (sitting to the far right in the photo) has a good reputation, as charcoal is highly sought after by the women at the N’Tomikorobougou market. She plans to use her loan to buy a truckload. She stocks up at the villages near Bamako. She manages her business with cash  in N’Tomikorobougou to a female clientele. Mrs. Djénéba foresees making a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which will be used to satisfy her needs and to invest in her business. Mrs. Djénéba has the goal of retaining the partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the most of a lot of future loans.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells scrap metal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of scrap metal. She hopes that in the future, she will build a house. This is her second loan with SMEP microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a maize farmer from Gwani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sunday would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sunday can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Sunday, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a big stall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a quality life and more profits. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kasminem

texts.en:
Kasminem has been a professional dressmaker for almost 26 years and her husband works as a welder in a rice company. They have two studying children. Two years back, Kasminem's leg was amputated and the doctors asked her for $2,000 dollars for a prosthesis. She had no money for this, so finally she made one (a false leg) by herself; now she helps others also. 

Kasminem wants to build a room where she can stitch clothes for sale. For this, she needs a loan of SRD 2,500. Currently, she is doing her work in the car garage.
