loans.use: to build a room where she can stitch the clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bigger tent for her fruit and vegetables and a parking place.

loans.name: Jecinter

texts.en:
Jecinter is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be enterprising. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to have a reputable salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a dairy cow. This is her first loan with SMEP microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Nuevo Chichiltote Group

texts.es: Grupo las Chichiltote está conformado por cinco mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras de éxito, es coordinado por la señora Hercilia de 34 años de edad acompañada, y se dedica a la venta de plata, productos Bogue y Zermat desde hace seis años. Y solicita el crédito para la compra productos como cadenas, pulseras de plata, anillos, perfumes, vanidades, cremas corporales, brillos labiales, crema de cabello, desodorantes etc. Lo que quiere lograr es mejorar las ventas y aumentar la demanda de los productos. La segunda socia es la señora Eda  de 36 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, la tercera socia es la señora Ana Isabel de 33 años de edad su negocio es la venta de tortillas, queso y crema. La cuarta socia es la señora Ana Cecilia de 30 años de edad comercializa fajas y doña Aracely tiene la edad de 37 años y se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sandalias y variedades de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The "Las Chichiltotes" group is formed by five entrepreneurial women who are striving for success. It is led by Señora Hercilia, who is 34 years old and is in a relationship. She has been selling silver and Vogue and Zermat [cosmetic] products for six years. She is applying for the loan to purchase products such as chains, silver bracelets, rings, perfumes, compacts, body creams, lip gloss, hair cream, deodorants, etc. What she wants to achieve is to improve her sales and increase the demand for her products. 

The second member of the group is Señora Eda, who is 36 years old and sells new clothing. The third member is Señora Ana Isabel, who is 33. Her business is selling tortillas, cheese, and cream. The fourth member is Señora Ana Cecelia, 30 years old, who sells sashes, and Doña Aracely is 37 years old and sells shoes, sandals, and a variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy products such as chains, silver bracelets, rings, perfumes, compacts, body creams, lip gloss, hair cream, deodorants, etc. to sell

loans.name: Segundo Juan

texts.es:
Segundo es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, nació en Moyobamba pero por razones de trabajo tuvo que viajar a la ciudad de Lima y vivió allí por casi un año. Actualmente ha regresado al Departamento de San Martín en donde diariamente alquilaba una mototaxi para poder trabajar, luego con muchísimo esfuerzo pudo comprarse su propio vehículo y ahora él brinda servicios de transporte por toda su ciudad. Segundo cree que le va bien porque día a día se esfuerza mucho y es muy responsable, amable y honesto.
Segundo tiene algunos problemas con su moto debido a que no le ha dado el mantenimiento respectivo, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder reparar el motor y hacer la limpieza correspondiente de su mototaxi. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto no tendrá problemas cuando se encuentre trabajando. Su mayor anhelo es poder construir su casa propia y tener una familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is a young man with many dreams of getting ahead. He was born in Moyobamba, but for work reasons he had to travel to the city of Lima and lived there for almost a year. Then he returned to the department of San Martin where he rented a mototaxi every day to be able to work. Later, with a lot of effort he was able to buy his own vehicle, and now he offers transportation services in the whole city. Segundo thinks it is going well for him because every day he works hard and is very responsible, friendly, and honest.

Segundo has some problems with his mototaxi because he has not maintained it. That is why he will use the loan to be able to repair the motor and perform cleaning on his mototaxi. He is very grateful for the Kiva lenders for their generosity. He wants them to know that with this help he won't have problems when he is working. His greatest desire is to be able to build his own house and have a family.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Beysi Denis

texts.es:
Beysi Denis tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y madre, en casa familiar, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí; ella goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Beysi Denis se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte público en mototaxi, desde hace más de 3 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en Cayaltí y anexos. Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de sus vehículos. De esta manera asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de sus herramientas de trabajo para poder seguir obteniendo ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beysi Denis is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her spouse and mother in a family house in a large community in the urban area of Cayaltí; she has good personal and employment references from her neighbors. Her community is primarily dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and trade. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Beysi Denis provides public transportation services in mototaxi. She has had the business for more than 3 years in Cayaltí and the surrounding area. She is requesting the loan to maintain and repair her vehicles. In this way, she can ensure the correct functioning of her work tools to continue making income and to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain and repair her vehicles.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer from Gayya village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Hauwa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zeudy Mabel

texts.es:
Zeudy Mabel tiene 26 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rustico junto a su hijo y padres. El domicilio del cliente se ubica en el distrito de Pucara en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias laborales y económicas.

La actividad que realiza el Zeudy Mabel es la de vender cerveza desde hace 03 años aproximadamente. El préstamo lo utilizará para incrementar su capital de trabajo y de esa manera poder adquirir una cantidad mayor de cerveza. Esta inversión le permitirá satisfacer toda la demanda que tiene y esto asu vez le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Zeudy Mabel is 26-years old. She lives in her family home, which is made of rustic materials, with her son and her parents. Zeudy Mabel's home is located in the Pucara District of Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region. The community she lives in is a small, rural area where all the residents know each other and give good work and financial recommendations.

For about the last three years, Zeudy Mabel's business has been selling beer. She will use the loan to increase her working capital and be able to acquire a greater quantity of beer. This investment will allow her to meet all the demand she has and at the same time improve her income in a short period of time. She will therefore be able to improve her own quality of life and that of her family as well.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and be able to acquire a greater quantity of beer for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 18 años y vive en Camana junto a su familia. Por cuestiones familiares y debido a la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Electrónica que tanto quería, es por ello que actualmente labora como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante y en sus tiempos libres vende golosinas. Él quiere tener mejores oportunidades más adelante, por eso se esfuerza cada día para obtener buenos resultados.
Miguel quiere mejorar la calidad e vida de su familia por ello va a utilizar el crédito para poder comprar algunos enseres para su casa. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque con ello su familia sentirá mayor comodidad y así continuará luchando porque más adelante quiere abrir su propio negocio: un taller de electrónica.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very entrepreneurial young man with a great will to get ahead. He is 18 years old and lives in Camana with his family. Because of family matters and due to the necessity to work, he was not able to study in the professional program in electronics that he so much wanted. It is for this reason that he now works as an assistant cook in a restaurant, and in his free time he sells candies. He wants to have better opportunities in the future, and so he makes an effort every day to obtain good results.

Miguel wants to improve the quality of life of his family. For this, he is going to use the loan to be able to buy some necessities for his house. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity because with this, his family will feel greater comfort and thus he will continue working, because in the future he wants to open his own business: an electronics workshop.

loans.use: to buy essentials to furnish his house and offer well-being to his family.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business four years. His business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Benson will use the 30,000 KES loan to service his motorcycle and buy farm inputs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Dan will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuktuk within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spares. His business goal is to own a tuktuk (auto-rickshaw) within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank

loans.use: buy motorcycle spares

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be focused, disciplined and determined. He operates a retail business where he makes shoes and is also repairing them. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. 

He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy materials for making and repairing shoes. His business goal is to own his own shoe shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and improve his life.

loans.use: to buy materials for making and repairing shoes

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
Jose Santos tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo, dedicado al comercio de animales de corral (patos, gallinas, entre otros) en el caserio de Matara. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Jose Santos se dedica a la venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos y pavos; desde hace año y medio en el Caserio Matara. El destino del crédito es para implementar su negocio, pues desea realizar la compra de una cantidad mayor de animales, y con esto incrementar sus ventas, pues podrá satisfacer toda la demanda insatisfecha de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Santos is 32-years old and lives with his wife and youngest son. He makes his living selling barnyard animals (ducks, chickens and others) in the village of Matara. The people in his community primarily make their livings in agriculture, raising livestock and in trade. The community is located in Callacyuc District and Province in the Cajamarca Region of Perú's northern mountains.

For the last year-and-a-half, Jose Santos has made his living selling barnyard animals, such as chickens, ducks and turkeys, in the village of Matara. He will use the loan to aid his business. He wants to purchase a larger number of animals, which will increase his sales because he will be able to meet his customers' unmet need. This will allow him to improve his income in a short period of time and therefore improve his own quality of life and his family's as well.

loans.use: to aid his business by purchasing a larger number of animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sardines, Peak milk, sugar, and toilet rolls for resale.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a maize farmer from Pampaida Dutse village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahuza can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Yahuza, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To  meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Felix Leonardo

texts.es:
En San Lorenzo vive don FELIX. En uno de los barrios más vulnerables de san Lorenzo, donde no existe aun servicio de agua potable y alcantarillado. 
FELIX  de 23 años,  vio la oportunidad de en un espacio de su casa poner un local de  venta de bebidas refrescantes y aceites para motores.
Debido a que mucha gente del sector es contratada para realizar labores forestales y agrícolas- y requieren de estos insumos. FELIX invirtió el monto de este crédito en la compra de: gaseosas, yogurt, aguas minerales, jugos de frutas naturales, y bebidas hidratantes. Así cómo aceites para moto sierras, aceites de 2 tiempos para motores de podado.
FELIX vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 1 año. 
Su esposa se dedica al cuidado del hogar y a la venta de las bebidas refrescantes mientas FELIX se dedica a la venta de aceites y otros accesorios para actividades forestales.
Tiene deseos de ampliar su local y poder vender otro tipo de materiales, y alimentos balanceados.
texts.en:
FELIX lives in San Lorenzo, in one of the most vulnerable neighborhoods where there is no potable water service or sewage system.
FELIX is 23 years old. He saw the opportunity to use a space in his house to sell soft drinks and motor oils.

Because many people in the area are contracted to do forestry and agricultural work, and they require these supplies. FELIX invested the amount of this loan in buying sodas, yogurt, mineral water, natural fruit juices, and sports drinks, as well as oils for chainsaws, and oils for 2-stroke motors for pruning.

FELIX lives with his wife and their small 1 year old son. 

His wife takes care of the home and sells soft drinks while FELIX works selling oils and other accessories for forestry activities.

He hopes to expand his business and be able to sell other types of materials and balanced foods.

loans.use: to buy: oils for chainsaws, oils for 2-stroke motors for pruning, as well as sodas, yogurt, mineral water, natural fruit juices, and sports drinks.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Saratu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mai Unguwa

texts.en: Mai Unguwa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mai Unguwa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mai Unguwa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Mai Unguwa expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet expenses like clothing and food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bitman

texts.es: Bitman: Es un señor amable y alegre de 72 años de edad, casado con 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Desde hace más de 14 años que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.  Tiene una finca ubicada en la comunidad de Columbus, que localiza a 95 km y 3 horas del municipio de Puerto de Cabezas. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar cerdos pequeños, para su engorde y comercialización y sembrar frijoles. Su sueño es contar con una producción diversificada y mejorar sus rendimientos.
texts.en: Bitman is a friendly and happy 72-year old man.  He is married with five grown children who live independently from him.  For more than fourteen years, Bitman has made his living in agriculture and by raising livestock.  He has a farm located in the community of Columbus, which is 95 km and three hours from Puerto de Cabezas.  Bitman is requesting a second loan so he can purchase young pigs to fatten and sell and so he can plant beans.  His dream is to have diversified production and to improve his yields.

loans.use: to purchase young pigs to fatten and sell and to plant beans.

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
Eustquio tiene 49 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserio El Arenal distrito Santo Tomas, Eustquio es nacido en caserio, él se lleva bien los miembros de su sector, caserío y pobladores del distrito de Santo Tomas; Eustquio cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua; está ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Eustquio es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su tercer año de producción tiene 4 años de edad, cultiva café en caserio El Arenal del distrito de Santo Tomás, actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cria animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 has. de café en fase de brote floral, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eustquio is 49 years old. He has a stable home with his partner and their three minor children. He lives in his own single floor house made of rustic materials located in the village of El Arenal in the district of Santo Tomas. Eustquio was born in the village. He gets along well with the members of his area, the village, and residents of the Santo Tomas district. Eustquio has good personal and professional references in the area. His home has water services and is located in the Santo Tomás district in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. His community is primarily dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Eustquio grows coffee. He currently has 2 hectares of a disease-resistant variety. The plantation is 4 years old and in its third year of production. Eustquio grows coffee in the village of El Arenal in the Santo Tomás district. It is an activity he has done for 4 years; he has experience in the field of growing coffee. He also raises young animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and grows bread products. The loan will be used to maintain and cultivate 1 hectare of coffee in the floral bud stage, ensuring a good production for 2015 which will be reflected in a higher sales volume. That way he will make greater profits and be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate 1 hectare of coffee in the floral bud stage.

loans.name: Fatou Kine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 02 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 14 novembre 2009. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier et les environs. Les membres sont solidaires et vivent dans la bonne entente. Leur principale est le commerce.
Aïssata, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est divorcée sans enfant. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de denrées alimentaire. Elle a ouvert une échoppe qu'elle gère elle-même. Elle s'approvisionne chez les grossistes de la place. Elle fait cette activité depuis longtemps et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle achète 05 cartons de bidons d'huile de 05 litres à 17000 F le carton, qu'elle revend à 5000 F le bidon de 05 L. Elle achète 10 sacs de riz à 12000 F le sac qu'elle revend à 13000 F. 05 carton de pots de tomate concentré GM acheté à 14000 F qu'elle revend à 2500 F le pot. 05 carton de pots de tomate PM acheté à 11800 F qu'elle revend à 1200 F le pot. 04 cartons de savon à 3000 F le carton de 24 morceaux PM et 03 cartons de savon à 9000 F le carton de 24 morceaux GM qu'elle revend en détail entre 250F le morceaux PM et 450 F le morceaux GM. Elle paie une charrette à 2000 F pour le transport des marchandises.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of 2 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on November 14, 2009. It is composed of members living in and around the same district. The members have solidarity and get along well. Their main work involves commerce. Aïssata, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 52 years old. She is divorced and has no children. For work, she does commerce in grocery items. She opened a store she manages herself. 

She gets her supplies from local wholesalers. She has been in this business for a long time and has good experience in this domain. She purchases five boxes of 5-liter containers of oil for 17,000 francs that she resells at 5,000 francs per 5-liter container. She purchases ten sacks of rice for 12,000 francs per sack that she resells at 13,000 francs; five boxes of canned tomato paste [large size] for 14,000 francs that she resells at 2,500 francs per can; five boxes of canned tomatoes [small size] for 11,800 francs that she resells at 1,200 francs per can; four boxes of soap for 3,000 francs per box containing 24 bars [small size], and three boxes of soap for 9,000 francs per box containing 24 bars [large size] that she sells retail from 250 francs a bar [small] and 450 francs a bar [large]. She pays 2,000 francs for a cart to transport the merchandise. 

With the profits, she plans on bolstering her savings.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Norma Debora

texts.es:
DEBORA tiene 30 años de edad- 3 hijos y vive con su esposo en San Lorenzo.
Ella inició su actividad comercial con un pequeño bazar, poco a poco fue creciendo en este negocio y cada vez se preocupaba en satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, hasta llegar el momento de que en la actualidad pueda tener una tienda, bazar y papelería. este nuevo credito fue invertido en la compra de aceites- arroz - azucar - avena - frejol 
Se siente muy satisfecha de poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos a bajo costo y de calidad.
Ella además vende ropa por catalogo y le encanta realizar varias actividades.
Es muy dinámica y amigable. Características que la hacen ser querida por los vecinos y conocidos.
Con el crédito anterior ella lo invirtió en el bazar que improvisó  en su casa y Con este nuevo crédito ella pudo realizar su sueño de tener su tienda.
Comenta que es buena opción trabajar con FODEMI porque los requisitos que solicitan no son complicados y el crédito lo entregan en poco tiempo.
texts.en:
Norma Debora is 30 years old, has 3 children and lives with her husband in San Lorenzo. She started her business with a small bazaar, and bit by bit it grew into this business. She always worried about satisfying the necessities of her clients, until reaching the current moment in which she could have a shop, bazaar and stationary store. This new loan will be invested in buying oils, rice, sugar, flour and bean. She feels very satisfied with being able to offer her clients quality products at a low cost.

She also sells clothes from a catalog and she loves running all these businesses. She is very dynamic and friendly, characteristics that make her loved by her neighbors and acquaintances.

With the previous loan she invested in the bazaar that she improvised in her house. With this new loan she will be able to make her dream of having a store come true. She comments that it is a good option working with FODEMI because the requirements that they ask for aren't complicated and they deliver the loan in a short amount of time.

loans.use: este nuevo credito fue invertido en abastecerse de productos para su tienda, bazar y papelería. compra de aceites- arroz - azucar - avena - frejol

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Salim and Yamima. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Musa  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping eventually to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To meets expense like school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Drane

texts.en:
Drane, a 52-year-old married mother of one, sells fruits and veggies and other products such as dairy and olive oil, pickles, etc.; all these are freshly made from villagers and she buys from them.  Her husband sells dairy as well. She is requesting this loan to add some items to resell. 
 
Drane lives in the suburbia of the city of Elbasan and has a little primitive store where she sells her items. She lived in rural northern Albania prior to the recent location which she finds much better, regarding the weather and other living opportunities. 

Here is what she said during the interview: ”I and my family are better off living here versus our home village. Even though we all live in one room, there are still so many opportunities here to make money and we are glad that we made the decision to move, despite being very difficult in the beginning.”

loans.use: to add some more freshly made food items such as dairy, pickles, olive oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 35 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells second-hand clothing in Accra in Ghana, and requested a GHS 1,500 loan through ID-Ghana to buy one bale of second-hand clothing, which she will sell to customers. 

Cynthia has borrowed and repaid three loans from ID-Ghana before this loan. She has been selling second-hand clothing for eight years and earns good income. Cynthia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothing, which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Kasimu

texts.en:
Kasimu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Kasimu would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kasimu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Kasimu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money  for himself and his family.

loans.use: To meet expenses like clothing and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Manasseh, Phibi and Esther. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Dauda spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing by eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bello

texts.en: Bello is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bello joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sabiu, Sani and Ummar.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bello would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bello can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Bello  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing by eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Asabe, Ibrahim and Alheri.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Saratu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing by eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Cesar Arturo

texts.es: Cesar de 48 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Cesar está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Cesar is 48 years old and has been raising corn and beans for 30 years.  He sells his products at the nearby markets and lives with his wife in a home of his own.  Cesar is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticide, etc. to improve the land shown in the image so he can continue working and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes and shoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful businessman. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, two of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.

She has been selling human medicine at retail for the last three years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
She has requested for a loan of UShs 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more injections, anti-biotics, pain relievers, gloves and other clinic utensils for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and changes in prices. Her dream is to expand her drug shop to include professional personnel. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans and the weekly repayments.

She resides in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more injections, anti-biotics, and pain relievers.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is attending school. She is also looking after four of her deceased sister`s children.

She has been selling roasted cow and goat meat in a shop for the last twenty years, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT- SACCO to increase her stock of spices and meat and pay rent for her working premises. Her challenges include the high prices of meat and high rent. 

Her dream is to open up branches in other areas. She joined MCDT because of the good customer care exhibited by the SACCO Staff.

loans.use: To buy more spices and meat for roasting

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman who has seven children. She describes herself as honest. Jane operates a farm where she has grown crops for the past nine years. Her business is located in a fertile area and she has primary customers over a large scale. 

This is Jane's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large business. Jane will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself as honest. Esther operates a farm where she has grown crops for the past 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are over a large scale.

Esther describes her biggest business challenge as being the lack of finance. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: María Cacimira

texts.es:
María de 47 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad. Estudio hasta 4° grado de educación básica, dejo de estudiar debido al conflicto armado que pasaba el país en aquellos días. Su Esposo esa en el extranjero y poco le ayuda con el sostén de la casa, por lo que tiene que trabajar con sus hijos para mantenerse y salir adelante. 
María creció trabajando con sus padres en agricultura, ganadería y crianza de especies menores, ahora ganado, aves de corral y cerdos, tiene una tienda desde hace más de 12 años que atiende desde las 6:00 am hasta las 5:00 pm, en todo esto se involucran también sus hijos.
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 4 cerdos y el concentrado que necesitará para desarrollarlos, para que en cuestión de 4 a 5 meses pueda venderlos.
El sueño de María es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, con las ganancias de la venta de cerdos abastecer su tienda y con apoyo de CrediCampo mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María, 47, is married with four children, who are now grown.  She studied until 4th grade in primary school--she had to give up studying because of the armed conflict that was taking place in the country at that time.  Her husband is away from the country, and doesn’t help her very much with supporting the house, so she and her children have to work to support themselves and move forward.

María grew up working with her parents in agriculture, raising livestock and small animals; and now she raises cattle, poultry, and pigs. She has had a store for more than 12 years, which she runs from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Her children help her with everything.

The loan will be used to purchase 4 pigs, and the feed that she will need to raise them, so that she can sell them in about 4 or 5 months. 

María’s dream is that her children may complete their educations.  She will stock her store with the earnings from the sale of the pigs; and with CrediCampo’s support, she will improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs and feed.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad sy solo el mayor estudia segundo grado de educación básica, estudió hasta 3° grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa y cría cerdos y aves de corral. Desde pequeño se crio con su hermano y con el apoyo de su abuela, sus padres se fueron al extranjero para trabajar y apoyarlos económicamente.
José es agricultor de granos básicos, frijol y maíz, además cría ganado en pequeña escala, trabajos que aprendió y desempeña muy bien gracias a su hermano pues le enseño todo lo que sabe, también apoya a su esposa con los cerdos y en ocasiones ella lo apoya con el ganado. Camina cerca de 45 minutos a través de colinas y veredas para llegar al lugar de la siembra.
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos novillas para aumentar su hato ganadero y en el futuro venderlas o dejarla para producción de leche.
texts.en:
José, who is 28 years old, has a partner and two children, ages 9 and 5. Only the older one is in school, in the second grade of basic education. José went to school through the third grade of basic education. His wife is a housewife and raises pigs and barnyard fowl. Since he was little, he was raised by his brother with the help of his grandmother. His parents went abroad to work and support them economically.

José is a farmer who raises basic grains, beans, and corn. In addition, he raises livestock on a small scale. He learned these jobs and does them very well thanks to his brother, since he taught him everything that he knows. He also helps his wife with the pigs, and sometimes she helps him with the livestock. He walks about 45 minutes through the hills and paths to arrive at his plantings.

He will use the loan to buy two heifers to increase his herd of livestock, and in the future he will sell them or keep them for milk production.

loans.use: to buy two heifers

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en:
Ishaku is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ishaku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yohana, Elcana and Blesin.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Ishaku  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure that his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To meet expenses like child school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en: Salisu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Salisu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hafsa, Azimu and Asiya.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Salisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Salisu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing by eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nyame Kwan Group

texts.en:
John is a member of Nyame Kwan group. He is 69 years old and happily married with 5 children. All of his children are working now, except his youngest who is presently attending a teacher's training college. His other 4 children are also farmers. John lives with his wife in Abura Enyinabrim in the Central Region of Ghana. 

John has been a farmer for 28 years. His farm is at two different locations. The first site is where he has an orange, cocoa and oil palm plantation, and on the second farm he grows cassava, plantain and cocoyam (taro, a root crop). He earns his entire living from his farming activities. John and the rest of his group members belong to the locally-registered Citrus Farmers Association that coordinates the marketing and capacity building of their members. John is finding it difficult to obtain a micro loan locally to finance the cost of maintaining his farms. He used to maintain the farms alone during his prime years; however, as he ages, his physical strength cannot cope with the maintenance demands. A micro-loan will help John to hire labourers to weed the farm, and buy fertilizer and food fly traps. The loan will help John to increase his profit significantly, and his profits will far exceed the loan he needs to invest in his farms now. John  thanks all the micro-lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To weed the farrm, and buy fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en: Lawan is a maize farmer from Kaza village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lawan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Lawan, like other members of Babban Gona, he intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meets expense like food and clothing by eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра уроженка района Кубадиён. Кубадиён находиться на юго-западной части Таджикистана, одна из самых теплых мест в Таджикистане. Зухра проживает на данном районе мужем и детьми. Ей 35 лет. Зухра в течение трех лет занимается животноводством. За столь период она освоила эту деятельность до мелочей и считает, что пора развивать  бизнес и продвинуться на новый уровень. Зухра приняла решения обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить большое количество скотов и увеличить поголовья скотин. Постепенно бизнес будет расти, что принесет в дом новые экономические возможности.
texts.en: Zuhra lives in Kubadiyon, which is located in the south-western part of Tajikistan, one of the warmest places in Tajikistan. Zuhra lives in the area with her husband and children. She is 35 years old. Zuhra has been working in animal husbandry for three years. During this time, she has mastered these skills, and she believes that it is time to develop her business and move it to the next level. Zuhra decided to ask for a loan to buy a large number of cattle and increase her herd. Gradually, the business will grow, which will bring home new economic opportunities.

loans.use: buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making metallic boxes

loans.name: Ghazieh

texts.en: Ghazieh, a mother of four children, is the sole income source for her family, especially after her husband’s retirement. She gains revenue thanks to her vegetable shop which she opened in 2012. And today, with her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will buy needed goods and some supplies as she is willing to develop her business and grow it more and more. Ghazieh has lots of plans in her mind that definitely will respond to her business needs; therefore she confirms that more Kiva loans will help her reach her goals.

loans.use: buy needed goods and some supplies

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Adzovi vit avec son conjoint et leurs 02 enfants à KPALIME lieu où son activité se déroule. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et revend en même temps des sacs et chaussures depuis 2002. A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, madame Adzovi demande un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. A l'avenir elle souhaite disposer d'une boutique et quitter sa maison familiales pour sa propre maison.
texts.en: Adzovi lives with her husband and their two children in Kpalime, where she also works.  By training, she is a hairdresser but she has also been reselling bags and shoes since 2002.  As it is almost the Holiday Season, Adzovi is taking a second loan to buy goods, so that she can meet the demand from her customers.  In the future, she would like to have her own store and her own house, as her family currently lives with relatives.

loans.use: to buy shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Bassma

texts.en: Bassma is a 26-year-old single woman from Lebanon living with her parents and three siblings. 10 years ago, she got the idea of getting involved in the hairdressing occupation, a work which she really likes. We note that Bassma worked at a young age so that she can help her parents in paying the high costs of living. At present, she needs to buy materials and supplies. To get this done, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Bassma is confident that this loan will only impact positively on her business and personal life as well.

loans.use: buy materials and supplies

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Nabila is a 32-year-old married woman from Lebanon with three children. Fourteen years ago, she started to run a home business which consists of serving female clients with hairdressing services. Over the years, she became well talented with a good business reputation. And today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase supplies and renew some tools with the aim of enhancing her skills. In the future, Nabila states that she will ask for additional Kiva loans as she badly wants to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: purchase supplies and renew some tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru:
Акрам родился в городе Истаравшан. Его детство прошло в Зафарабадском районе. Ему 56 лет. Женат и имеет четырех детей. Его жену зовут Мавджуда, она домохозяйка. Акрам хороший и трудолюбивый мужчина. Он очень любит свою семью.
        Акрам работает таксистом.Он перевозит людей от посёлка Зарнисор до базара и зарабатывает в день от 40 до 60 сомони. 
        Акрам  в дальнейшем хочет  сотрудничать с МДО Арванд и взять потребительский кредит на ремонт своего дома. Акрам заранее благодарит за доверие и взаимопонимание. СПАСИБО - «АРВАНД»!!!
texts.en:
Akram was born in the city of Istaravshan. He spent his childhood in the Zafarabad area. He is 56 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife's name is Mavzhuda. She a housewife. Akram is a good and hardworking man. He loves his family very much.

Akram drives a taxi. He transports people from the village of Zarnisor to the bazaar and earns from 40 to 60 TJS a day.

Akram wants to continue to work with MDO Arvand and take out a loan to repair his house. Akram would like to thank you for your belief in him and understanding. THANK YOU, Arvand!!!

loans.use: buy building materials.

loans.name: Najiyu

texts.en: Najiyu is a maize farmer from Kankanki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Najiyu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Najiyu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Najiyu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing by eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur KARIM  est né vers 1971 à MASSAKANA, père de 5 enfants, marié et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à BANCONI un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur KARIM mène des activités d’achat et de vente des pneus et des jantes  il ya plus de 10 ans, il s'approvisionne à BAMAKO.
 Il est à son troisième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 30 pneus de vélo de marque différentes et 30 jantes de vélo pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
 Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 francs CFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Mr. Karim was born around 1971 in MASSAKANA. A married father of five, he lives in his own house with his wife in a traditional family in BANCONI, a popular neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. Mr. Karim has been running a tire and rim business for more than ten years. He stocks up in BAMAKO. He is on his third individual loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in the hopes of satisfying his ever-increasing clientele. This loan will allow him to buy 30 bike wheels of different brands and 30 bike rims to sell at retail at the market to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. He envisions earning a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to repay the loan with interest and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and rims

loans.name: Illimani - 27 Group

texts.es:
Benita es una mujer de 50 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 22 años y tres hijas de 18, 15 y 10 años, y su negocio es la confección y venta de tejidos a máquina. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, responsable, constante y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en ferias y mercados  de la zona cruce ‘villa Adela’ lugar caracterizado por ser el nexo que une varias zonas de la ciudad, donde existen paradas de transporte público para todas las ubicaciones de este lugar, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura ambiente de 8-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Benita es de tez  morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, viste de manera tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, la hija mayor cursa estudios superiores a nivel técnico. Toda la familia vive en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, gas y electricidad. Gracias a una invitación de una amiga comerciante, se unió a una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, venta de vajillas, venta de muebles, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero, venta de salteñas y confección de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos para la venta. Ella realiza ropa de bebe, suéter para adulto, gorros de lana y otros, en su máquina de tejer. Una vez realizado y con una buena cantidad de productos se dirige a las ferias y mercado cargada de una bolsa llena de tejidos para ofertarlos en la calle y al paso de la gente. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda propia donde pueda exponer variedad de tejidos. Ella desea realizar la compra de lana por mayor, para tener material de trabajo para poder confeccionar y vender variedad de tejidos en las fiestas de fin de año.
Es por esos motivos que Benita solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor y tener material de trabajo para ofertar sus productos a fin de año.
texts.en:
Benita is a 50-year old woman. She is married, has one 22-year old son and has three daughters, who are 18-, 15- and 10-years old respectively. Her business is making and selling machine woven goods.

Benita is enterprising, independent, a good mother, responsible, persevering and hard-working. She sells her goods on the street at the festivals and markets in the crossroads of ‘Villa Adela.’ This is an area known for being the link that unites various areas in the city. There are a lot of public transportation stops that serve the area. The climate is cold and dry with an average year-round temperature of 8-12 degrees Celsius.

Benita has a dark-skinned complexion, is medium height, has black hair that she wears in a long braid and wears traditional clothing (a hat, shawl and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, and she also speaks Spanish. Benita lives her life with her husband, who works in construction, and her children, who go to school. Benita's eldest daughter is furthering her education with technical studies. The whole family lives together in their own home. They have potable water, gas and electricity.

Thanks to the invitation of business friend, Benita joined a communal bank with people whose businesses include: selling empanadas, selling cosmetics, selling seasonal clothing, selling flatware, furniture sales, selling quilts, making leather wallets, selling meat pies, and making skirts. They came together to request a loan and improve their businesses. Benita's business is making woven goods to sell. She makes baby clothing, adult sweaters, woolen hats and other items on her weaving machine. Once she has made a good amount of products, Benita goes to the festivals and markets loaded with a bag full of woven goods to sell on the street and to passersby. Her dream is to expand her business and have her own store where she could show a variety of woven goods. Benita wants to purchase wholesale wool so she will have work supplies to make and sell her textiles at the year-end festivals.

These are the reasons that Benita is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale wool and to have work supplies to sell her products at the end of the year.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale wool so she can have materials for her work and sell her products at the end of the year.

loans.name: Ruth De La Paz

texts.es:
Ruth de 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos ambos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo es chofer de una ruta de buses, Ruth cuida a sus hijos mientras su esposo trabaja.
Ruth está cursando su último año en la escuela de enfermería, estudia los días martes, miércoles y viernes y por las tardes realiza sus prácticas en el hospital de la ciudad, los fines de semana vende panes con pollo y pupusas para ayudar a su esposo con el sostén de la familia y para costear las clases y los viajes en autobús hasta el lugar donde estudia..
El préstamo será utilizado para cancelar los derechos de graduación en la universidad donde estudia y para cubrir otros gastos que tienen que ver con su graduación.
Ruth sueña con seguir especializándose en la rama de la medicina, también que sus hijos triunfen en el estudio y algún día poner ladrillo de piso en su casa.
texts.en:
Ruth, who is 28 years old, is married and has two children. Both go to the school in the community. Her husband is a driver on a bus route. Ruth cares for the children while her husband works.

Ruth is in her last year of nursing school. She goes to school on Tuesdays, Wednesdays,  and Thursdays, and in the afternoons she does her practical training in the city hospital. On the weekends, she sells chicken sandwiches and pupusas [filled corn tortillas, a typical Salvadoran dish] to help her husband support the family and to pay for her classes and the bus trips to the place where she goes to school.

The loan will be used to pay graduation fees at the university where she studies and to cover other expenses that are related to her graduation.

Ruth dreams of continuing to specialize in the field of medicine, and also that her children succeed in school, and someday to put a brick floor in her house.

loans.use: to pay her university graduation fees.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Peter would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Peter can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Peter, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing by eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fidrit

texts.en:
Fidrit wants to repair the little tricycle or ‘motorcar’ called here locally; he is called to transport mostly construction supplies with it, but also for moving. “I havae clients all the time, in the city and the villages around; clientele is not a problem at all for the moment and I foresee it remaining as such for years to come. Albania is still poor and the part of the country where I live, I think is one of the poorest,” said Fidrit to the Branch Assistant who interviewed him.

Fidrit is 54 years old and lives with his retiree mother.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle he uses to make a living

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Haruna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Nathan, Famela and Nehemiah.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

Saratu will use this loan to store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Saratu  plans to use the additional income to educate her children so that they may grow up to  have professional jobs.

loans.use: to store her maize.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Joy, Clopas and Jona.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

Musa will use this loan to store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  Musa  plans to use the additional income to educate his children so that they may grown up and  have professional jobs.

loans.use: to store his maize.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim is a 22-year-old married woman with one child. Her husband is a taxi driver and works very hard to pay everyday expenditure as he is the only income source of the family. To increase the revenues and profits and live in better conditions, Rim opened a clothing store in 2010. She is a friendly person and always welcomes customers in a pleasant way and that’s what pushes her clientele to come over and over again to buy her products. 

With her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will buy a wide variety of clothes from the new winter collection in order to meet both the market’s and clients' expectations.

loans.use: buy a wide variety of clothes

loans.name: Osmer Germain

texts.es:
Osmer Germain tiene 23 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada de material rustico, junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Osmer Germain es la de prestar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi desde hace un año. El financiamiento lo necesita para compra de llantas y mejoras en su unidad vehicular, con lo que podrá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su unidad de trabajo, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Germain is 23 years old and lives in a rustic rented home along with his wife and daughter in the Pucara district.  Its population farms, raises livestock, and works as merchants within the Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in northern Peru.

Osmer Germain has been driving a moto-taxi for a year and needs this loan to buy tires and make improvements to his vehicle to ensure that it’s in proper working order.  This will allow him to improve his income in the short term and improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and perform maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Marilu

texts.es:
María Marilu tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

María Marilu se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, compra de más mercadería, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio; María Marilu piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Marilu is 42 years old, married, and has no children to care for.  She lives with her family in the rural area of Oyotun, within the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  Her’s is an agricultural and merchant community.

María Marilu sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, eggs, soups, etc. and has been doing this for more than 10 years.  She runs her business out of her home and is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales.

María Marilu wants to increase her inventory so she can meet her customers’ different needs, requirements, and likings.  This will allow her to increase her sales and earnings in the short term and eventually her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, dedicado a la cria y comercialización de animales menores(cerdos, pavos, entre otros). Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. La misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Artemio se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores(cerdos, pavos, etc), desde hace 4 años, en el Caserio Santa Clara. El préstamo lo desea para invertir en el negocio de animales menores(cerdos, pollos, pato, etc); para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales y así poder cumplir co todos los gustos y preferencias de su publico consumidor; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Artemio is 42 years old and with his wife and three children in the Pucara district.  Its population farms, raises livestock, and works as merchants within the Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in northern Peru.  He has been raising and selling small animals (pigs, turkeys, etc.). for four years in Santa Clara.

He is asking for this loan to buy small animals (pigs, chickens, ducks, etc.) so he can increase and diversify his stock and be able to meet his customer’s needs.  This will allow him to increase his sales and earnings in the short term and eventually his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Хусан молодой парень в возрасте 23 лет. Хусан живет в многодетной семье и родителям Хусана приходиться трудиться целый день, чтобы обеспечить семью. Мама Хусана работает дояркой на скотоводческой ферме. Отец работает разнорабочим на частной стройке. Сам Хусан получил неполное среднее образование так, как у родителей не было возможности дать ему достойное образование. Хусан является старшим ребенком в семье и видя как родителям приходиться трудно обеспечивать семью он решил заняться животноводством. Хусан осуществляет эту деятельность уже 3 года. Начинал Хусан с малого, всего с одного барана. Постепенно Хусан увеличил поголовье скота на 2 коровы и 4 барана. Сейчас бизнес Хусана является основным источником дохода для семьи. Хусан хочет чтоб младшие братья получили достойное образование и не мучились в жизни как родители. На данный момент в связи с упадком цен на скот у Хусана возникли проблемы с финансами. Хусан решил взять кредит и обратился с этой просьбой в "АРВАНД". На полученные деньги Хусан хочет взять корм для скота и пару ягнят. Хусан заранее благодарен организации "АРВАНД" за предоставление банковских услуг для малоимущих слоев населения.
texts.en: Husan is a young man, 23 years old. Husan is a member of a large family and lives with his parents. Husan has to work all day to provide for his family. Husan's mother works as a milkmaid on a cattle farm. His father works as a laborer on a private building site. Husan did not finish his secondary education since his parents were not able to provide him with a decent education. Husan is the oldest child in the family and, seeing how hard parents have to work to provide for his family, he decided to keep livestock. Husan has been doing this for three years. Husan started small, with only one sheep. Husan gradually increased the number of cattle to two cows and four sheep. Now, Husan's business is the main source of income for the family. Husan wants his younger brothers to receive a good education and not suffer in life as his parents have. Currently, because there has been a decline in cattle prices, Husan has had financial problems. Husan decided to take out a loan and thus approached Arvand. With the money, Husan wants to buy fodder and a couple of lambs. Husan would like to thank Arvand in advance for providing banking services for the poor.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed.

loans.name: Ferdinant

texts.en:
Ferdinant requests this loan to pay for his wife Elena's school fees.  She takes finance courses part time courses at the public university in their city of Korca.

Elena has a degree in another field but is required to have a degree in economics, also because she is working in the accounting department. 

Ferdinant owns a car service with his father and Elena works with the blind association in their city. Their parents, who receive a retirement pension,  live with them.

loans.use: to pay for  his wife's tuition.

loans.name: File

texts.en:
File requests a loan to help pay for her daughter’s university fees. 

File is a 51-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 14 and 21. 

She has raised livestock i for some time because it is profitable. File has a mini-farm with 15 goats and two dairy cows.  She also owns land and plants seasonal vegetables  for her family’s use. 

Her husband is  disabled and receives a disability income. Her oldest child, a son, works in a nearby restaurant.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rabiu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. 

Rabiu will use  this loan to store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Rabiu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farm and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to store her maize.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe FAIDA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame ABY assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes FAIDA, fait la vente des  friperies . 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 balles de friperie au grand marché  d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientéle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The four members of the FAIDA group are married women with an average age of 38 years and who have on average five children. They live for the most part in traditional families in HAMDALLAYE, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They are on their eighth group loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Mrs. ABY, seated second from the left in the photo of this group of women, FAIDA, sells secondhand clothes. They plans to buy with this loan two packages of secondhand clothing at the grand market, where she is highly sought after for the quality of her products, to sell them at retail at the market to a clientele made up of men and women for cash or credit. She foresees earning a monthly average profit of 30,000 FCFA, of which a part will be used to repay the loan with interest and another part to save.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes

loans.name: Savrukhon

texts.ru:
Саврухон доброжелательная скромная женщина, проживающая в одном из древних городов Таджикистана, в городе Исфара. Она снова обратилась за кредитом для развития своей деятельности. Предыдущий кредит Саврухон брала в 2012 году для купли школьных принадлежностей, который был успешно профинансирован кредиторами Kiva. Пользуясь случаем она хочет поблагодарить всех за оказанную поддержку. С историей ее кредита можно ознакомиться перейдя по ссылке http://www.kiva.org/lend/456928. 
Саврухон сейчас ведет свою торговую деятельность при поддержке мужа, который вышел на пенсию. В их лавке клиенты всегда могут приобрести свежие газеты, журналы, сканворды и офисные принадлежности. В данный момент Саврухон необходимо увеличить ассортимент товара в ее лавке для большего привлечения клиентов. Она берет повторный кредит, чтобы приобрести канцелярские товары. Саврухон и в этот раз надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Savruhon is a friendly, modest woman who lives in one of the ancient cities of Tajikistan, Isfara. She is asking for a second business loan. Previously, Savruhon took out a loan in 2012 to buy school supplies. This loan was successfully financed by Kiva lenders. She would like to take this opportunity to thank everyone for their support. Her loan history can be found by clicking on the link http://www.kiva.org/lend/456928.

Savruhon now runs her business with her husband's (who is retired) help. In their shop, customers can buy newspapers, magazines, crossword puzzles and office supplies. Currently Savruhon feels it is necessary to increase the variety of goods she offers in her shop to attract more customers. She is taking a second loan to buy stationery. Savruhon is hoping for your help.

loans.use: buy goods.

loans.name: Linus

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 29ans,Linus est mariée et a 01 enfant de 02ans en charge. Il revend des portes chemise et des chapeau de façon ambulante. Il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit lui permettra d'élargir son activité et impliquer les membres de la famille dans l'activité.
texts.en: A young 29-year-old man, Linus is married and has a 2-year-old child in his care. He sells garment bags and hats door to door. He is seeking a first loan to buy merchandise. The profit will allow him to grow his business and to involve family members in his business.

loans.use: to buy hats and garment bags

loans.name: Badengnadjourou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BADENGNADJOUROU  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles au QUARTIER BABEMBA un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  AMINATA  assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  BADENGNADJOUROU , fait la vente des chaussures. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt des quantités importantes de  chaussure au grand marché  d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientéle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the BADENGNADJOUROU group are married women who are, on average, 32 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Babemba, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).
