Eager to meet the needs of their customers, they are taking their 12th solidarity loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

Aminata, seated second from the left in the photo, sells shoes.  She is planning to use her loan to buy a large quantity of shoes at the Grand Market.  Thanks to the high-quality of her merchandise, she receives a high demand from her customers.  She resells her goods on a retail basis, at the market, to both men and women.  She gets paid in cash and on credit.  She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 17,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest rate, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Yanet Patricia

texts.es:
Yanet Patricia tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Yanet Patricia se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes en gerenal(arroz, azúcar, café, ect) en su bodega, en el cual esta ubicada en su domicilio. El presente crédito será utlizado para la compra de una cantidad mayor de mercaderia(arroz, azúcar, café, ect) para asi aumentar sus ventas. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yanet Patricia is 30 years old and lives with her spouse and their children in their own home in the district of Zaña, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, northern coast of Peru. Her community basically makes a living from agriculture, raising cattle and trade.

Yanet Patricia makes a living from the business of selling general groceries (rice, sugar, coffee, etc.) from her shop which is located in her home. The current loan will be utilized to buy wholesale merchandise (rice, sugar, coffee, etc.) to increase her sales in that way. This will allow her to improve her income and increase her earnings in the short term and in the end, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Tashhon

texts.ru: Ташхон, 61 год, вдова, мама 2 взрослых детей, есть внучка. Образование у Ташхон - среднее. Она начала заниматься сельским хозяйством в 2009 году. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет: 2 коровы, 10 коз. Также Ташхон выращивает пшеницу и кукурузу для реализации. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Это катастрофически маленькие доходы и их не хватает на содержание семьи. Поэтому Ташхон в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства, что позволит Ташхон увеличить доходы ее семьи.
texts.en: Tashhon is 61 years old, a widow, and the mother of two adult children. She also has a granddaughter. Tashhon has a middle-school education. She started farming in 2009. At present, the farm has two cows and ten goats. Tashhon also grows wheat and corn for sale. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. This is a catastrophically small income and are not enough to support a family. Therefore Tashhon, in order to further develop her farm, approached the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy a cow. She plans to invest profits from the loan into expanding the farm, which will increase income for Tashhon and her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock and increase her income.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta de estado civil soltera, reside en el distrito de Morropón junto a su familia, natural de la zona. La comunidad donde vive es un lugar en donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Y está ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que se dedica Violeta es a la elaboración y venta de pan, cuenta con clientes estables y 04 chicos a su cargo quienes le reparten el pan en todo Moropón; Violeta realiza su actividad dos veces al día por la mañana y tarde además de la venta de dulces; ella cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. Conocida en la zona con muy buenas referencias personales y crediticias. Violeta solicita del crédito para comprar la materia prima de producción del pan(harina) en mayores cantidades dado que su demanda ha crecido notablemente y ella desea cubrila por completo, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Violeta is single and lives in the Morropon district with her family.   The local population are merchants, farmers, and raise livestock.  There are basic services such as running water and electricity and it’s located in the Morropon province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Violeta makes and sells bread and has steady customers and 4 deliverymen who deliver around town.  She works once in the morning and again in the evenings.  She also sells candy and has 10 years experience.  She is known in the area and has good personal and professional references.

Violeta is asking for this loan to buy supplies (flour) in quantity because her demand has increased notably and she wants to be able to meet it.  This will allow her to increase her sales and earnings in the short term and eventually her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy white damask to dye

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 fattening pigs and feed concentrate to raise them

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial es un joven que proviene de la ciudad de Apurimac, situado en la sierra meridional del país, en la vertiente oriental de la Cordillera de los Andes. Él junto a sus padres y 7 hermanos vinieron a Lima en busca de un mejor futuro para toda su familia. Sus padres se dedican a la agricultura, y debido a ello sus ingresos son mínimos, lo que no les permite solventar sus gastos de estudios.

Él para poder ayudar un poco a sus padres, empezó a trabajar desde los 14 años como repartidor de gaseosas, pero debido a sus estudios ya no puede continuar laborando, es por eso que está solicitando el apoyo de KIVA para no dejar de estudiar, ya que actualmente está atravesando una difícil situación económica.

Lamentablemente tuvo un período en el cual no pudo estudiar debido a que no contaba con el dinero suficiente para poder matricularse. Él actualmente está cursando el Tercer Ciclo de la Carrera de Electrónica Industrial, la cual le interesa mucho porque le permitirá establecerse mejor económicamente para poder así apoyar a sus padres con la educación de sus hermanos menores.

Él está muy agradecido con el apoyo que brinda KIVA ya que les permite continuar con sus estudios y llegar así a cumplir con todas sus metas trazadas, como la de ser un excelente profesional y trabajar en una empresa muy importante, o mejor aún, tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Marcial is a young man who comes from Apurimac, a city located in the country's southern mountains on the western slope of the Andes mountain range.  Together with his parents and seven siblings, Marcial came to Lima in search of a better future for his whole family.  His parents make their livings in agriculture and, as such, their income in minimal.  It is not enough to cover the cost of Marcial's education. 

To help his parents a bit, Marcial started working as a carbonated beverage delivery man when he was fourteen years old.  But because he was going to school, he couldn't keep working.  That is why Marcial is requesting a loan from KIVA, so that he doesn't have to stop going to school.  He is currently going through a difficult financial time.  

Unfortunately, there was a time when Marcial couldn't go to school, as he didn't have enough money to register.  He is currently in the third term of his  Industrial Electronics degree.  The degree is very interesting to him because it will allow him to establish himself better financially and to be able to help his parents with his younger siblings' educations. 

Marcial is very grateful for the help that KIVA is offering.  It will allow him to continue going to school and to complete all his coursework and goals, like that of becoming an excellent professional and working for a very important company, or better yet, having his own company.

loans.use: to continue with his degree in Industrial Electronics and one day be an excellent professional.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a private teacher and has worked in this occupation for the past five years. She is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one sibling. 

Currently, Imane wishes to acquire a new laptop. To do so, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She notes that the laptop will definitely ease her work preparations as well as her research and knowledge development. At this moment in time, Imane does her best to become a good and skilled teacher so she can get hired by a reputable school in the days to come.

loans.use: acquire a new laptop

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a maize farmer from Tafida village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aliyu would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Aliyu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Delia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell for her gasoline retailing business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Bitrus Lado

texts.en: Bitrus Lado is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mathew, Saminu and Tina. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bitrus Lado would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to take care of his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus Lado can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Bitrus Lado spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to access a loan that covers expenses like his children's school fees and clothing, which will eliminate pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: D. Yohana

texts.en: D. Yohana is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, D. Yohana would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to take care of his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, D. Yohana can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. D. Yohana, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to access a loan that covers expenses for food and clothing, which will eliminate pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 46 years old and married with five children.

Eva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Eva has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Eva aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya is a maize farmer from Jaki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to take care of his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ishaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to access a loan that covers expenses for food and clothing, which will eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic supplies for his cacao crops.

loans.name: Sandra De La Paz

texts.es:
Sandra de 30 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 7 años de edad, solo el mayor estudia. Ella estudio hasta bachillerato,  su esposo trabaja como chofer de camión, transportando materiales. Con Sandra vive también su mamá, pero solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

Sandra es empleada, trabaja en la alcaldía de su comunidad, también tiene un negocio de vena de ropa de manera ambulante en sus tiempos libres después de salir de su trabajo. El préstamo será utilizado para reparar el techo de su casa, comprará 500 tejas, madera y pagara la mano de obra que va a necesitar.

Sandra espera tener algún día un bazar en el que venda ropa de todos los estilos y tamañas, ayudar a sus hijos que terminen sus estudios y conseguir un mejor empleo.
texts.en:
30-year-old Sandra has a partner and two children, aged one and seven. Only the eldest is studying. Sandra studied up until the end of high school. Her husband works as a truck driver, transporting materials. Sandra’s mother also lives with her, but only her children are dependent on her.

Sandra is employed. She works at the mayor’s office in her community, and she also has a business selling clothes from door to door; she does this in her free time after leaving work. The loan will be used to repair the roof of her house. She will buy wood and 500 tiles, and pay the workers she will need.

Sandra hopes to have a large retail store one day where she can sell clothes of all sizes and styles. She also hopes to help her children to finish their studies and to find a better job.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house. She will buy wood and 500 tiles, and pay the workers she is going to need

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rasing pigs.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her vegetable vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.en:
LUZ DIVINA - Divine Light

Chichicastenango is one of the most beautiful municipalities in Guatemala. Located in the eastern part of the country, the town is known for its great historical and cultural importance. The textiles and handicrafts from this place move the economy and attract thousands of tourists. 

In a neighboring town of Chichicastenango, eleven women with intentions of self-improvement have come together to form the Trust Bank called “Luz Divina,” or “Divine Light.” They wish to improve their quality of life through credit and education, which are services that Friendship Bridge provides in order to empower Guatemalan women so that they can find their own solutions to their problems. 

Juana is one of the members. She is 35 years old and studied formally for six years in school. Currently she is single and lives with her parents and two brothers. Juana is very happy to find a group that allows her to share her lived experiences while also learn from her fellow members. Informal education and talks that the women receive monthly with their credit agent, inform them of new hygienic and health practices, strategies to improve their sales, and how to increase their self-esteem. In addition to her work in the elaboration of typical Mayan blouses called güipiles, Juana also plans to begin a new business raising bulls. Therefore, she is asking for a new loan that she will use to buy additional thread for her textiles and acquire a calf. 

Like Juana, all of the businesswomen in the group appreciate the assistance of the Kiva investors in helping the women find a “light” that allows the women to improve their own lives as well as those of their families. Thank you Kiva for contributing to a very important process!

loans.use: to purchase thread and other materials to make textile handicrafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an expanded offering of jewelry at his kiosk

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Chisac Group

texts.en:
MUJERES UNIDAS CHISAC - United Women from CHISAC

San Cristobal Totonicapan is part of the Guatemalan highlands, and made up of hardworking families. Ten women, who are currently beginning their second cycle of loans from Kiva, formed the Trust Bank named “Mujeres Unidas Chisac,” or “United Women from Chisac.” 

One of the members of the group is Mrs. Santos. This 40 year-old motivated businesswoman is married to a bricklayer, with whom she has seven children between the ages of 18 months and 18 years. Santos has sold chicken for a while but demand has increased and she recognizes the necessity of access to credit. In addition, Santos and her family are weavers. They receive requests from textile vendors, especially during this time of year as new year parties approach. Therefore, Santos is requesting a new loan with which she plans to increase her inventory of chicken, as well as buy a new sewing machine. Santos is excited to generate more income through her businesses in order to continue providing better nutrition and education for her children. 

The hope of the women of the Trust Bank “United Women from Chisac” is to provide a better future for their children, giving them the opportunity to develop intellectually in local schools. In order to do this, the women must work hard to be able to afford the costs associated with education. 

The women are truly grateful for receiving a new loan that will benefit themselves as well as their families.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of chicken, as well as buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose and his wife came to the U.S. from Venezuela in 2012. Once in the U.S., he saw a business opportunity. He says, “I have more than 15 years of experience bringing North American products to Venezuela for established businesses there,” and he decided to start a company to export North American goods to Venezuela, Colombia, and Panama. 

Currently, the business supports Jose, his wife and daughter, and employs five people. Like many business owners, Jose says, “One of my greatest successes as a business owner in the U.S. has been to see my company grow by leaps and bounds every day. I feel lucky to have professionals such as those at Accion to reach out to support our ongoing growth.” And, just like many small businesses, building credit has been difficult. Jose knows it “is necessary to sustainably expand the business and support our global growth.”

Jose will use this loan to increase publicity efforts. Specifically, he wants to feature his business in newspapers with large circulations and develop flyers and local banners. Jose sees continued expansion in his future: “I hope in the future to expand my company to Brazil, Argentina, and Costa Rica, and then on to all of the countries that we can possibly build a contract with to export our products.” 

On a personal level, Jose says, “I would like to continue to support my family, and servicing the United States which has given me all its great opportunities.”

loans.use: to pay for increased publicity of his export business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase party supplies, linens, and stands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising of her natural parenting store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 58 years old. She has been married to Pascual for more than 40 years. She works selling different products such as beauty supplies, perfume and underwear. She sells from her house and has many recurring clients. Her biggest accomplishment is earning money to cover her expenses and also helping her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy more products and increase her sales during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and beauty products for catalog sales.

loans.name: Shayirgul

texts.ru: Шайиргул 48 лет, в разводе, мать 2 детей. У Шайиргул среднее образование, она работает в сельской управе, получает ежемесячную заработную плату в размере 7,800 сом (KGS). Также с 2001 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, также на арендованном земельном наделе мерою 1,0 Га, Шайиргул выращивает рис. Ее ежемесячная совокупная прибыль от бизнеса составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Шайиргул решила утеплить дом, поставив пластиковые двери. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку пластиковых окон, так как они не пропускают холод, Шайиргул сможет утеплить дом и обезопасить своих детей.
texts.en: Shayirgul is 48 years old, divorced and a mother of 2 children. Shayirgul has a secondary education and works at the village council, earning a monthly salary of 7,800 som (KGS). Also, she has been involved in agriculture since 2001 to provide additional income. She has 4 cows, 10 sheep and also grows rice on 1.0 hectare of leased land. Her monthly combined business profit amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). Shayirgul decided to insulate her house by installing plastic doors. This is why she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy plastic windows because they do not let the cold in. Shayirgul will be able to insulate her house and provide safety for her children.

loans.use: to purchase energy efficient plastic windows in order to be more secure and conserve energy

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Felomina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Felomina is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her fishing business.

Felomina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to develop his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To change the lock on the door of her house and reinforce the walls for greater security.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs, hens, rice flour, cinnamon, cheese, cottage cheese, etc.

loans.name: Gulyai

texts.ru: Гуляй, 45 лет, в разводе, 2 детей, старший сын учится в университете, младший- школьник. У Гуляй высшее образование, она инженер, работает по специальности. Ежемесячная заработная плата  Гуляй - около 18,000 сом (KGS). Гуляй перед наступлением холодов хочет утеплить свой дом. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 новых энергосберегающих пластиковых окон, также перестелить линолеум. Данные мероприятия помогут Гуляй утеплить ее дом и обезопасить детей, позаботившись об их здоровье.
texts.en: Gulyai is 45 years old, divorced and has 2 children. Her oldest son attends a university and the youngest is a school student. Gulyai has a higher education, is an engineer and works in her field.  Gulyai's monthly salary is about 18,000 som (KGS). Prior to the onset of the cold weather, Gulyai wants to insulate her house. This is why she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy new energy-efficient plastic windows and also to replace linoleum. These projects will help Gulyai to insulate her house and provide safety for children by caring for their health.

loans.use: to purchase linoleum and four energy efficient plastic windows in order for her family to be more secure and conserve energy

loans.name: Ramos

texts.es:
Ramos tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres, en casa familiar, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Ramos se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como patos y gallinas, desde hace más de 5 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento para sus animales y ampliar sus corrales, de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramos, 41, is single and lives with her parents in the family home in a large community in an urban area of Cayaltí.  She has good personal and work references from her neighbors.  Her community is dedicated basically to agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  It is located in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Ramos raises and sells animals such as ducks and hens.  For over five years she has been in the business working from home.  The loan she is requesting is to buy animal feed and to expand her barnyard to grow her business.  This will allow her, in the short term, to improve her income, increase profits and, therefore, give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and expand the barnyard to increase business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy household furnishings for her daughter's well-being.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Rosalia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, cuyes, cerdos, etc), desde hace 05 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Rosalia solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea realizar la compra de patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes, entre otros. Esto le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
39-year old Rosalia lives with her partner and doesn't have any children in her care. She lives in the family home in the rural district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. Her community is involved in agriculture, animal-raising, and business.

Rosalia has earned her living raising and selling poultry, guinea pigs, pigs etc. in her home for five years. The corral is located at the back of her house. She is seeking a loan to buy ducks, chickens, turkeys, guinea pigs etc. These purchases will enable her to have a wider range of animals so she can grow her business and satisfy her customers' needs. In the short term this will lead to greater earnings enabling her to improve her own and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy ducks, chickens, turkeys, guinea pigs etc. so she has a wider range of animals for sale

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.ru: Татьяна, 33 года, не замужем, детей нет. У Татьяны средне-специальное образование, она работает санитаркой в поликлинике. Татьяна живет с мамой - пенсионного возраста. Заработная плата Татьяны составляет около 6,500 сом (KGS). Ей необходимо сделать сантехнический ремонт в ее доме и купить мебель. Поэтому Татьяна обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка труб, кранов и мебели. Доходы от заработной платы она будет и дальше вкладывать в улучшение условий проживания ее и мамы.
texts.en: Tatiana is 33 years old, not married and has no children. Tatiana has a secondary-specialized education and works as an orderly at a hospital. Tatiana lives with her retired mother. Tatiana salary amounts to about 6,500 som (KGS). She has to make plumbing repairs in her house and purchase furniture. This is why Tatiana requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank, the goal of which is to buy pipes, faucets and furniture. She will continue investing her earnings into improving her and her mother's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pipes, faucets and furniture in order to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Zhanylkan

texts.ru: Жанылкан 54 года, вдова, мать 2 детей. У Жанылкан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже 18 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Жанылкан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 1 дойная корова и 1 лошадь. На ежедневной основе она реализует молоко. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,60 ГА, где Жанылкан выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Жанылкан и ее семьи составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Жанылкан и ее близких, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки 1 лошади. Жанылкан намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что позволит ей накопить средства на развитие доходов ее семьи.
texts.en: Zhanylkan is 54 years old, a widow and a mother of 2 children. Zhanylkan has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 18 years. Thanks to Zhanylkan's persistence, drive and hard work, today she has 1 dairy cow and 1 horse. She sells milk on a daily basis. She also has 0.60 hectares of land, where Zhanylkan grows potatoes. Zhanylkan's and her family's combined monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). This money is not enough for a decent life for Zhanylkan and her family, and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 1 horse. Zhanylkan intends to increase her livestock headcount, which will allow her to save money for expanding her family's income.

loans.use: to buy 1 horse in order to invest in her business and grow her income

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his three children. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yohanna  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for expenses like his children's school fees and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices soon after harvest.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other member of her family. Lucy lives in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees. 

Lucy has been operating a retail shop for the past seven years, working six days a week. She does not have another source of income. Her challenges include seasonality and fluctuating prices

Lucy joined MCDT-SACCO due to the relatively low interest charged on loans and the successful members of her community who have taken out loans from MCDT-SACCO. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more food spices, rice, sugar, cooking fat and flour to sell. Her dream is to own a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more food spices, rice, sugar, cooking fat and flour to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself as honest. Mary operates a farm where she has been growing crops for seven years. Her business is located in a fertile place and her primary customers are over a large scale. 

This is Mary's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. Mary will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large farm within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una mujer de 47 años de edad, divorciada y madre de dos jóvenes, cuenta con trayectoria en Fundación Mujer, ha solicitado 8 créditos en el transcurso de crecimiento en la actividad productiva, los cuales le han permitido adquirir equipo suficiente para la correcta atención de las clientas que lleguen hasta su salón.
La micro empresa cuenta con el equipo suficiente para desempeñarse en sus labores, la visitan diversas clientas, la mayoría asalariadas de las empresas que se encuentran al rededor. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertir en el pago de 250 000 colones para un proveedor e invertir en compra de más productos para que sus clientas los puedan adquirir ya que en muchas ocasiones son productos que se necesitan para continuar el tratamiento adecuado.
El salón Piccola se encuentra funcionando correctamente ya que lo tiene de manera legal con patente y tributación. Además tiene un buen punto de ubicación ya que es una calle muy transitada y a sus alrededores existen diversas empresas como Coopenae, Ministerio de Justicia, Seguros del Magisterio y la Clínica Bíblica, prefieren el  salón de doña Rosa porque aparte de ser barato, brinda un buen servicio. Doña Rosa sueña con brindar empleo a una de sus hijas y continuar brindando un servicio de calidad a su clientela.
texts.en:
47-year old Sra. Rosa is divorced and has two children. She has a history with Fundación Mujer as she has had eight loans with them as her business has grown. The loans have enabled her to buy equipment suitable for the needs of the clients who come to her salon. A wide range of clients come to her small business, most of them well-paid people from nearby businesses.

Rosa is now seeking a loan of 250,000 colones to buy more products from a dealer so her clients can have the products they need to continue their treatments. Her salon Piccola is registered legally and pays taxes. It has a good location in a busy street with nearby businesses such as Coopenae, the Ministry of Justice, Insurance Faculty, and the Bible Clinic. People choose her salon because it is inexpensive and provides a good service.

Rosa's dreams include being able to provide one of her daughters with a job and continuing to offer quality service to her clients.

loans.use: Buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Guillermo Eliceo

texts.en:
Guillermo Eliceo, aged 50, is married and has two daughters who are married and independent. He lives in his mother's house and has been working in retail for the past 15 years. Guillermo Eliceo had an accident so he started with a small candy stall and, little by little, he invested in other products. He now has a small grocery store. 

Guillermo Eliceo is requesting a loan so he can buy products to restock his grocery store for the end-of-year retail season. He describes himself as credit-worthy as he likes to pay on time. His biggest accomplishment is supporting his daughters.

loans.use: To buy products for the end-of-year retail season.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, aged 31, is a married woman with two children in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has a business in the Philippines where she sells vegetables. Gina has been in this business for two years.

Gina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can  afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Vivencia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell root crops business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine. Vivencia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stocks of root crops to sell.

Vivencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Victoria Alicia

texts.en:
Victoria Alicia, aged 28, is married and has two sons. She lives in her father-in-law's house. Victoria Alicia owns a grocery store and works from Monday to Sunday: during the weekend, her husband helps her.  

Victoria Alicia is requesting a loan to buy products in bulk at a lower price: she says that this will help her to increase her profits. Her biggest accomplishment is helping her husband to support the family economy. Victoria Alicia's goal is to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products in bulk at a lower price.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 and lives in Molave Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is separated with 2 school-age children. 

She has 1 photocopying machine in her house that caters for those who want to reproduce their documents. She has had this business for 2 years now. 

She has requested a loan to buy a second photocopying machine to earn more for her children's future. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Maricel hopes that she can support the financial needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy a second photocopying machine

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 62 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 4 adult-age children. 

He has a store that is managed by his wife while he manages their rice production. 

He has requested a loan to restock his store with coffee, noodles, shampoo and canned goods to sell. He has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. 

In the future, Edgar wants to have a business site in the city.

loans.use: to restock his store with coffee, noodles, shampoo and canned goods

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 63 years old and married with nine children.

Corazon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Corazon aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 57 years old with three children, and two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Clarita has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her business. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is 37 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with three school-age children. He has a shop that sells sacks of rice from his farm and his neighbor's harvest. He requested a loan to purchase additional materials like paint, sliding glass windows and chairs for his house to make his house good looking and decent for his family. He has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Juvy hopes that his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like paint, sliding glass windows and chairs for his house

loans.name: Gelaina

texts.en: Gelaina lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 27 years old and married with two school-age children. She has a sari-sari store business that caters to the family's needs and sustains their income. With the high demands of her customers, she borrowed money from PMPC in the amount of PHP 40,000 for the purpose of buying sari-sari commodities and for repairing her house. With the help and aid of the cooperative, she is so blessed.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, candies, chocolate and canned goods to supply the demands of the customers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old and married with nine children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Lourdes has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and she also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Lourdes aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for computers, office supplies, and additional office equipment

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 42 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is single and the breadwinner of their family. She bakes different flavors of cakes and has had this business for 26 years. She requested a loan to purchase ingredients such as eggs, flour, bananas, chocolate, ube and butter to make more cakes to fulfill the orders of her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes that she can find her partner in life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as eggs, flour, bananas, chocolate, ube (purple yams)  and butter

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda is 46 years old and she lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 8 adult aged children. She has a farm that sells different kinds of fruits, like mangosteen, mangoes, etc. At the same time, she also manages her rice field with her husband. She has had this business for 40 years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.  She has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Daylinda wants to purchase a hauling truck for delivery.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des céréales. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus des céréales à KPALIME lieu où elle s'approvisionne également. Elle souhaite à l'avenir avoir un meilleur rendement et avoir une famille en paix et heureuse. Ama a 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés.
texts.en: Ama is requesting a first loan to buy cereals. She has an income-generating activity selling cereals in Kpalimé, where she also gets her supplies. In the future she would like to make more profit and see her family live in peace and happiness. Ama has four children, three of whom are at school.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is 50 years old and she lives in Tambulig, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with five adult aged children. She has a shop that buys and sells wood. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to buy wood to sell for building materials at very affordable prices. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Elisa wants to help more Filipino people build their homes.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell for building materials.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a widow and resident of Pines, Oroquieta City. She earns a living through raising pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for five years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase four piglets, bags of feed, and animal vitamins. Lolita deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets, bags of feed, and animal vitamins for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 50 years old and married with six children.

Lita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Lita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

Lita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Faatafunaina

texts.en: Faatafunaina is 62 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for eight years. Faatafunaina needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a sprayer, crops, a new wheelbarrow, a machete and boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Faatafunaina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a sprayer, crops, a new wheelbarrow, a machete and boots

loans.name: Taimoe

texts.en: Taimoe is a 44-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells Samoan taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has 10 years of experience with this business. Taimoe needs a loan to buy a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, seasoning, salt, plastic bags, labels and a new plastic sealer. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Taimoe has been a member of SPBD since 2004.

loans.use: to buy a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, seasoning, salt, plastic bags, labels and a new plastic sealer

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is 59 years old and she lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is separated with 2 children. She has a sewing machine that caters those who wants to make costumes, as well as school and office uniforms. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan to buy new materials for her sewing services to serve more customers and earn money to perform her obligations. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Concepcion hopes to have a new sewing machine unit.

loans.use: to buy new materials for her sewing services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy "pagnes wax réal" (highly decorative and colorful African fabric).

loans.name: Level

texts.en: Level is 23 years old and single with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Level needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a machete, a spade, a crowbar, crops and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Level will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a machete, a spade, a crowbar, crops and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her 40,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Ma. Liza operates her own bakery and she desires to expand soon. She dreams that her children have a good life in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a parent of six children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Alma is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business for her fishing business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn is 33 years old and single.

Sherlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

Sherlyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Sherlyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Saiauta

texts.en: Saiauta is a 22 year old single woman with two children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Saiauta needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, a cooler, cordials, bags of sugar, foam cups, Chinese candy and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's well being and help with the expansion of her family's house. Saiauta has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, a cooler, cordials, bags of sugar, foam cups, Chinese candy and rubber gloves

loans.name: Talaitupu

texts.en: Talaitupu is 26 years old and married with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Talaitupu needs a loan to buy new gum boots, chemicals, overalls, a machete, a sprayer, fertilizer and a new crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Talaitupu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new gum boots, chemicals, overalls, a machete, a sprayer, fertilizer and a new crowbar

loans.name: Wend Baraka Group

texts.fr: Binanaté, emprunteur représentatif est mariée, mère de 7 enfants dont 2 continuent à aller à l'école et 3 autres qui sont majeurs travaillent déjà. Elle vend des céréales( maïs, haricot, mil,...). Binanaté voudrait avec ce prêt acheter des sacs d'haricot, de maïs et de mil pour vendre. Wend Baraka regroupe des femmes battantes qui travaillent bien et font des remboursement correctes sans problème. Binanaté en plus de la vente des céréales vend du bois de chauffe chez elle à la maison. Avec le bénéfice de ses ventes, elle aimerait continuer ses activités et aider son époux dans la gestion de leur famille
texts.en: Binanaté, who is the representative borrower of this group, is married and mother to seven children, two of whom are still at school and three of whom are already adults and working. She sells cereals (corn, beans, millet,..). Binanaté would like to use this loan to buy sacks of beans, corn and millet to sell on. Wend Baraka is a group of fighting women who work hard and make all their repayments in full and on time. As well as selling cereals, Binanaté also sells firewood from her home. With the profits she makes from her sales, she would like to be able to continue her businesses and help her husband to look after their family.

loans.use: to buy cereals (beans, corn) to sell.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn makes a living through her retailing business. She and her husband run a lumberyard in Ozamiz City and earn a promising income to support their family.  Rosalyn has signed up to become a member of PMPC to gain access to insurance and financial assistance. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed a loan to purchase more lumber to sell. Rosalyn hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 61 years old and she lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 3 adult aged children. She has been doing her farming activity for 29 years and she is proud that her children finished their studies by this business activity. She requested a loan to pay for labor and seedbed preparation for the next cropping season. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Anita wants to repair her house and buy a jeep.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Poto

texts.en: Poto is a 78 year old widow with four children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years. Poto needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Poto will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 46 years old and she lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with with one school-aged son. She has a store that sells rice, junk food, etc. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan to restock her store with variety of goods to earn more money for the future of her son. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Carolina hopes to sustain the financial needs of her son despite being a single mother.

loans.use: to restock her store with a variety of goods.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Condiments, habillement, les objets de parure, éponges, encens. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur vingtième prêt de groupe.
Setou est un membre du groupe Sabougnouma, assise au bout à gauche, elle est vendeuse d’habits, d’éponges, d’encens et des parures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habits, éponges pour la propreté, encens et parures   en quantité et en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabougnouma comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 190000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Setou compte réaliser  200 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala. They know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 42 years of age and have at least four children each. This group of women have small businesses selling condiments, clothing, linen, sponges and incense. The members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program so they could expand their businesses and they are on their 20th group loan.

Setou is a member of the Sabougnouma group and sitting on the far left of the photo. She sells clothing, sponges, incense and sets of linen. She is planning to use her loan to buy clothing, sponges, incense and linen sets, in sufficient quantities and quality as she needs to sell them on a retail basis to a diverse customer base. She gets her supplies at the market.

While the other members of the Sabougnouma group expect to make an average profit of 190,000FCFA each during this cycle, Setou expects to make 200,000FCFA. 

As well as repaying their loans, they use part of their income to cover personal expenses and expand their businesses. They would like to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they do not run out of stock.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is 42 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City with her husband and eight kids. Annabelle takes care of a fish pond from which she earns added income for the family. She has been doing this type of activity for three years. Recently, she has signed up as a member of PMPC and requested a loan to buy fish feed and additional fingerlings for her fish pond for sale and consumption. In the future, she has planned to expand and improve her fish pond into a business enterprise.

loans.use: to buy fish feed and additional fingerlings for her fish pond for sale and consumption

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Dolly, 23 years old, is married. She lives with her husband and two kids in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. In order to survive, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store. It began with displaying a few inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar, and various shampoo and soap. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari store in January of 2014. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received her 2nd loan. Now, she is applying for 7,000 PHP to pay for additional merchandise for her store to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise for her store to draw more customers to buy in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Souroukoukin de la Commune de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, poissons frits, condiments, patate, boisson et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.
Fatoumata est un membre du groupe Djekafo, assise au milieu, elle est vendeuse de poisson cuit. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de poissons, huiles, charbons de bois et condiments en qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle prépare 
les poissons  pour les vendre en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koury. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000CFA chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Fatoumata compte réaliser  170 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of women from the Souroukoukin district of the municipality of Koury. They know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 33 years of age and have at least four children each. This group of women have small businesses selling fried fish, condiments, potatoes, drinks and other products. The members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program so they could expand their businesses and they are on their second group loan.

Fatoumata is a member of the Djekafo group and sitting in the middle of the photo. She sells cooked fish and is planning to use her loan to buy fish, oil, charcoal and condiments in sufficient quantities and quality as she needs to prepare her fish for sale on a retail basis to a diverse customer base. She gets her supplies in Koury.

While the other members of the Djekafo group expect to make an average profit of 150,000FCFA each during this cycle, Fatoumata expects to make 170,000FCFA. 

As well as repaying their loans, they use part of their income to cover personal expenses and expand their businesses. They would like to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they do not run out of stock.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 59 years old and she lives in Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with three adult-aged children. She has a restaurant that sells delicious food and she has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase additional kitchen utensils and to renovate her restaurant to accommodate all her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Alicia wants buy and build a boarding house in the city to earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase additional kitchen utensils and to renovate her restaurant.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 22 years old and single. She lives in Silanga, Tangub City. Rosemarie has a fish vending business and owns a fish pond. She has earned approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of activity for the last two years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials, additional fingerlings, and equipment for her fish pond. Rosemarie recently became an active member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, additional fingerlings, and equipment for her fish pond

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
This is Desiree, 45, a resident of Busuanga, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to David and they have a child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Desiree operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, pants, and undergarments. She will also purchase footwear items to expand her product inventory.

Desiree hopes that her business will get bigger. She dreams of giving her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy RTW products and merchandise items needed to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Vaiopua'a

texts.en: Vaiopua'a is 53 years old and married with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for nine years. Vaiopua'a needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, crops, a new wheelbarrow, a machete and sprayers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Vaiopua'a will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, crops, a new wheelbarrow, a machete and sprayers.

loans.name: Suega

texts.en: Suega is 53 years old and married with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for seven years. Suega needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, sprayers, a new crowbar, crops and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007.  Suega will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, sprayers, a new crowbar, crops and a machete.

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en: Meleseke is 36 years old and unmarried with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 13 years. Meleseke needs a loan to buy crops, a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a spade, a machete and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2001. Meleseke will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a spade, a machete and chemicals.

loans.name: Kaha

texts.fr: Femme de 34ans, Kaha se bat chaque fois pour apporter le meilleur d'elle même à sa famille. Elle a pour conjoint un menuisier. En 2009, elle a commencé la vente des œufs frais à KPALIME et s'approvisionne à NOTSE. Manquant de fonds pour acheter plus de marchandises, Kaha demande un premier crédit à WAGES. Elle espère étendre son activité et mettre la famille à l'aise.
texts.en: 34-year-old Kaha fights to give her family everything they need. Her partner works as a carpenter. In 2009, she started selling fresh eggs in Kpalimé. She gets her supplies from Notse. Because she lacks the funds to purchase more stock, Kaha is requesting her first-ever loan from WAGES. She hopes to be able to grow her business and give her family a good life.

loans.use: to purchase eggs

loans.name: Egleseria

texts.en: Egleseria is from Silanga, Tangub City, Philippines. She is 59 years old, married and has one child. In order to sustain their family, Egleseria sells bleaching liquid in front of their house. Her product is salable since most of the women in the area are using bleaching liquid in their house, especially in their laundry. She has had this business for five years and it's doing well. She earns a small income to support her family in addition to the income of her husband. She requested a loan to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to increase sales and serve more customers. Egleseria has been a member of PMPC for two years. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of bleaching liquid to increase sales and serve more customers.

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en: Seutaatia is 59 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 10 years. Seutaatia needs a loan to buy a sack of rice, onions, a bag of sugar, flour, cooking oil, canned drinks, snacks and frozen goods. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2004 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, onions, a bag of sugar, flour, cooking oil, canned drinks, snacks and frozen goods.

loans.name: Cifriana

texts.en: Cifriana is 61 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with seven adult-aged children. She has a shop that sells flower arrangements for any occasion. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan to buy farming materials and pesticides for continuously providing services to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Cifriana wants to plant more flowers to sell.

loans.use: to buy farming materials and pesticides for her flower garden.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling native bags in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her native bag making business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native bag making business.
